column3: wait.until(ExpectedConditions.visibilityOf(element)); not compiling with Selenium 3.3.1
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 7 with Eclipse Mars Selenium Version:   3.3.1 Browser:   N/A  Since Firefox version 48, Mozilla requires all add-ons to be signed. Until recently, Firefox support in Selenium was exclusively provided by an add-on. As this add-on is not currently signed, this solution does not work with the latest Firefox releases. As an alternative, Mozilla are working on a WebDriver specification compliant implementation named GeckoDriver. Please note that the specification is not complete, and that Selenium itself does not comply with the specification at this time. This means that features previously available through Selenium will not be available using GeckoDriver.  Any issue logged here for Firefox 48 or later will be closed as a duplicate of #2559. Our recommendation is to switch to GeckoDriver, or to continue testing on Firefox 45 until GeckoDriver is a viable option for you. If you are interested in helping us to sign the add-on to restore support for later Firefox versions, please see the following comment for what's needed: https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/issues/2942#issuecomment-259717567  If the issue is with Google Chrome consider logging an issue with chromedriver instead: https://sites.google.com/a/chromium.org/chromedriver/help  If the issue is with Microsoft Edge consider logging an issue with Microsoft instead: https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/platform/issues/  If the issue is with Firefox GeckoDriver (aka Marionette) consider logging an issue with Mozilla: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/buglist.cgi?product=Testing&component=Marionette  If the issue is with Safari, only Safari 10+ is supported. Please log any Safari issue with Apple: https://bugreport.apple.com/  If the issue is with PhantomJS consider logging an issue with Ghostdriver: https://github.com/detro/ghostdriver  -->  Browser Version:     ## Expected Behavior -  ## Actual Behavior -  ## Steps to reproduce -

Execution is completed as reasonable time with available nodes. But, serenity report generation is taking additional 1 hour 30 minutes from the time of execution completed.  I am using serenity version 1.1.42. Please suggest me for this. ![screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17195094/21708561/1080f0bc-d400-11e6-87fc-bc821229a6a1.jpg)

column3: Delete all cookies is not deleting cookies permanently from browser.
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 7 Enterprise  Selenium Version:   2.53.1, IDE Browser:   Chrome, IE  Browser Version:   Chrome: 55.0.2883.87  IE: 11  ## Expected Behavior -  It should clear cookies and redirect to login page.  ## Actual Behavior -  It is clearing the cookies but when navigating to login page the cookies are restoring back.  The cookies are restoring even if i do page refresh after deleting cookies.    ## Steps to reproduce -  I am using Machine Specs (MSpec), ReSharper (test runner) and Selenium.  My idea is to run Selenium web driver instance only once during the whole test cycle which means web driver starts at the beginning of first test and stops at the end of last test. During each test I want to clear out my cookies so that I can come back to my login screen before performing next test.  So, I have a common method in MSpec that will be called before end of each test and in that method I am calling  IWebDriver.Manage().Cookies.DeleteAllCookies(); and next navigating to login screen but it is not working.  My login token will be stored in cookies after login so i want to clear/delete cookies.  The did the debug at IWebDriver.Manage().Cookies.DeleteAllCookies(); after that I checked the cookies in browser it shows 0 cookies, but when I am navigating to login screen again in browser it is showing cookies.   In order to double check, after executing IWebDriver.Manage().Cookies.DeleteAllCookies(); I did manual refresh with out navigating to login page still the cookies are coming back.

column3: IEDriver 3.2 doesn't work with file input dialog
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 7 64Bit Selenium Version:   ```  org.seleniumhq.selenium selenium-server 3.2.0  ``` Browser:   Internet Explorer 11  Browser Version:   11.0.9600.18015  ## Expected Behavior - SendKeys to a file input field opens the file dialog and sets the correct path and closes the file dialog.  ## Actual Behavior - With IEDriver 32Bit 3.2 no path is set and the dialog stays open. Switching to IEDriver 3.1 (now used because 3.2 doesnt work) or 2.48 (was used before updating to selenium 3) resolves the issue.  ## Steps to reproduce - Following codes shows the missbehavior (you need to adjust paths): ``` import org.openqa.selenium.By; import org.openqa.selenium.WebElement; import org.openqa.selenium.ie.InternetExplorerDriver;  public class TestFileUpload {  	public static void main(String[] args) { 		String driverPath_2_48 = "C:/work/temp/iedriver/2.48/IEDriverServer.exe"; 		String driverPath_3_1 = "C:/work/temp/iedriver/3.1/IEDriverServer.exe"; 		String driverPath_3_2 = "C:/work/temp/iedriver/3.2/IEDriverServer.exe"; 		System.setProperty("webdriver.ie.driver", driverPath_3_2); 		InternetExplorerDriver driver = new InternetExplorerDriver();  		driver.get("https://www.google.de/imghp");  		driver.findElement(By.id("qbi")).click(); 		driver.findElement(By.xpath("//a[text()='Bild hochladen']")).click();  		WebElement fileInput = driver.findElement(By.id("qbfile")); 		fileInput.sendKeys("C:\\work\\temp\\someImage.jpg");  		try { 			Thread.sleep(2500); 		} 		catch (InterruptedException e) { 			// ignore 		}  		driver.quit(); 	} } ```

column3: Proxy not working
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 7 64bit Selenium Version:   3.0.1 Browser:   Firefox & Chrome  Browser Version:   Firefox : 50.1.0 & Chrome : 55.0.2883.87 m  ## Expected Behavior - The website shows my proxy's IP adress  ## Actual Behavior - The website shows my own IP adress  ## Steps to reproduce - Code for Firefox ```   public static void ProxyUsingFirefoxDriver()     {     	System.setProperty("webdriver.gecko.driver", "C:\\geckodriver\\geckodriver.exe");         //Create a new Firefox profile         FirefoxProfile firefoxProfile = new FirefoxProfile();         //Then add the proxy setting to the Firefox profile we created         firefoxProfile.setPreference("network.proxy.http", "198.2.202.40");         firefoxProfile.setPreference("network.proxy.http_port", "8090");         //Then create a new Firefox Driver passing in the profile we created         //WebDriver we open a Firefox using this profile now         FirefoxDriver Driver = new FirefoxDriver(firefoxProfile);          //Navigate to a url and look at the traffic being logged in Fiddler.         Driver.navigate().to("https://whatismyipaddress.com/");     } ```  Code for Chrome ```     public static void ProxyUsingChromeDriver()     {         //Set the location of the ChromeDriver         System.setProperty("webdriver.chrome.driver", "C:\\geckodriver\\chromedriver.exe");         //Create a new desired capability         DesiredCapabilities capabilities = DesiredCapabilities.chrome();         // Create a new proxy object and set the proxy         Proxy proxy = new Proxy();         proxy.setHttpProxy("198.2.202.40:8090");         //Add the proxy to our capabilities          capabilities.setCapability("proxy", proxy);         //Start a new ChromeDriver using the capabilities object we created and added the proxy to         ChromeDriver Driver = new ChromeDriver(capabilities);          //Navigation to a url and a look at the traffic logged in fiddler         Driver.navigate().to("https://whatismyipaddress.com/");     } ```

column3: Selenium IDE 2.9.1: single web action is recorded as two same commands.
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 7 64-bit Selenium Version:   Selenium IDE 2.9.1 Browser:   Firefox Browser Version:   ESR 45.8.0 (64-bit)  ## Expected Behavior - A single web action should be recorded as a single selenium command via Selenium IDE docked version(Ctrl+Shift+s).  ## Actual Behavior - A single web action, like, `click`, `type` are recorded twice with Selenium IDE docked/embedded version. Here is a screenshot: ![s-ide-2-9-1-docked](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15373664/24089609/99c121ce-0d73-11e7-929d-11f157770dd4.jpg)   ## Steps to reproduce - 1. Open Firefox 2. Press combination key `Ctrl+Shift+s` to launch Selenium IDE 2.9.1 in docked/embedded version. 3. Click "Click to Record" to start a new recording. 4. Enter "http://www.bing.com" in browser URL. 5. Click Bing search box. 6. Type "hello" into the search box. 7. Click search button  Script generated as: ```       New Test     New Test   	open 	/ 	   	click 	id=sb_form_q 	   	type 	id=sb_form_q 	hello   	type 	id=sb_form_q 	hello   	click 	id=sb_form_go 	   	clickAndWait 	id=sb_form_go 	       ```

column3: http request times out when application is run as a service in windows
column4:
## Meta - OS:   Windows 7 Selenium Version:   3.3.0 Browser:   Firefox WebDriver: Gecko 0.15.0  Browser Version:   firefox 52.0.2  The issue below happens only when run as a windows service. There are no issues when the validator is run as a console application. column3: Unable to launch chrome browser using selenium 3.1.0
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 7 Selenium Version:   3.1.0 Browser:   Chrome  I used below code for 3.0.1, it was working:  **System.setProperty("webdriver.chrome.driver", "D:/chromedriver.exe"); 		DesiredCapabilities capabilities = new DesiredCapabilities(); 		capabilities.setCapability(CapabilityType.ACCEPT_SSL_CERTS, true); 		driver = new ChromeDriver(capabilities); 		System.out.println(driver);**  The code is not working on selenium version 3.1.0  Error: === Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkState(ZLjava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/Object;Ljava/lang/Object;Ljava/lang/Object;)V  Have any work around in this version?

column3: Selenium 3.0.1 with Firefox 51.0.1 and Gecko Driver
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 7 Selenium Version:   3.0.1 Browser:   Firefox  Browser Version:   51.0.1 (Portable)  ## Expected Behavior - Open browser and go to a specific page  ## Actual Behavior - Stuck on user profile page  ## Steps to reproduce - http://stackoverflow.com/q/42154400/4675568  I'm executing this code:   ``` public class Selenium {          public static void main(String[] args) {             WebDriver driver = createFFDriver();             driver.navigate().to("http:....");             System.out.println("Finished");         }          public static WebDriver createFFDriver(){             System.setProperty(GeckoDriverService.GECKO_DRIVER_EXE_PROPERTY,SELENIUM_DRIVERS + "\\firefox\\foo\\geckodriver.exe");             FirefoxProfile firefoxProfile = new FirefoxProfile();             File pathToBinary = new File(SELENIUM_INSTALLS_DEV + "\\51.0.1\\FirefoxPortable.exe");             FirefoxBinary ffBinary = new FirefoxBinary(pathToBinary);              return new FirefoxDriver(ffBinary,firefoxProfile);         } } ``` In logs, I've got this:   ``` 1486713046153   geckodriver INFO    Listening on 127.0.0.1:12466  Feb 10, 2017 8:50:46 AM org.openqa.selenium.remote.ProtocolHandshake createSession INFO: Attempting bi-dialect session, assuming Postel's Law holds true on the remote end 1486713046731   mozprofile::profile INFO    Using profile path foo\AppData\Local\Temp\rust_mozprofile.p25D0Gb1sBQm 1486713046752   geckodriver::marionette INFO    Starting browser foo\firefox\51.0\FirefoxPortable.exe 1486713046782   geckodriver::marionette INFO    Connecting to Marionette on localhost:52818 ```  Browser is opened but stuck. ![ff_profile_stuck](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6714374/22880732/9d603aaa-f1e3-11e6-95f8-1e8cd29ffc9c.png)

column3: Invalid Xpath Gives 'UnreachableBrowserException' Using RemoteWebDriver
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 7 Selenium Version:   3.0.1 Browser:   Chrome, Firefox, IE at least  Browser Version:   54, 49.0.2, 11  ## Expected Behavior -  Trying to use invalid xpath should give an Exception that references the fact it's invalid xpath - this used to happen pre-Selenium 3 I believe  ## Actual Behavior -  Gives an UnreachableBrowserException. This seems to be because it's not throwing a WebDriverException in HttpCommandExecutor#execute but eventually throws an IllegalArgumentException in ErrorCodes#toStatus, which falls into the general 'Exception' catch in RemoteWebDriver#execute which seems to assume there's a problem communicating with the web browser.  org.openqa.selenium.remote.UnreachableBrowserException: Error communicating with the remote browser. It may have died. column3: Unable to do automation on Opera Browser
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 7 Selenium Version:   3.0.1 Browser:    Opera   Browser Version:    42.0.2393.94   Issue: ==== I can launch Opera browser but unable to load the URL before that the opera browser got crashed. Following are my code for the execution and reproduce the issue:  System.setProperty("webdriver.opera.driver", operaChromiumDriver); 		ChromeOptions options = new ChromeOptions(); 		options.setBinary(operaBrowserLocation);  		DesiredCapabilities capabilities = new DesiredCapabilities(); 		capabilities.setCapability(ChromeOptions.CAPABILITY, options);  		System.out.println(capabilities);  		WebDriver browser = new OperaDriver(capabilities); //Got Crash in this step  		WebDriver driver = browser; 		driver.get("https://in.yahoo.com/");

column3: import  org.openqa.selenium.server.browserlaunchers.Sleeper; gives a cannot be resolved error

column3: Strange error message after upgrading to 3.0.0
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 7 Selenium Version:   3.0.0 Browser: Chrome  Browser Version:   54  ## Expected Behavior - The mocha unit tests worked as expected in 2.53.2  ## Actual Behavior - The test now fails with the following error stack: ```   1) Selenium Webdriver NodeJS API (selenium_webdriver-test.js) Wait success using a custom promise:      Error: TypeError: fn is not a function       at test\selenium\tests\0-helper\selenium_webdriver-test.js:189:10       at ManagedPromise.invokeCallback_ (node_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:1341:14)       at TaskQueue.execute_ (node_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:2950:14)       at TaskQueue.executeNext_ (node_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:2933:27)       at asyncRun (node_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:2793:27)       at node_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:675:7       at process._tickDomainCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:129:7)   From: Task: Selenium Webdriver NodeJS API (selenium_webdriver-test.js) Wait success using a custom promise       at Context.ret (node_modules\selenium-webdriver\testing\index.js:185:10)       at node_modules\selenium-webdriver\testing\index.js:104:5       at ManagedPromise.invokeCallback_ (node_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:1341:14)       at TaskQueue.execute_ (node_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:2950:14)       at TaskQueue.executeNext_ (node_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:2933:27)       at asyncRun (node_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:2793:27) ```  ## Steps to reproduce - ``` 'use strict';  const webdriver = require('selenium-webdriver');  test.describe('Selenium Webdriver NodeJS API (selenium_webdriver-test.js)', function () { 	test.it('Wait success using a custom promise', function () { 		let finished = false;  		function asyncOperation(delay) { 			let deferred = webdriver.promise.defer(); 			setTimeout(function () { 				finished = true; 				deferred.fulfill(true); 			}, delay || 100);  			return deferred; 		}  		let deferred = asyncOperation(100);  		let waitPromise = driver.wait(deferred, TIMEOUT, 'waiting for a promise to succeed');  		waitPromise.then(function () { 			assert.strictEqual(finished, true); 		}).catch(function (e) { 			throw new Error(e); 		}); 	}); }); ```

column3: WebDriver cannot click an 'area' element
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 7 Selenium Version:   2.44 Browser:   Chrome  My application have map/area element on the page for setting PIN. On clicking of map/area image (which contains numbers only 0 to 9) text box is get populated as per number we have clicked.  But map/area is not get clicking so no entry is going into respective text box.

column3: When launching automated tests based on Selenium via Microsoft TFS (vstest.console.exe) there is an error: The HTTP request to the remote WebDriver server for URL http://localhost:4851/session timeout out after 60 seconds.
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 7 Selenium Version:   2.27.0 https://www.nuget.org/packages/Selenium.WebDriver.ChromeDriver/ Browser:   Chrome v. 55  Browser Version:   55.0.2883.87 m (64-bit)  ## Expected Behavior - Selenium should properly launch Chrome and connect to it, so the automated tests are launched properly.  ## Actual Behavior - I get the exception in TFS Logs: OpenQA.Selenium.WebDriverException : The HTTP request to the remote WebDriver server for URL http://localhost:4851/session timed out after 60 seconds.  ## Steps to reproduce - When it works: From the command line on Windows 7, launching  C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\Common7\IDE\CommonExtensions\Microsoft\TestWindow\vstest.console.exe "C:\Folder\FunctionalTests\ValidationTests.dll"  /Settings:"C:\F\1\TestResults\tests_2017-02-03_02-46-33-PM.runsettings" /logger:trx  the tests are properly launched, Chrome browser is launched, and browses to the proper page, and tests are started.  When it does not work: When the command line above is launched by the TFS vNext build definition.  Note: It also did not work by launching the command line above, if the Chrome was installed by used 'admin' in Administrators group on Windows 7, and vstest.console.exe was launched when logged in to the system as a local user different then 'admin'. I had to uninstall Chrome, log on to the Windows as user who will launch the vstest.console.exe, and install Chrome.  Logs from the TFS: 2017-02-03T13:46:32.8549151Z Executing the powershell script: C:\Software\TFS2015BuildAgent\tasks\VSTest\1.0.32\VSTest.ps1 2017-02-03T13:46:33.2409372Z ##[debug]Calling Invoke-VSTest for all test assemblies 2017-02-03T13:46:42.8964894Z Working folder: C:\F\1 2017-02-03T13:46:42.8974895Z Executing C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\Common7\IDE\CommonExtensions\Microsoft\TestWindow\vstest.console.exe "C:\MTFolder\FunctionalTests\MT.SWF.IND.FormPlus.ValidationTests.dll"  /Settings:"C:\F\1\TestResults\tests_2017-02-03_02-46-33-PM.runsettings" /logger:trx 2017-02-03T13:46:43.1665049Z Microsoft (R) Test Execution Command Line Tool Version 14.0.25420.1 2017-02-03T13:46:43.1685050Z Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation.  All rights reserved. 2017-02-03T13:46:43.6135304Z Starting test execution, please wait... 2017-02-03T13:46:43.7275370Z Warning: Using Isolation mode to run the tests as diagnostic data adapters were enabled in the runsettings. Use the /inIsolation parameter to suppress this warning. 2017-02-03T13:46:50.1009015Z Warning: Diagnostic data adapter ('Code Coverage') message: Diagnostics and data collection from IIS failed: An error occurred during website instrumentation: Internet Information Services could not be found on the machine.. 2017-02-03T13:46:50.8789460Z Information: NUnit Adapter 3.6.1.0: Test execution started 2017-02-03T13:46:50.9139480Z Information: Running all tests in C:\Folder\FunctionalTests\ValidationTests.dll 2017-02-03T13:46:52.6060448Z Information: NUnit3TestExecutor converted 335 of 335 NUnit test cases 2017-02-03T13:47:55.5386443Z Failed   CreateInstrument_IP("abc",False) 2017-02-03T13:47:55.5416445Z ##[error]Error Message: 2017-02-03T13:47:55.5426445Z ##[error]   OneTimeSetUp: System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException : Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation. 2017-02-03T13:47:55.5436446Z ##[error]  ----> OpenQA.Selenium.WebDriverException : The HTTP request to the remote WebDriver server for URL http://localhost:4851/session timed out after 60 seconds. 2017-02-03T13:47:55.5436446Z ##[error]  ----> System.Net.WebException : The operation has timed out    Note: 1. When I log on to Windows 7 as a user who installed Chrome, and I launch vstest.console.exe with parameters above, everything is fine. 2. When the job to launch this command line is run by BuildAgent (this process is run by exactly the same user from point 1.), then I get the errors above.  It seems like there is a problem with proper launching Chrome when executing the tests by VsoAgentService process. VsoAgentService version 14.102.25423.0 Script C:\Software\TFS2015BuildAgent\tasks\VSTest\1.0.32\VSTest.ps1 is launched as the user who runs the Build Agent, and when I log on to Windows by exaclty the same user, I can manually run vstest.console.exe and all tests are working.  I have no clue what causes this problem, I would like to get any guidance how to further proceed with this issue. I expect WebDriver has problems with properly lunching chrome.exe - and this is a reason why chrome does not reponse. Becuase chrome.exe process itself is launched properly (I can see this on the active processes list in Task Manager and other Sysinternals tools)  Is there any chance I can get any detailed stacktrace for that?

column3: ClickAndHold not Holding when followed by MoveByOffset or MoveToElement
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 7  Selenium Version:   Version: 3.0.0.0 Runtime Version: v4.0.30319 Visual Studio 2013  Browser:   Google Chrome  Browser Version:   55.0.2883.87 m  ## Expected Behavior - ClickAndHold sets e.which to 1 on successive mouse events, until Release() is called.  ## Actual Behavior - e.which is set to 1 during the mousedown event, but is no longer 1 once the mousemove event is called.  ## Steps to reproduce - Create the following IAction and Perform() on any element: ``` string driverFolder = "folder/here"; IWebDriver driver = new OpenQA.Selenium.Chrome.ChromeDriver(driverFolder); driver.Navigate().GoToUrl("http://www.google.com"); Actions builder = new Action(driver); IWebElement body = driver.FindElement(By.TagName("body")); IAction dragBottomCorner = builder     .MoveToElement(body, body.Size.Width - 5, body.Size.Height - 5) // included this because it's part of my original code     .ClickAndHold()     .MoveByOffset(-5, -5)     .Release()     .Build(); dragBottomCorner.Perform(); ```  You'll also have to attach events to mousedown and mousemove and log e.which to verify that it is being unset when the mouse moves after being set correctly during mouse down.  Here's the Chrome console output for that (each line is event + e.which): mousemove 0 mousedown 1 mousemove 0 mouseup 1  The flag appears to always get cleared in mousemove. Maybe this is Chrome behavior, but when using the app myself, e.which is 1 while the mouse is moving.

column3: User cannot switch to an iframe and interact with its elements if the iframe is off screen
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 7  Selenium Version:   selenium-webdriver (3.3.0), geckodriver 0.15.0 ruby 2.3.3p222 (2016-11-21 revision 56859) [i386-mingw32]  Browser:   Firefox  Browser Version:   52.0  ## Expected Behavior - The user should be able to switch to an iframe without 1st scrolling it into view.  The user should then be able to interact with elements inside of the iframe.  This may be related to issue 2377, but I am not sure.  ## Actual Behavior - The user is NOT able to switch to an iframe without 1st scrolling it into view.  The code seems to be switching to the iframe, but the user will NOT be able to interact with elements inside of the iframe.  ## Steps to reproduce - Sample html https://jsfiddle.net/0hdtcyjz/40/  On the sample jsfiddle page...  Click the 'Update iFrame' button. This will load an HTML form into the iFrame found at the bottom of the page, but the user would still need to scroll to get to the iframe. Do NOT scroll to the iframe. Switch to the iframe using something like driver.switch_to.frame driver.find_element(:id,'iframe_id') Attempt to click button1 in the frame driver.find_element(:xpath, "//*[@value='button1']") Selenium will NOT be able to click the button

column3: How to enable chromedriver logging in from the selenium webdriver for nodejs
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 7  Selenium Version:   3.3.0  Browser:   Chrome  Browser Version:   57 (64-bit)  ## Expected Behavior - I need to enable the chromedriver logging from within a selenium webdriver nodejs test and this should be possible using the method `enableVerboseLogging`  ## Actual Behavior - Using `enableVerboseLogging` on the builder instance does work and I did not find any documentation that explains how to use `enableVerboseLogging`.  ## Steps to reproduce - ``` require('chromedriver'); const webdriver = require('selenium-webdriver');  let capabilities = webdriver.Capabilities.chrome(); capabilities.setScrollBehavior(1); let builder = new webdriver.Builder().withCapabilities(capabilities); builder.enableVerboseLogging(); // fails!!! let driver = builder.build(); ```

column3: 500 Internal Privoxy Error when I instantiate a phantomjs webdriver
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 7  Language: Python v3.6  Selenium Version:   3.3.1, Webdriver  Browser:   Phantomjs  Browser Version:   2.1.1  ## Expected Behavior - successfully create instance ## Actual Behavior - I got the 500 error ## Steps to reproduce - when i run the code ``` driver = webdriver.PhantomJS() ``` then i got the below msg  > selenium.common.exceptions.WebDriverException: Message: > 500 Internal Privoxy Error > Privoxy encountered an error while processing your request: > Could not load template file no-server-data or one of its includ ed components. > Please contact your proxy administrator. > If you are the proxy administrator, please put the required file(s)in the  (confdir)/templates directory.  The location of the (confdir ) directory is specified in the main Privoxy config file. (It's typically the Privoxy install directory).

column3: Vertical slider in Selenium IDE gone, when running Selenium in sidebar and moved the slider to the right
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 2008 R2 Selenium Version:   2.9.1 Browser:   Firefox  Since Firefox version 48, Mozilla requires all add-ons to be signed. Until recently, Firefox support in Selenium was exclusively provided by an add-on. As this add-on is not currently signed, this solution does not work with the latest Firefox releases. As an alternative, Mozilla are working on a WebDriver specification compliant implementation named GeckoDriver. Please note that the specification is not complete, and that Selenium itself does not comply with the specification at this time. This means that features previously available through Selenium will not be available using GeckoDriver.  Any issue logged here for Firefox 48 or later will be closed as a duplicate of #2559. Our recommendation is to switch to GeckoDriver, or to continue testing on Firefox 45 until GeckoDriver is a viable option for you. If you are interested in helping us to sign the add-on to restore support for later Firefox versions, please see the following comment for what's needed: https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/issues/2942#issuecomment-259717567  If the issue is with Google Chrome consider logging an issue with chromedriver instead: https://sites.google.com/a/chromium.org/chromedriver/help  If the issue is with Microsoft Edge consider logging an issue with Microsoft instead: https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/platform/issues/  If the issue is with Firefox GeckoDriver (aka Marionette) consider logging an issue with Mozilla: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/buglist.cgi?product=Testing&component=Marionette  If the issue is with Safari, only Safari 10+ is supported. Please log any Safari issue with Apple: https://bugreport.apple.com/  If the issue is with PhantomJS consider logging an issue with Ghostdriver: https://github.com/detro/ghostdriver  -->  Browser Version 51.0 (32 bin) ## Expected Behavior - My vertical slider can get focus and is slideable. ## Actual Behavior - Vertical slider is gone ## Steps to reproduce - Pick up slider and drop it on the right.

Create new Console Application project in "C:\dev\Selenium\QaShahin\WebDriverFramework" folder. Add following packages by nuget:     Selenium.Firefox.WebDriver.0.15.0     Selenium.Support.3.3.0     Selenium.WebDriver.3.3.0     Selenium.WebDriver.ChromeDriver.2.28.0     Selenium.WebDriver.IEDriver.3.3.0     Selenium.WebDriver.PhantomJS.Xplatform.2.45.0.1  Run the simplest code:  [http://pastebin.com/yB09c2Zn](http://pastebin.com/yB09c2Zn)  Error appears  'Cannot find a file named 'C:\dev\Selenium\QaShahin\WebDriverFramework\WebDriverFramework\bin\Debug\webdriver.json' or an embedded resource with the id 'WebDriver.FirefoxPreferences'. '   Geckodriver team mentioned that it's related to Selenium itself [https://github.com/mozilla/geckodriver/issues/539](https://github.com/mozilla/geckodriver/issues/539)

column3: Alert handling fails in latest IE version
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 10 Enterprise Selenium Version:   3.3.1 Browser:   Internet Explorer  Browser Version:   11.953.14393.0  ## Expected Behavior - I was running the same test script for last 3 months. Suddenly last week it started failing in verifying the alert text. One difference I could find is now if the same alert is displayed within a short time span there is a warning with checkbox. Warning message is "don't let this page create more messages".    Alert alert = driver.switchTo().alert(); alertText = alert.getText(); alert.getText() should return the text.  ## Actual Behavior - It is not returning the alert text.  ## Steps to reproduce - Use the same version of IE 11 as mentioned, generate some browser native alert within a short span(say 2 sec).

column3: IE alert interrupting selenium test case automation
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 10  selenium-dotnet-3.0.0 Selenium Driver Version:   IEDriverServer_x64_2.53.1 Browser:   Internet Explorer 11   public void Test_CreatNewReport(){             IWebElement button_Create = null;             IWebElement datamatrix_button = null;             try             {                 button_Create = driver.FindElement(By.XPath("//*[@id='create-new-workspace-icon']"));                 button_Create.Click();                 utils.WaitForPageLoading(driver);                 datamatrix_button = driver.FindElement(By.XPath("//*[@id='add-popular-widgets']/li[10]"));                 datamatrix_button.Click();                 Thread.Sleep(3090);            //     IAlert alert = driver.SwitchTo().Alert();                          //   alert.Accept();              }             catch (Exception)             {                 throw;             }             finally             {                 Clean_up(); //driver.Quit();             }   ## Expected Behavior - The browser have to create a new widget followed as by the code given.  ## Actual Behavior - The IE11 is throwing an alert :  Are you sure you want to leave the page? Message from Webpage :  You have unsaved changes Stay on this page Leave this Page  ## Steps to reproduce - The alert should be comprimiz ![alert](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6804126/20299593/9c09e7ac-ab41-11e6-95d9-3f206d8702b5.PNG) ed to stay in the page and continue to work as per the code without interruption.

column3: Java: parameter type conflict
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 10 Selenium Version:  3.1.0  ## Expected Behavior   > Success complilation  ## Actual Behavior   > T.java:[10,59] no suitable method found for until(org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.ExpectedCondition) >     method org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.FluentWait.until(java.util.function.Predicate) is not applicable >       (argument mismatch; org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.ExpectedCondition cannot be converted to java.util.function.Predicate) >     method org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.FluentWait.until(java.util.function.Function) is not applicable >       (cannot infer type-variable(s) V >         (argument mismatch; org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.ExpectedCondition cannot be converted to java.util.function.Function)) >   ## Steps to reproduce - Compile java class:  ```  import org.openqa.selenium.firefox.FirefoxDriver; import org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.ExpectedConditions; import org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.FluentWait;  public class T {      public static void main(String[] args) {         new FluentWait(new FirefoxDriver()).until(ExpectedConditions.alertIsPresent());     }  }

column3: Can no longer drag and drop to reorder scripts or test cases
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 10 Selenium Version:   IDE 2.9.1  Browser:   Firefox  Since Firefox version 48, Mozilla requires all add-ons to be signed. Until recently, Firefox support in Selenium was exclusively provided by an add-on. As this add-on is not currently signed, this solution does not work with the latest Firefox releases. As an alternative, Mozilla are working on a WebDriver specification compliant implementation named GeckoDriver. Please note that the specification is not complete, and that Selenium itself does not comply with the specification at this time. This means that features previously available through Selenium will not be available using GeckoDriver.  Any issue logged here for Firefox 48 or later will be closed as a duplicate of #2559. Our recommendation is to switch to GeckoDriver, or to continue testing on Firefox 45 until GeckoDriver is a viable option for you. If you are interested in helping us to sign the add-on to restore support for later Firefox versions, please see the following comment for what's needed: https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/issues/2942#issuecomment-259717567  If the issue is with Google Chrome consider logging an issue with chromedriver instead: https://sites.google.com/a/chromium.org/chromedriver/help  If the issue is with Microsoft Edge consider logging an issue with Microsoft instead: https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/platform/issues/  If the issue is with Firefox GeckoDriver (aka Marionette) consider logging an issue with Mozilla: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/buglist.cgi?product=Testing&component=Marionette  If the issue is with Safari, only Safari 10+ is supported. Please log any Safari issue with Apple: https://bugreport.apple.com/  If the issue is with PhantomJS consider logging an issue with Ghostdriver: https://github.com/detro/ghostdriver  -->  Browser Version:     ## Expected Behavior - ability to drag and drop individual test scripts wtihin a test case and also test cases within a suite  ## Actual Behavior - can no longer drag and drop individual test scripts wtihin a test case and also test cases within a suite  ## Steps to reproduce -

column3: IE DriverÂ returns an array if a JavaScript object has a property, length, with a number value (hangs ifÂ it's a string value)
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 10 Selenium Version:   Any Browser:   Internet Explorer  Browser Version:   11 64bit  ## Expected Behavior - When running execute script against IE Driver for the below, it should return an object. return {'length':1,'foo':'bar'}; {'length':1,'foo':'bar'} ## Actual Behavior - Instead an array is returned return {'length':1,'foo':'bar'}; [null] ## Steps to reproduce - Launch IE Driver and send a newÂ session command. Go to a website of some sort (get out of intranet ideally). Execute script to return an object. From my chat with @lukeis it looks like it's related to having the length property, specifically when set to a number. I will note when I was testing that passing in a string value forÂ length seemed to hang the IE Driver (no response was received). So when passing in: return {'length':'1','foo':'bar'}; the server would not respond and eventually timeout.

column3: stderr spam caused by ExpectedConditions and FluentWait
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 10 Selenium Version:   3.1.0 Browser:   Chrome Browser Version:   56.0.2924.87  ## Expected Behavior - ExpectedConditions should not spam stderr with warnings caused by exceptions that occur during a wait.  ## Actual Behavior - ExpectedConditions spams stderr. This did not happen in 3.0.1.  ## Steps to reproduce - Do something like ```java new WebDriverWait(driver, 10).until(ExpectedConditions.presenceOfElementLocated(By.cssSelector(cssSelector))); ``` with an element that gets added to the page at some point after the first time Selenium polls the page. column3: Can't click on a URL that spans two physical lines
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 10 Selenium Version:   3.0.1 Browser:   Firefox   Browser Version:   47.0.1  ## Expected Behavior - Using `driver.action.move_to(e).click.perform` should click on the URL.  ## Actual Behavior - Using the code `driver.action.move_to(e).click.perform does not click a URL that is spanned on two lines. However `e.click` works OK.  ## Steps to reproduce - Not sure whether it happens for all the URLs. However, in this case if the `div` containing the URL is resized to have the URL on a single line - it is clicked.

column3: org.openqa.selenium.UnsupportedCommandException in selenium 3
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 10 Selenium Version:   3 Browser:   Firefox 50.1.0  Since Firefox version 48, Mozilla requires all add-ons to be signed. Until recently, Firefox support in Selenium was exclusively provided by an add-on. As this add-on is not currently signed, this solution does not work with the latest Firefox releases. As an alternative, Mozilla are working on a WebDriver specification compliant implementation named GeckoDriver. Please note that the specification is not complete, and that Selenium itself does not comply with the specification at this time. This means that features previously available through Selenium will not be available using GeckoDriver.  Any issue logged here for Firefox 48 or later will be closed as a duplicate of #2559. Our recommendation is to switch to GeckoDriver, or to continue testing on Firefox 45 until GeckoDriver is a viable option for you. If you are interested in helping us to sign the add-on to restore support for later Firefox versions, please see the following comment for what's needed: https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/issues/2942#issuecomment-259717567  If the issue is with Google Chrome consider logging an issue with chromedriver instead: https://sites.google.com/a/chromium.org/chromedriver/help  If the issue is with Microsoft Edge consider logging an issue with Microsoft instead: https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/platform/issues/  If the issue is with Firefox GeckoDriver (aka Marionette) consider logging an issue with Mozilla: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/buglist.cgi?product=Testing&component=Marionette  If the issue is with Safari, only Safari 10+ is supported. Please log any Safari issue with Apple: https://bugreport.apple.com/  If the issue is with PhantomJS consider logging an issue with Ghostdriver: https://github.com/detro/ghostdriver  -->  Browser column3: IE screenshot returns as black image using selenium server standalone 2.53.1 and 3.0.1
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 10 Selenium Version:   2.53.1,3.0.1 Browser:   Internet Explorer 11  I am trying use the screenshot.save method to save the screenshot while running scripts in IE 11 browser.  But the image stored always is a black image  My browser capabilities are as below   if opts['browser_selection'] =~ /^(ie|internet explorer)$/i                 browser_capabilities[:browserName] = 'internet explorer'                 browser_capabilities[:platform] = 'WINDOWS'                 browser_capabilities[:ignoreProtectedModeSettings] = true                 browser_capabilities[:ignoreZoomSetting] = true                 browser_capabilities[:nativeEvents] = false                 browser_capabilities[:unexpectedAlertBehaviour] = 'accept'                 browser_capabilities[:enablePopups] = true                 browser_capabilities[:enablePersistentHover] = true                 browser_capabilities[:requireWindowFocus] = true end   It seems to be working fine if selenium hub and node are run manually but when I make it run in the background the screenshot is black

column3: driver = webdriver.Firefox() complains about: Your Firefox profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccessible.
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 10  Selenium Version:   3.3.1  Browser:   Firefox  Browser Version:   52.0.1 (32-bit)  ## Expected Behavior - When running this `driver = webdriver.Firefox()` Firefox would open successfully.  Then the Python script would run without errors.  ## Actual Behavior - There is dialog with the Firefox which states the following: ```Your Firefox profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccessible.``` The Python method does not continue until the dialog is accepted manually.   ## Steps to reproduce - ``` from selenium import webdriver from selenium.webdriver.common.keys import Keys  driver = webdriver.Firefox() driver.get("http://www.python.org") assert "Python" in driver.title elem = driver.find_element_by_name("q") elem.clear() elem.send_keys("pycon") elem.send_keys(Keys.RETURN) assert "No results found." not in driver.page_source driver.close() driver.quit() ```

column3: Feature Improvement - user agent injection to IE11
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows 10  Selenium Version:   3.0.0  Browser:   Internet Explorer  Browser Version:   11.576.14393.0  ## Feature Improvement - It seems that IE11 has a built in way to change its user agent, I've noticed it while hitting F12 and looking at emulation tab. Can you add an ability to control the user agent through this interface?

column3: Selenium 3.2.0 - IEDriverServer - Setting ignoringProtectedmode true from my driver is not working
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windows Selenium Version:   3.2.0 Browser:   Internet Explorer 11  Browser Version:   11 (32 Bit)  ## Expected Behavior - I expect when i have enabled manually the protected mode in my Internet explorer and i set my driver for disabling this... it has to run fine and with this mode disabled...  because i think that you don't need to depened of a manual setting... i understand if I disabled this mode from: ignoreProtectedModeSettings or ieOptions.IntroduceInstabilityByIgnoringProtectedModeSettings my driver is going to run with this feature disabled...   ## Actual Behavior - However it is not so... I did so and when i run my driver with that setting for ignoring the protected mode settings when I run my driver, all my tests are failed, because the behaviour of the driver is not correct... it doesn't wait for the load page... but If I disabled manually the protected mode all works fine...  In the file attached you have my code for local and remote and the log when i send to remotedriver...  You can see two strange lines: D 2017-03-07 15:26:49:607 BrowserFactory.cpp(146) Ignoring Protected Mode Settings: 1 D 2017-03-07 15:26:49:609 BrowserFactory.cpp(152) Has Valid Protected Mode Settings: 0  i am not sure, but i have the feeling i say ignore the protected mode, but it use the protected mode unless i disabled this manually from my Internet Explorer.  ## Steps to reproduce - Prerequirement: Enable the protected mode in the IE11. It is necessary, for reproducing scenario.  1. Run IEDriverServer.exe from a console CMD. 2. Run your test by remotedriver to the http://127.0.0.1:5555 with the capability:              capabilities.SetCapability("ignoreProtectedModeSettings", true); If you run in local i have the same trouble and the option is: ieOptions.IntroduceInstabilityByIgnoringProtectedModeSettings = true; 3- Run test.  [IEDriverserver.txt](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/files/824707/IEDriverserver.txt)

column3: IEDriverServer.exe crash calling MoveToElement() action
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Windoes 7 Pro Selenium Version:   3.0.1 Browser:   Internet explorer 11.0.9600.18537  ## Expected Behavior Open and control two browser windows using a single instance of IEDriverServer.exe. Bring the first browser into focus, navigate to a particular url and scroll to an element (url and element are unimportant as long as they exist and are valid). Bring the second browser into focus, navigate to a particular url, scroll to an element and end the test.  ## Actual Behavior The first browser window is brought into focus, a url is loaded and page is scrolled to a particular element. The second browser window is brought into focus, a url is loaded and page is scrolled to a particular element but then IEDriverServer.exe crashes before the test can complete.  ## Extra Notes I believe this issue has been previously reported but until now there has been no public mention of code that can be used to easily replicate the issue as I provide below. I believe this open issue describes the same problem I am experiencing: [https://github.com/seleniumhq/selenium-google-code-issue-archive/issues/7198](https://github.com/seleniumhq/selenium-google-code-issue-archive/issues/7198).   Here is what I know:  - Both the 32 and 64 bit versions of the IE driver server are affected (v3.0.0 for both) - The same code works fine with no crash in other browsers such as google chrome (when modified to replace internet explorer specific code with other browser equivalent) - I have observed that this problem seems to be intermittent as the code can be run without a crash a very small percentage of the time (I can't be sure but I'm guessing 99.9% crash and 0.01% no crash) - Using the javascript executor to scroll to the element instead of the MoveToElement() action works as expected without a crash and therefore can be used as a workaround until a proper fix is discovered  ## Steps to reproduce  1. Create a new C# 'Windows Forms Application' project named 'SeleniumIEServerCrashTestApp'.  2. Add references to **WebDriver.dll** and **WebDriver.Support.dll**.  3. Place a copy of either the 32 or 64 bit IEDriverServer.exe in 'C:\IEServer' or else change the path of the sIEServerPath string variable in the below code to a path that contains IEDriverServer.exe.  4. Replace the code for Form1 with the following and run:  		using System; 		using System.Linq; 		using System.Windows.Forms;  		namespace SeleniumIEServerCrashTestApp 		{ 			public partial class Form1 : Form 			{ 				public Form1() 				{ 					InitializeComponent(); 				}  				private Int32 nPort = 7793; 				private IntPtr[] nBrowserHandle = new IntPtr[2]; 				private OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebDriver oBrowser1 = null; 				private OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebDriver oBrowser2 = null; 				private string sIEServerPath = "C:\\IEServer\\IEDriverServer.exe";  				private void Form1_Load(object sender, EventArgs e) 				{ 					// Code to reproduce crash in ie server when using MoveToElement action  					try 					{ 						OpenQA.Selenium.By oBy = OpenQA.Selenium.By.XPath("//img[@id='footerLogo']"); 						OpenQA.Selenium.IWebElement oElement = null; 						OpenQA.Selenium.Interactions.Actions oActions = default(OpenQA.Selenium.Interactions.Actions);  						// Start the IEDriverServer.exe as a hidden window  						System.Diagnostics.Process proc = new System.Diagnostics.Process();  						proc.StartInfo.UseShellExecute = false; 						proc.StartInfo.CreateNoWindow = true; 						proc.StartInfo.FileName = sIEServerPath; 						proc.StartInfo.Arguments = "/port=" + nPort; 						proc.Start();  						// Launch 2 browsers against the same ie server  						LaunchNewBrowser(ref oBrowser1); 						LaunchNewBrowser(ref oBrowser2);  						// Navigate to url in browser #1  						oBrowser1.Navigate().GoToUrl("http://docs.seleniumhq.org");  						// Bring the browser window into focus  						modGlobal.BringWindowToFront(nBrowserHandle[0]);  						// Find the footer element  						if (oBrowser1.FindElements(oBy).Count == 0) 						{ 							OpenQA.Selenium.Support.UI.WebDriverWait oWait = new OpenQA.Selenium.Support.UI.WebDriverWait(oBrowser1, TimeSpan.FromSeconds(5)); 							oWait.Until(x => x.FindElement(oBy)); 						}  						oElement = oBrowser1.FindElement(oBy);  						// Scroll to the footer element using selenium actions class  						oActions = new OpenQA.Selenium.Interactions.Actions(oBrowser1); 						oActions.MoveToElement(oElement); 						oActions.Perform();  						// Navigate to url in browser #2  						oBrowser2.Navigate().GoToUrl("http://docs.seleniumhq.org/download/");  						// Bring the browser window into focus  						modGlobal.BringWindowToFront(nBrowserHandle[1]);  						// Find the footer element  						if (oBrowser2.FindElements(oBy).Count == 0) 						{ 							OpenQA.Selenium.Support.UI.WebDriverWait oWait = new OpenQA.Selenium.Support.UI.WebDriverWait(oBrowser2, TimeSpan.FromSeconds(5)); 							oWait.Until(x => x.FindElement(oBy)); 						}  						oElement = oBrowser2.FindElement(oBy);  						// (Attempt to) scroll to the footer element using selenium actions class  						oActions = new OpenQA.Selenium.Interactions.Actions(oBrowser2); 						oActions.MoveToElement(oElement); 						oActions.Perform();     // <---------- Ie Server Crash 						//((OpenQA.Selenium.IJavaScriptExecutor)oBrowser2).ExecuteScript("arguments[0].scrollIntoView(true);", oElement);      // <---------- scroll to element using javascript = no crash 					} 					catch (Exception ex) 					{ 						MessageBox.Show(ex.Message); 					} 					finally 					{ 						// Cleanup  						if (oBrowser1 != null) 							oBrowser1.Close(); 						if (oBrowser2 != null) 							oBrowser2.Close();  						CloseProcessByName("IEDriverServer"); 					} 				}  				private void LaunchNewBrowser(ref OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebDriver oBrowser) 				{ 					string sIEProcessName = "iexplore"; 					string sBrowserTitle = "WebDriver";  					// Get all currently open browser handles  					System.Diagnostics.Process[] oProccesses = System.Diagnostics.Process.GetProcessesByName(sIEProcessName); 					IntPtr[] nSkipList = null;  					if (oProccesses.Length > 0) 					{ 						// Add currently open browser handles to a skip list  						Array.Resize(ref nSkipList, oProccesses.Length);  						for (Int32 i = 0; i <= oProccesses.Length - 1; i++) 						{ 							if (oProccesses[i].MainWindowHandle != IntPtr.Zero) 							{ 								nSkipList[i] = oProccesses[i].MainWindowHandle; 							} 						} 					}  					// Spawn new browser  					oBrowser = new OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.RemoteWebDriver(new Uri("http://localhost:" + nPort), OpenQA.Selenium.Remote.DesiredCapabilities.InternetExplorer());  					// Ensure there is no wait time when checking for elements  					oBrowser.Manage().Timeouts().ImplicitlyWait(new TimeSpan(0, 0, 0));  					// Get the browser handle (hwnd)  					IntPtr nHandle = GetProcessHandle(sIEProcessName, sBrowserTitle, nSkipList);  					if (nHandle != IntPtr.Zero) 					{ 						// Save handle for later  						if (object.ReferenceEquals(oBrowser, oBrowser1)) 						{ 							nBrowserHandle[0] = nHandle; 						} 						else 						{ 							nBrowserHandle[1] = nHandle; 						} 					} 				}  				private IntPtr GetProcessHandle(string sProcessName, string sTitle, IntPtr[] nSkipList) 				{ 					IntPtr nReturn = IntPtr.Zero; 					System.Diagnostics.Process[] oProccesses = System.Diagnostics.Process.GetProcessesByName(sProcessName);  					foreach (System.Diagnostics.Process oCurrentProcess in oProccesses) 					{ 						if (oCurrentProcess.MainWindowHandle != IntPtr.Zero && (nSkipList == null || (nSkipList.Contains(oCurrentProcess.MainWindowHandle) == false && oCurrentProcess.MainWindowTitle.StartsWith(sTitle) == true))) 						{ 							nReturn = oCurrentProcess.MainWindowHandle; 						} 					}  					return nReturn; 				}  				private void CloseProcessByName(string sProcessName) 				{ 					System.Diagnostics.Process[] oProccesses = null; 					bool bFound = true;  					while (!(bFound == false)) 					{ 						bFound = false; 						oProccesses = System.Diagnostics.Process.GetProcessesByName(sProcessName);  						foreach (System.Diagnostics.Process oCurrentProcess in oProccesses) 						{ 							bFound = true;  							try 							{ 								oCurrentProcess.Kill(); 							} 							catch (Exception ex) 							{ 							} 							finally 							{ 								Application.DoEvents(); 							} 						} 					} 				} 			} 		}  		public static class modGlobal 		{ 			[System.Runtime.InteropServices.DllImport("user32.dll")] 			[return: System.Runtime.InteropServices.MarshalAs(System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType.Bool)] 			static extern bool SetForegroundWindow(IntPtr hWnd); 			public static void BringWindowToFront(IntPtr nHandle) 			{ 				SetForegroundWindow(nHandle); 			} 		}

column4: ## Meta - OS:   win8.1 Enterprise 64bit  Selenium Version:   Selenium server version: 3.3.1, revision: 5234b32  Ruby version: 2.3.3p222 x64 Java version: '1.8.0_102' IEDriverServer (3.0.0.0) IE version 11.0.9600.18538 ChromeDriver 2.27.440174 Chrome version 56.0.2924.87 (64 bit) Selenium server version: 3.3.1, revision: 5234b32 Gems:  	childprocess (0.5.9) 		ffi (\~> 1.0, >= 1.0.11) 	ffi (1.9.14) 	rubyzip (1.2.0) 	selenium-webdriver (3.0.5) 		childprocess (\~> 0.5) 		rubyzip (\~> 1.0) 		websocket (\~> 1.0) 	watir (6.1.0) 		selenium-webdriver (\~> 3.0) 	websocket (1.2.3)  ## Expected Behavior - Requesting a Chrome browser by passing a hash to Watir::Browser.new should open a Chrome browser.  ## Actual Behavior - A short program to exercise this (small_case.rb): ``` require 'watir'  cr_caps = {   browser_name: 'chrome',   chromeOptions: { args: [ '--proxy-server=127.0.0.1:9999' ] } }  browser = Watir::Browser.new(   :remote,   url: 'http://127.0.0.1:4444/wd/hub',   desired_capabilities: cr_caps ) browser.goto 'https://github.com/' sleep 5 browser.close ```  Gets exception with message: ``` [remote server] org.openqa.selenium.remote.server.DefaultDriverFactory(DefaultDriverFactory.java):62:in `newInstance': The best matching driver provider org.openqa.selenium.ie.InternetExplorerDriver can't create a new driver instance for Capabilities [{browser_name=chrome, chromeOptions={args=[--proxy-server=127.0.0.1:9999]}}] (Selenium::WebDriver::Error::UnknownError) Build info: version: '3.3.1', revision: java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker():-1:in `run' 	from [remote server] java.lang.Thread():-1:in `run' 	from C:/Ruby23-x64/lib/ruby/gems/2.3.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.5/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/response.rb:69:in `assert_ok' 	from C:/Ruby23-x64/lib/ruby/gems/2.3.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.5/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/response.rb:32:in `initialize' 	from C:/Ruby23-x64/lib/ruby/gems/2.3.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.5/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/bridge.rb:645:in `raw_execute' 	from C:/Ruby23-x64/lib/ruby/gems/2.3.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.5/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/bridge.rb:109:in `create_session' 	from C:/Ruby23-x64/lib/ruby/gems/2.3.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.5/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/bridge.rb:69:in `initialize' 	from C:/Ruby23-x64/lib/ruby/gems/2.3.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.5/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/driver.rb:57:in `new' 	from C:/Ruby23-x64/lib/ruby/gems/2.3.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.5/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/driver.rb:57:in `for' 	from C:/Ruby23-x64/lib/ruby/gems/2.3.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.5/lib/selenium/webdriver.rb:82:in `for' 	from C:/Ruby23-x64/lib/ruby/gems/2.3.0/gems/watir-6.1.0/lib/watir/browser.rb:46:in `initialize' 	from C:/dev/spikes/se_browser/small_case.rb:8:in `new' 	from C:/dev/spikes/se_browser/small_case.rb:8:in `' 	from -e:1:in `load' 	from -e:1:in `' ``` It seems to be asking the Internet Explorer driver to create a session, although the requested browser name was 'Chrome'.  Note that similar invocation works correctly with Firefox and IE.  Also using capabilities objects works correctly, e.g. `Selenium::WebDriver::Remote::Capabilities.chrome(CHROME_OPTIONS)`  ## Steps to reproduce -  1. Set up Selenium Hub and Selenium node 2. For "small_case.rb", just execute `ruby small_case.rb` 3. For the larger "my_script.rb", set environment variable GRID_URL to http://127.0.0.1:4444/wd/hub, if running locally.  Also set DESIRED_BROWSER to chrome, ie, or ff. 4. Verify that the correct browser comes up. [selenium_issue_20170317.zip](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/files/851755/selenium_issue_20170317.zip)

column3: Can't switch tabs for Firefox 52.0.1
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Win10 x64 Selenium Version:   3.3.1 Browser:   Firefox 52.0.1  geckodriver 0.15.0  ## Expected Behavior -  Firefox 47.0 can open new tab by "body.send_keys(Keys.CONTROL + 't')" and switch to new tab  ## Actual Behavior -  Firefox 52.0.1 just stay in current tab, can't open new tab and switch it  ## Steps to reproduce -  from selenium import webdriver from selenium.webdriver.common.keys import Keys  browser = webdriver.Firefox() browser.maximize_window() browser.get('http://tw.yahoo.com') body = browser.find_element_by_tag_name("body") body.send_keys(Keys.CONTROL + 't')  browser.switch_to.window(browser.window_handles[-1]) browser.get('http://www.google.com')

column3: Screenshots Intermittently Fail
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Ubuntu 16.04 Selenium Version:   3.0.1 Browser:   Chrome Browser Version:   57.0.2987.13  ## Expected Behavior - A screenshot is taken and saved as a .png  ## Actual Behavior - The error message ``` [4.806][WARNING]: screenshot failed, retrying``` appears. No exceptions are thrown. A screenshot is not saved.   ## Steps to reproduce - ```      driver.switchTo().window(targetwindow);      TakesScreenshot yourScreenshot = (TakesScreenshot) driver;      File tempfile = yourScreenshot.getScreenshotAs(OutputType.FILE); ```     This happens intermittently, not on certain sites. Maybe it has to do with multiple browser windows open? Or if one window has a blocking popup so it cannot switch? If so, is there a way to define a timeout/wait for the screenshot?

column3: Session timeout doesn't work with Appium node
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Ubuntu 14.04LTS  Selenium Version:   selenium-server-standalone-3.0.1.jar  Browser:   Appium  Browser Version:   1.5.0  ## Expected Behavior - The test script does not call driver.quit at the end to simulate fault situation. Selenium server should release the session after Appium client inactivity timeout is reached. So the next test script can use the webdriver.Remote() again even without property shutdown.  ## Actual Behavior - Selenium server doesn't release the session after Appium client inactivity timeout is reached and keep queuing all request even the test script has been terminated. The webdriver.Remote() call doesn't report fail or timeout and keep waiting unless user interrupts.  I try to fall back to 2.53.1 then everything works fine as I expected.  ## Steps to reproduce - Grid server:  ``` $ java -jar selenium-server-standalone-2.53.1.jar -role hub ``` Node (same as Grid server): ``` $ appium --session-override --nodeconfig node_zp1.json -p 4726 -bp 2252 --default-capabilities '{"udid":"E4AZCY066429", "fullReset":true}' ``` nodeconfig of node_zp1.json:  ``` {     "capabilities": [         {             "applicationName": "Asus Zenphone",             "browserName": "Asus Zenphone",             "platformName": "ANDROID",             "maxInstances": 1         }     ],     "configuration": {         "cleanUpCycle": 2000,         "timeout": 30000,         "proxy": "org.openqa.grid.selenium.proxy.DefaultRemoteProxy",         "host": "127.0.0.1",         "port": 4726,         "maxSession": 1,         "register": true,         "registerCycle": 5000,         "hubPort": 4444,         "hubHost": "192.168.57.1"     } } ```  Test script: ```python from appium import webdriver desired_caps = {} desired_caps['platformName'] = 'Android' desired_caps['platformVersion'] = '4.2' desired_caps['deviceName'] = 'Android' #devInfo['serial'] desired_caps['app'] = '/home/scotthsiao/workspace/selenium/' + devInfo['apk'] desired_caps['applicationName'] = "Asus Zenphone" print "try to connect to remote" driver = webdriver.Remote('http://localhost:4444/wd/hub', desired_caps) print "connected" ```

column3: installing py selenium in development mode
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Ubuntu Selenium Version:   3.0.1 Client: Python    --> ## Expected Behavior - After executing `./go py_prep_for_install_release` `python setup.py develop` should correctly install selenium in development/editable mode.  ## Actual Behavior - Output of `python setup.py develop`  ``` running develop running egg_info creating selenium.egg-info writing selenium.egg-info/PKG-INFO writing top-level names to selenium.egg-info/top_level.txt writing dependency_links to selenium.egg-info/dependency_links.txt writing manifest file 'selenium.egg-info/SOURCES.txt' reading manifest file 'selenium.egg-info/SOURCES.txt' reading manifest template 'MANIFEST.in' warning: no files found matching 'py/selenium/selenium.py' writing manifest file 'selenium.egg-info/SOURCES.txt' running build_ext Creating /home/jitendra/.virtualenvs/pyselexp/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium.egg-link (link to .) Adding selenium 3.0.1 to easy-install.pth file Installed /home/jitendra/gitprojects/selenium3 Processing dependencies for selenium==3.0.1 Finished processing dependencies for selenium==3.0.1 ```  Output of `python -c 'import selenium;print("OK");'`  ``` Traceback (most recent call last):   File "", line 1, in  ImportError: No module named selenium ```  ## Steps to reproduce - 1. Clone the repository using `git clone git@github.com:SeleniumHQ/selenium.git` 2. Execute `./go py_prep_for_install_release`  3. Execute `python setup.py develop`  Please see below 02 lines as mentioned in the output of `python setup.py develop` ``` Adding selenium 3.0.1 to easy-install.pth file Installed /home/jitendra/gitprojects/selenium3  ``` As I am using `virtualenv`, I added `/py` after `/home/jitendra/gitprojects/selenium3` in my `easy-install.pth` file as shown below  ``` cat /home/jitendra/.virtualenvs/pyselexp/lib/python2.7/site-packages/easy-install.pth import sys; sys.__plen = len(sys.path) /home/jitendra/gitprojects/selenium3/py import sys; new=sys.path[sys.__plen:]; del sys.path[sys.__plen:]; p=getattr(sys,'__egginsert',0); sys.path[p:p]=new; sys.__egginsert = p+len(new)  ``` and i was able to successfully execute ` python -c 'import selenium;print("OK");' `.

column3: Firefox maximize and sendKeys does not work with GeckoDriver on Selenium 3.1.0
column4: ## Meta - OS:   RHEL7-64 bit Selenium Version:   3.1.0 Browser:   Firefox  Browser Version:   51.0.1  ## Expected Behavior - Once the driver is initialized with Geckodriver, the window loads the url and should maximize and accept keys F11 and F5. Here is the code  _driver.get( url ); By by = get_element( "global_nav" ); _driver.manage().window().maximize(); _driver.findElement( by ).sendKeys( Keys.F11 ); sleep( 2000 ); _driver.findElement( by ).sendKeys( Keys.F5 ); ## Actual Behavior - Neither the Firefox window maximizes nor sendKeys is having any impact. ## Steps to reproduce - 1. Use Firefox with GeckoDriver to initialize the driver. 2. Load a url and try to maximize with above code. 3. Then send two keys F11 and F5 using the above code.

column3: You must enable the 'Allow Remote Automation' error even when already set

This works for several runs (10-30 min) and then starts Failing ALL runs with "Allow Remote Automation" error. Log into iMac, launch Safari, Click Develper dropdown and note that Allow Remote Automation is still check.  Log out and repeat of above, works and then quicks   ## Steps to reproduce - See above

column3: Ruby 2 and Selenium IDE 2.9.1 -- exported test cases (unit::testCase) broken for 2 reasons
column4: ## Meta - OS:   OSX 10.12.2  Selenium Version:   IDE 2.9.1  Browser:   Firefox  Ruby 2 and Selenium IDE 2.9.1 -- exported test cases (unit::testCase) broken for 2 reasons:  1. the export file writes the exported class as `class Test` Test is a keyword and ruby fails to parse it as name ;) => FIX: rename it. e.g. SeleniumTest (more descriptive anyway)  2. the exported file still contains the ${receiver} placeholder  This placeholder should have been replaced with `@driver` => FIX: replace ${receiver} with @driver  can we get these fixes in the code so we don't have to manually change it in the generated file? :)

column3: It is not clear how to upload multiple files via selenium
column4: ## Meta - OS:   OSX 10.11.6 Selenium Version:   selenium (2.53.6) Browser:   Firefox 45.4.0  ## Expected Behavior - I'm trying to create an automate test for multiple file upload but actually it keeps on failing on this version of Firefox, so i would like to know which should be the correct way to do this in my firefox version. I've tried with :  1) Multiple send keys with different file path 2) Concatenate file path with a comma 3) Concatenate file path  with a space  ## Actual Behavior -  ## Steps to reproduce - this is my html page            (root)/forms/multiple_file_upload_form.html                    ================  this is my piece of code in python      def choose_multiple_files(self, locator, basePath="",  *files):         fileList = []         selenium2Lib = BuiltIn().get_library_instance('Selenium2Library')         for file in files:             path_to_image = os.path.join(basePath, file)             fileList.append(path_to_image)             if self.browser not in ("googlechrome", "gc", "chrome"):                 selenium2Lib._element_find(locator, True, True).send_keys(path_to_image)         if self.browser in ("googlechrome", "gc", "chrome"):             logging.info(fileList)             selenium2Lib._element_find(locator, True, True).send_keys("\n".join(fileList))  Thanks for the support

column3: [SafariDriver] Unable to Right Click Element using Actions
column4: ## Meta - OS:   OSX 10.11.6 Selenium Version:   2.53.0 Browser:   Safari  Browser Version:   10.0  ## Expected Behavior - Should right click element being passed into method.  In my application a context menu for the Element should appear.  ## Actual Behavior - Get the following error from the SafariWebDriver running on the Agent:  Exception thrown org.openqa.selenium.WebDriverException: Unknown command: {"id":"jre8mp1j66q6","name":"mouseMoveTo","parameters":{"element":":wdc:1490790363654"}} (WARNING: The server did not provide any stacktrace information) Command duration or timeout: 5 milliseconds Build info: version: '2.53.0', revision: '35ae25b', time: '2016-03-15 17:00:58'  Driver info: org.openqa.selenium.safari.SafariDriver Capabilities [{browserName=safari, takesScreenshot=true, javascriptEnabled=true, version=10.0, cssSelectorsEnabled=true, platform=MAC, secureSsl=true}]  ## Steps to reproduce -  I'm using the Selenium Grid plugin on Jenkins to control a SSH Slave on OSX and getting a RemoteWebDriver object.  I have tried both of the following options but nothing happens and get an error from the RemoteWebDriver:  var action = new Actions(WebDriver); action.ContextClick(webElement.Element).Perform();  and  var action = new Actions(WebDriver); action.KeyDown(Keys.Control).Click(webElement.Element).KeyUp(Keys.Control).Build().Perform();

column3: Selenium-webdriver #enabled? is incorrect for inputs nested in disabled fieldsets
column4: ## Meta - OS:   OSX Selenium Version:   selenium-webdriver 3.0.5 Browser:   Firefox   Given HTML like                      and element referring to the input  Using selenium-webdriver with marionette disabled against Firefox 47 calling       element.enabled?  # returns false  Using selenium-webdriver with marionette enabled against Firefox 50.1.0      element.enabled? # returns true  In both cases the input is disabled in the browser and I would expect `enabled?` to return false

column3: screenshots file path separator not correct on Mac
column4: ## Meta - OS:   OSX Selenium Version:   3.2.0  (selenium-server-standalone-3.2.0.jar) Browser:   FireFox  Browser Version:   45.4.0  ## Expected Behavior - screenshots file locate in test-output ## Actual Behavior - screenshots file located in project root path with wrong file path separator, like: eduCloud\test-output\html\screenshots\WebDrivertest31488667211537.png \ is the file path separator on Windows, / is the file path separator on Mac.  ## Steps to reproduce - run any failed testcase, and check the screenshot file on Mac

column3: Firefox Profile is not working with remote services
column4: ## Meta - OS:   OSX Selenium Version:   3.2.0 Browser:   Firefox    Browser Version:   52.0.1  ## Expected Behavior -  Preferences should take effect locally or with remote services like Sauce Labs.  ## Actual Behavior -  Preferences work locally but don't work with remote services like Sauce Labs.  ## Steps to reproduce -  var FirefoxProfile = require("selenium-webdriver/firefox").Profile; var profile = new FirefoxProfile(); profile.setPreference("media.navigator.streams.fake", true); profile.setPreference("media.navigator.permission.disabled", true);  var firefoxDriver = new webdriver.Builder().withCapabilities({ 'browserName': 'firefox', 'firefox_profile': profile }).build();

column3: SafariDriver 2.48.0 not supporting wait
column4: ## Meta - OS:   OSX Selenium Version:   3.0.1, python 3.5 Browser:   Safari  Browser Version:   10.0.1 ## Expected Behavior - Driver should wait for the object to appear. ## Actual Behavior - Browser is closed throwing exception. ## Steps to reproduce - Install selenium 3.0.1 in macOS sierra with safari 10.0.1 and selenium 3.0.1 install safaridriver 2.48.0 Run scripts with explicit wait.  ## Code self.driver = webdriver.Safari() self.driver.wait = WebDriverWait(self.driver, 60) self.driver.get("http://example.com") Click Sign in button and wait for sign in page self.driver.find_element_by_xpath(XMLDict['SignIn'].Xpath).click() self.driver.wait.until(EC.visibility_of_element_located((By.ID, XMLDict['User'].ID))) self.driver.maximize_window()  ## Error Message  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.5/lib/python3.5/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/support/wait.py", line 71, in until value = method(self._driver) File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.5/lib/python3.5/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/support/expected_conditions.py", line 78, in call return _element_if_visible(_find_element(driver, self.locator)) File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.5/lib/python3.5/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/support/expected_conditions.py", line 98, in _element_if_visible return element if element.is_displayed() == visibility else False File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.5/lib/python3.5/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webelement.py", line 358, in is_displayed return self._execute(Command.IS_ELEMENT_DISPLAYED)['value'] File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.5/lib/python3.5/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webelement.py", line 494, in _execute return self._parent.execute(command, params) File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.5/lib/python3.5/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py", line 236, in execute self.error_handler.check_response(response) File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.5/lib/python3.5/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/errorhandler.py", line 163, in check_response raise exception_class(value)

column3: unable to connect  MacOSX + Mozilla 52.0.2 +  geckodriver 0.15.0 + selenium 3.3.0
column4: ## Meta - OS:   OSX  Selenium Version:   3.3.0 (using Ruby selenium-webdriver gem 3.3.0) 3.3.1 is not available!!!  Browser:   Firefox 52.0.2 geckodriver 0.15.0  Browser Version:   52.0.2 (64-bit)  ## Expected Behavior - Launch browser  ## Actual Behavior - ``` Selenium::WebDriver::Error::WebDriverError: unable to connect to Mozilla geckodriver 127.0.0.1:4444 from /Users///selenium-webdriver-3.3.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/service.rb:130:in `connect_until_stable' ```  ## Steps to reproduce - ``` require 'selenium/webdriver'  Selenium::WebDriver::Firefox::Binary.path = "/Users/#{ENV['USER']}/Applications/Firefox.app/Contents/MacOS/firefox" Capybara::Selenium::Driver.new(app, :browser => :firefox) session = Capybara::Session.new(:selenium) session.visit('/') ```

column3: Please add possibility to set technologyPreview flag for safariDriver in javascript version
column4: ## Meta - OS:   masOS Sierra 10.12.3 Selenium Version:   javascrip/node 3.0.1 Browser:   safari 10.0.3  ## Expected Behavior - Need to run test in Safari Technology Preview. There is an Option "technologyPreview" in Java version https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/selenium-3.0.1/java/client/src/org/openqa/selenium/safari/SafariOptions.java  ## Actual Behavior - Can't set technologyPreview option for safariDriver from javascript binding   ## Steps to reproduce -

column3: Grid 3.0.1 Hub not connecting to Node on the same MacOS machine
column4: ## Meta - OS:   MacOS Sierra 10.12.3 Selenium Version:   Standalone Grid Server 3.0.1  I open two separate terminal windows.  In one, I use this command:  `java -jar selenium-server-standalone-3.0.1.jar -role hub -hubConfig hubconfig.json`  hubConfig.json  `{   "port": 4444,   "newSessionWaitTimeout": -1,   "servlets" : [],   "withoutServlets": [],   "custom": {},   "capabilityMatcher": "org.openqa.grid.internal.utils.DefaultCapabilityMatcher",   "throwOnCapabilityNotPresent": true,   "cleanUpCycle": 5000,   "role": "hub",   "debug": false,   "browserTimeout": 0,   "timeout": 1800 }`  In a separate window (in the same machine) I type this command for the node:  `java -jar selenium-server-standalone-3.0.1.jar -role node -hub http://10.10.3.1:4444/grid/register/ -nodeConfig nodeConfig.json -log nodelog.log -debug`  nodeConfig.json  `{   "capabilities":   [     {       "browserName": "firefox",       "maxInstances": 1,       "seleniumProtocol": "WebDriver"     },     {       "browserName": "chrome",       "maxInstances": 1,       "seleniumProtocol": "WebDriver"     },     {       "browserName": "safari",       "maxInstances": 1,       "seleniumProtocol": "WebDriver"     }   ],   "proxy": "org.openqa.grid.selenium.proxy.DefaultRemoteProxy",   "maxSession": 5,   "port": 5555,   "register": true,   "registerCycle": 5000,   "hub": "http://10.10.3.1:4444",   "nodeStatusCheckTimeout": 5000,   "nodePolling": 5000,   "role": "node",   "unregisterIfStillDownAfter": 60000,   "downPollingLimit": 2,   "debug": false,   "servlets" : [],   "withoutServlets": [],   "custom": {} }`  At this point I would expect the node to successfully connect to the hub.  However, It times out.    ## Expected Behavior -  I would expect the node to successfully connect to the hub  ## Actual Behavior -  Instead, it times out.  Here is the content of nodelog.log  `11:24:10.915 INFO - Selenium build info: version: '3.0.1', revision: '1969d75' 11:24:10.917 INFO - Launching a Selenium Grid node 11:24:11.731 DEBUG - CookieSpec selected: default 11:24:11.750 DEBUG - Auth cache not set in the context 11:24:11.752 DEBUG - Connection request: [route: {}->http://10.10.3.1:4444][total kept alive: 0; route allocated: 0 of 2000; total allocated: 0 of 2000] 11:24:11.781 DEBUG - Connection leased: [id: 0][route: {}->http://10.10.3.1:4444][total kept alive: 0; route allocated: 1 of 2000; total allocated: 1 of 2000] 11:24:11.784 DEBUG - Opening connection {}->http://10.10.3.1:4444 11:24:11.791 DEBUG - Connecting to /10.10.3.1:4444 11:25:29.237 DEBUG - http-outgoing-0: Shutdown connection 11:25:29.238 DEBUG - Connection discarded 11:25:29.238 DEBUG - Connection released: [id: 0][route: {}->http://10.10.3.1:4444][total kept alive: 0; route allocated: 0 of 2000; total allocated: 0 of 2000] 11:25:29.238 WARN - error getting the parameters from the hub.
