column3: UnknownCommandError: GET /session/{sessionID}/element/{elementID}/location did not match a known command
column4: ## Meta - OS:   macOS Sierra 10.12.3 Selenium Version:   javascript/node 3.0.1 Browser:   Firefox 51.0.1 (64 bit) Geckodriver Version: 0.14.0  ## Expected Behavior - WebElement.getLocation() returns element location   ## Actual Behavior - UnknownCommandError: GET /session/e362d785-035c-4342-ae9b-cbd9c1ce88fd/element/f7e9090c-79c2-8249-b1df-8f080ce9b6e6/location did not match a known command  ## Steps to reproduce - Steps to reproduce - driver.findElement(locator).then(el => el.getLocation())  https://github.com/mozilla/geckodriver/issues/471 @andreastt Member andreastt commented 20 hours ago /{session id}/location isnâ€™t a WebDriver command endpoint. You probably want /{session id}/rect, which returns a dictionary of x/y/width/height properties.  Are you sure youâ€™re using the most up to date Node.js bindings? If so and the problem persists, please consider filing a bug on the Selenium project.  Thanks!

column3: Python/Chrome "cannot get automation extension" during screenshot.
column4: ## Meta - OS:   MacOS 10.12.3 Selenium Version:   ChromeDriver 2.27 selenium-3.0.2 via pip3 Browser:   Chrome 57.0.2987.88  Python3 Script to reproduce:  ``` import selenium.webdriver as webdriver import time  browser = webdriver.Chrome() browser.get("https://google.com") time.sleep(2) browser.save_screenshot("test.png") browser.quit()  ```  Result:  ``` $ python3 wd_test.py  Traceback (most recent call last):   File "wd_test.py", line 7, in      browser.save_screenshot("test.png")   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py", line 798, in get_screenshot_as_file     png = self.get_screenshot_as_png()   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py", line 817, in get_screenshot_as_png     return base64.b64decode(self.get_screenshot_as_base64().encode('ascii'))   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py", line 827, in get_screenshot_as_base64     return self.execute(Command.SCREENSHOT)['value']   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py", line 236, in execute     self.error_handler.check_response(response)   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/errorhandler.py", line 192, in check_response     raise exception_class(message, screen, stacktrace) selenium.common.exceptions.WebDriverException: Message: unknown error: cannot get automation extension from unknown error: page could not be found: chrome-extension://aapnijgdinlhnhlmodcfapnahmbfebeb/_generated_background_page.html   (Session info: chrome=57.0.2987.88)   (Driver info: chromedriver=2.27.440174 (e97a722caafc2d3a8b807ee115bfb307f7d2cfd9),platform=Mac OS X 10.12.3 x86_64)  Exception ignored in: > Traceback (most recent call last):   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/common/service.py", line 173, in __del__   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/common/service.py", line 149, in stop   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/common/service.py", line 120, in send_remote_shutdown_command ImportError: sys.meta_path is None, Python is likely shutting down ```  "cannot get automation extension" has been reported many times over the years. Not necessarily anywhere useful to the selenium developer team though - https://www.google.com/search?q=%22cannot+get+automation+extension%22  If you change to Firefox it works as expected (no exception thrown)

column3: SafariDriver not connecting.
column4: ## Meta - OS:   MacOS 10.11.6 El Capitan Selenium Version:   Selenium 2.53.1 Browser:   Safari  Browser Version:   Safari 10.0.3  ## Expected Behavior - Safari driver to connect and run test.  ## Actual Behavior - Safari runs the test from time to time and other times the Safari driver closes right away or hangs on the connection. ## Steps to reproduce - I think Safari driver is connecting where I'm not getting the error on the 4th line in red saying it's not connecting, but my test will fail with the error. ``` RuntimeError: Failed to connect to SafariDriver after 10114 ms Build info: version: '2.53.1', revision: 'a36b8b1', time: '2016-06-30 17:37:03' System info: host: 'LEFTOUT', ip: 'LEFTOUT', os.name: 'Mac OS X', os.arch: 'x86_64', os.version: '10.11.6', java.version: '1.8.0_73' Driver info: driver.version: SafariDriver ``` ![safaridriver](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9540417/24046822/de7d0ece-0af1-11e7-81d2-8604cbbe3c11.png)  I have tried to upgrade to Selenium 3.0.1 with Selenium-standalone, however it does not work for me. I had to roll back to Selenium 2.53.1.

column3: Safari Technology Preview starts with No available window
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Mac OS X Sierra 10.12.3 Selenium Version:   selenium-webdriver@3.1.0 Browser:   Safari Technology Preview Browser Version:   release 24  ## Expected Behavior - Test starts in browser.  ## Actual Behavior - Browser starts with no available windows ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17174214/23504925/1e2c82c4-ff4a-11e6-94b9-e4d5c14f2dc8.png)  ## Steps to reproduce -  Test.js file:  ``` let wd = require('selenium-webdriver'); let test = require('selenium-webdriver/testing'); let safari = require('selenium-webdriver/safari'); let opts = new safari.Options(); opts.setTechnologyPreview(true); let caps = opts.toCapabilities(); let driver = new wd.Builder().withCapabilities(caps).build();  test.describe('Test', function () {      test.before(() => driver.manage().timeouts().implicitlyWait(120000)         .then(() => driver.manage().timeouts().pageLoadTimeout(120000))         .then(() => driver.manage().timeouts().setScriptTimeout(120000))         .then(() => driver.get('https://www.google.com/'))     );      test.it('Test', () => driver.findElement(wd.By.id('gb_70'))         .then(button => button.click())     );      test.after(() => driver.quit()); }); ```  Run with mocha `mocha -t 60000 Test.js`

column3: No log files
column4: ## Meta - OS:   mac OS X Sierra 10.12.3 Selenium Version:   javascript binding 3.3.0 Browser:   Firefox 52.0.0  ## Expected Behavior - log files appeared in the project root  ## Actual Behavior - can't find the log files  ## Steps to reproduce - ``` let wd = require('selenium-webdriver'); let test = require('selenium-webdriver/testing'); let logging = wd.logging; let prefs = new logging.Preferences(); prefs.setLevel(logging.Type.DRIVER, 0); prefs.setLevel(logging.Type.CLIENT, 0); prefs.setLevel(logging.Type.BROWSER, 0); prefs.setLevel(logging.Type.PERFORMANCE, 0); let caps = wd.Capabilities.firefox(); caps.setLoggingPrefs(prefs); let driver = new wd.Builder().withCapabilities(caps).build();  test.describe('Test', function () {     test.before(() => driver.get('https://www.google.com/'));      test.it('Click button', () => driver.findElement(wd.By.id('gb_70')).click());      test.after(() => driver.quit()); } ```

column3: [Node.js] Unhandled Rejection in checkLegacyResponse() at error.js:505
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Linux 4.4.0-51-generic x86_64 (Travis CI) Selenium Version:   3.0.0 Browser:   chrome  Browser Version:   Google Chrome 54.0.2840.90   ## Expected Behavior -  Should not has Unhandled Rejection  ## Actual Behavior -  Unhandled Rejection at selenium-webdriver/lib/error.js:505  ## Steps to reproduce -  https://travis-ci.org/wechaty/wechaty/jobs/182802278#L3134  ```shell Unhandled Rejection at: Promise Promise {    { WebDriverError: unknown error: Chrome failed to start: was killed   (Driver info: chromedriver=2.25.426924 (649f9b868f6783ec9de71c123212b908bf3b232e),platform=Linux 4.4.0-51-generic x86_64)     at Object.checkLegacyResponse (/home/travis/build/wechaty/wechaty/node_modules/selenium-webdriver/lib/error.js:505:15)     at parseHttpResponse (/home/travis/build/wechaty/wechaty/node_modules/selenium-webdriver/lib/http.js:509:13)     at doSend.then.response (/home/travis/build/wechaty/wechaty/node_modules/selenium-webdriver/lib/http.js:440:13)     at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:103:7) name: 'WebDriverError' } } reason: { WebDriverError: unknown error: Chrome failed to start: was killed ```  P.S. This exception often appears in my CI tests. I checked many times to confirm that I do all the `catch` work for promises in my code.

column3: Selenium Grid 3.0 is closing browser
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Linux Selenium Version:   3.0.1 Browser:   Chrome  Browser Version:   Google Chrome 54.0.2840.100   ## Expected Behavior -  ## Actual Behavior -  ## Steps to reproduce - Run your tests on the Hub picking Chrome browser and doing some findElements using Xpath instead of CSS selector  The result would be:  ``` org.openqa.selenium.remote.UnreachableBrowserException: Error communicating with the remote browser. It may have died. Build info: version: '3.0.1', revision: '1969d75', time: '2016-10-18 09:49:13 -0700' System info: host: 'MP19779.local', ip: '10.244.250.81', os.name: 'Mac OS X', os.arch: 'x86_64', os.version: '10.11.6', java.version: '1.8.0_111' Driver info: driver.version: RemoteWebDriver Capabilities [{applicationCacheEnabled=false, rotatable=false, mobileEmulationEnabled=false, networkConnectionEnabled=false, chrome={chromedriverVersion=2.25.426924 (649f9b868f6783ec9de71c123212b908bf3b232e), userDataDir=/tmp/.org.chromium.Chromium.z0eB6N}, takesHeapSnapshot=true, pageLoadStrategy=normal, databaseEnabled=false, handlesAlerts=true, hasTouchScreen=true, version=54.0.2840.100, platform=LINUX, browserConnectionEnabled=false, nativeEvents=true, acceptSslCerts=true, webdriver.remote.sessionid=27dd808a-8a8d-4e5d-aa7e-88697d130b84, locationContextEnabled=true, webStorageEnabled=true, browserName=chrome, takesScreenshot=true, javascriptEnabled=true, cssSelectorsEnabled=true}] Session ID: 27dd808a-8a8d-4e5d-aa7e-88697d130b84      at org.openqa.selenium.remote.RemoteWebDriver.execute(RemoteWebDriver.java:622)     at org.openqa.selenium.remote.RemoteWebDriver.findElements(RemoteWebDriver.java:393)     at org.openqa.selenium.remote.RemoteWebDriver.findElementsByCssSelector(RemoteWebDriver.java:469)     at org.openqa.selenium.By$ByCssSelector.findElements(By.java:441)     at org.openqa.selenium.remote.RemoteWebDriver.findElements(RemoteWebDriver.java:356)     at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor9.invoke(Unknown Source)     at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)     at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)     at org.openqa.selenium.remote.Augmenter$CompoundHandler.intercept(Augmenter.java:189)     at org.openqa.selenium.remote.RemoteWebDriver$$EnhancerByCGLIB$$b074229.findElements() ```  I think such issue shouldn't kill your browser. But the browser dies, when I've figured it out and fixed my By.xpath it stopped killing my browser at all :)

column3: Documentation for executeScript is incorrect - it can (correctly) return a Map
Grid Node timeout value differs from value set on the hub
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Latest Docker Image Selenium Version:   3.0.1 Browser:   Chrome Browser Version:   53.0.2785.101-1  ## Expected Behavior - timeout value on node matches the timeout value set for hub. So if hub timeout is set to 300000, I expect the node timeout to also be 300000.  ## Actual Behavior - timeout value for each node on the grid intermittently shows 1800 even though I set the timeout on the hub to 300000. ## Steps to reproduce - **On Grid console page on each node I see the following configuration (note the timeout value)** browserTimeout: 900000 debug: false help: false jettyMaxThreads: -1 port: 5555 role: node **timeout: 1800** _(should be 300000)_ cleanUpCycle: 5000 host: 659103bcc9f9 maxSession: 1 capabilities: Capabilities [{seleniumProtocol=WebDriver, browserName=chrome, maxInstances=1, platform=LINUX}] hub: http://hub:4444/grid/register id: http://659103bcc9f9:5555 hubHost: hub hubPort: 4444 nodeStatusCheckTimeout: 5000 proxy: org.openqa.grid.selenium.proxy.DefaultRemoteProxy register: true registerCycle: 5000 remoteHost: http://659103bcc9f9:5555  **On the same grid console page, clicking on view config link, I can see the hub has the correct values including value for timeout.** Config for the hub : browserTimeout : 900000 debug : false help : false jettyMaxThreads : -1 port : 4444 role : hub timeout : 300000 cleanUpCycle : 5000 host : 10.255.0.5 maxSession : 1 hubConfig : /opt/selenium/config.json capabilityMatcher : org.openqa.grid.internal.utils.DefaultCapabilityMatcher newSessionWaitTimeout : -1 throwOnCapabilityNotPresent : true Config details : hub launched with : -browserTimeout 900000 -debug false -help false -jettyMaxThreads -1 -port 4444 -role hub -timeout 300000 -cleanUpCycle 5000 -host 10.255.0.5 -maxSession 1 -hubConfig /opt/selenium/config.json -capabilityMatcher org.openqa.grid.internal.utils.DefaultCapabilityMatcher -newSessionWaitTimeout -1 -throwOnCapabilityNotPresent true the final configuration comes from : the default : browserTimeout : 0 debug : false help : false jettyMaxThreads : -1 role : hub timeout : 1800 cleanUpCycle : 5000 maxSession : 1 capabilityMatcher : org.openqa.grid.internal.utils.DefaultCapabilityMatcher newSessionWaitTimeout : -1 throwOnCapabilityNotPresent : true  **updated with params :** browserTimeout : 900000 debug : false help : false jettyMaxThreads : -1 role : hub **timeout : 300000** cleanUpCycle : 5000 maxSession : 1 capabilityMatcher : org.openqa.grid.internal.utils.DefaultCapabilityMatcher newSessionWaitTimeout : -1 throwOnCapabilityNotPresent : true

column3: Opera browser in Selenium grid: Driver class not found
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Host: Windows 8.1 Enterprise 64 bit Node and the Hub: Windows 7 Enterprise 32 bit service pack 1 Selenium Version:   selenium-server-standalone-3.3.1.jar Browser:   Opera Browser Version:   44.0.2510.1159 (PGO)  32 bit  ## Expected Behavior - Initialize opera driver and be able to run tests ## Actual Behavior - Driver class not found: com.opera.core.systems.OperaDriver ## Steps to reproduce -  I'm trying to setup an environment with Selenium grid to execute my Selenium test on a remote machine. The only browser I can`t get to work is Opera. I configured it the same as the other browsers. However the node shows a Driver class not found.  On the host opera is installed, the opera webdriver is in C:/GUI-Tests/Drivers/operadriver.exe, the stacktrace of the error is: ``` 13:30:37.169 INFO - Driver class not found: com.opera.core.systems.OperaDriver 13:30:37.169 INFO - Driver provider com.opera.core.systems.OperaDriver registration is skipped: Unable to create new instances on this machine. 13:30:37.178 INFO - Driver class not found: com.opera.core.systems.OperaDriver 13:30:37.178 INFO - Driver provider com.opera.core.systems.OperaDriver is not registered ```  Starting the hub: `java -jar selenium-server-standalone-3.3.1.jar -role hub -hubConfig hubConfig.json` My Hub config: ``` {   "host": ip,   "maxSessions": 5,   "port": 4444,   "cleanupCycle": 5000,   "timeout": 300000,   "newSessionWaitTimeout": -1,   "servlets": [],   "prioritizer": null,   "capabilityMatcher": "org.openqa.grid.internal.utils.DefaultCapabilityMatcher",   "throwOnCapabilityNotPresent": true,   "nodePolling": 180000,   "platform": "WINDOWS" }  ``` Starting the node: `java -jar selenium-server-standalone-3.3.1.jar -role node -nodeConfig nodeConfig.json` My node config file:   ``` {   "capabilities":   [ 	{ 	  "browserName": "opera", 	  "platform": "WINDOWS", 	  "maxInstances": 5, 	  "seleniumProtocol": "WebDriver", 	  "webdriver.opera.driver": "C:/GUI-Tests/Drivers/operadriver.exe" 	}   ],   "proxy": "org.openqa.grid.selenium.proxy.DefaultRemoteProxy",   "maxSession": 1,   "port": 5555,   "register": true,   "registerCycle": 5000,   "hub": "http://localhost:4444",   "nodeStatusCheckTimeout": 5000,   "nodePolling": 5000,   "role": "node",   "unregisterIfStillDownAfter": 60000,   "downPollingLimit": 2,   "debug": false,   "servlets" : [],   "withoutServlets": [],   "custom": {} } ```

column3: Python webdriver, ActionChains.perform action raises a exception
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Debian 9.0 Selenium Version:   Selenium Webdriver 3.3.1 python bindings Browser:   Firefox 52.0.1 (64-bit) with geckodriver 0.14.0  ## Expected Behavior - The code will trigger browser interaction -- hover over an autocomplete field  ## Actual Behavior - The following traceback is triggered  ```Traceback (most recent call last):   File "add_a_channel.py", line 78, in test_add_a_channel     hover.perform()   File "/home/avolkov/.virtualenvs/selenium/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/common/action_chains.py", line 77, in perform     self.w3c_actions.perform()   File "/home/avolkov/.virtualenvs/selenium/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/common/actions/action_builder.py", line 76, in perform     self.driver.execute(Command.W3C_ACTIONS, enc)   File "/home/avolkov/.virtualenvs/selenium/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py", line 238, in execute     self.error_handler.check_response(response)   File "/home/avolkov/.virtualenvs/selenium/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/errorhandler.py", line 193, in check_response     raise exception_class(message, screen, stacktrace) WebDriverException: Message: Missing or invalid type argument for pointer action ```  ## Steps to reproduce - Run the following code over any input field.  ``` autocomplete = driver.find_element_by_name("source_id__autocomplete") hover = webdriver.ActionChains(driver).move_to_element(autocomplete) hover.perform() ```

column3: Cannot Build Using "go" for 3.0.1
column4: ## Meta - OS:   CentOS 6.6 Selenium Version:   3.0.1  Build Script Error  ## Expected Behavior - Build Success.  ## Actual Behavior - BUILD FAILED: //java/server/src/org/openqa/selenium/remote/server:server:uber must contain exactly one colon (found 2)   ## Steps to reproduce - ./go //java/server/src/org/openqa/selenium/remote/server:server:uber //java/client/src/org/openqa/selenium:client-combined:uber  java -version shows: openjdk version "1.8.0_111" OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_111-b15) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.111-b15, mixed mode)

column4: ## Meta - OS:   centos 6 Selenium Version:   3.3.1 Browser:   firefox Browser Version:    45.8.0  ## Expected Behavior - 10 ## Actual Behavior - Traceback (most recent call last):   File "test.py", line 22, in      print driver.execute_script("return roger;")   File "/netShare/home/buildsystem/Desktop/virgile/TEST/SELENIUM/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py", line 467, in execute_script     'args': converted_args})['value']   File "/netShare/home/buildsystem/Desktop/virgile/TEST/SELENIUM/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py", line 238, in execute     self.error_handler.check_response(response)   File "/netShare/home/buildsystem/Desktop/virgile/TEST/SELENIUM/selenium/webdriver/remote/errorhandler.py", line 193, in check_response     raise exception_class(message, screen, stacktrace) selenium.common.exceptions.WebDriverException: Message: ReferenceError: roger is not defined ## Steps to reproduce - // add firefox geckodriver folder to the path  // index.html        test            toto      // test.py from selenium import webdriver from selenium.webdriver.firefox.firefox_binary import FirefoxBinary from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait from selenium.w    ebdriver.common.keys import Keys from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By from selenium.webdriver.common.action_chains import ActionChains from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC from selenium.common.exceptions import TimeoutException  import os import subprocess import time  driver = webdriver.Chrome() driver.get("file:///path/to/index.html") time.sleep(5) print driver.execute_script("return roger;")  driver.close()  // commande  python test.py

column3: javascript/atoms/test/type_test.html fails in Firefox 51
column4: ## Meta - OS:   all of them Selenium Version:   n/a, it's pure JS Browser:   Firefox Browser Version:   51+  ## Expected Behavior - The test should pass.  ## Actual Behavior - The test throws a "Cannot set the selection end" error when trying to type into a `` element.  Firefox 51+ returns null for the element's `selectionStart` and `selectionEnd` properties. Not sure whether that's a Firefox bug, or if it's intentional behavior that the atoms now need to account for somehow.  ## Steps to reproduce - `./go debug-server` and then visit http://localhost:2310/javascript/atoms/test/type_test.html in a browser.

column3: Selenium 3.0.2 and Firefox 50.0.1 Still cannot work together?
column4: ## Meta - OS:   ```FreeBSD 12-CURRENT``` Selenium Version:   ```./geckodriver -V geckodriver 0.11.1  The source code of this program is available at https://github.com/mozilla/geckodriver.  This program is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public License 2.0. You can obtain a copy of the license at https://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/. ```  ``` me@blubee:~/bin % pip list | grep selenium selenium (3.0.2) ```  Browser:   ```firefox-50.1.0_4,1    Web browser based on the browser portion of Mozilla```  ## Expected Behavior - launch Firefox, run tests?  ## Actual Behavior - Firefox fails to launch with this error message ``` d = webdriver.Firefox() ``` or ``` >>> caps = DesiredCapabilities.FIREFOX >>> caps["marionette"] = True >>> caps["binary"] = "/usr/home/blubee/bin/firefox" >>> d = webdriver.Firefox(capabilities = caps) ``` both leads to this error ``` Traceback (most recent call last):   File "", line 1, in    File "/home/blubee/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/firefox/webdriver.py", line 150, in __init__     keep_alive=True)   File "/home/blubee/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py", line 92, in __init__     self.start_session(desired_capabilities, browser_profile)   File "/home/blubee/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py", line 179, in start_session     response = self.execute(Command.NEW_SESSION, capabilities)   File "/home/blubee/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py", line 236, in execute     self.error_handler.check_response(response)   File "/home/blubee/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/errorhandler.py", line 192, in check_response     raise exception_class(message, screen, stacktrace) ```  I downloaded the geckodriver from github and placed it in my path and I have one of the latest versions of firefox, I still get this error.  ## Steps to reproduce - try to create a firefox webdriver in python.  I've looked at the code, in line 192 of ```.../selenium/webdriver/remote/errorhandler.py``` and I don't see anything too unusual, so I am not sure what to do next.

column3: Unable to run Selenium test cases with HTMLLauncher and Chrome
column4: ## Meta - OS:   - MacOS 10.11.6  Selenium Version:   - IDE: 2.9.1  Browser:   - Chrome - Firefox   Browser Version:   - Chrome 55.0.2883.87 (64-bit) - Firefox 50.0.2   ## Expected Behavior - - The command succeed and i see my test running ## Actual Behavior - - Error is thrown   So, firstly I want to apologise if this is been discussed anywhere else or what I'm trying to achieve is not possible at all. Im trying to run Firefox's Selenium IDE generated tests, exported as html files, from command line, using `chromedriver` and Chrome as a test browser. This is the command im running: `java -Dwebdriver.gecko.driver=/usr/local/bin/chromedriver -jar 'selenium-html-runner-3.0.1.jar' -htmlSuite '*chrome' 'http://localhost:3000/fluid' 'my-test-file.html' 'results.html'`  When i run that i can see Chrome is being open for ~1sec and then closed when i got the error looking like that: ``` Multi-window mode is longer used as an option and will be ignored. Starting ChromeDriver 2.25.426935 (820a95b0b81d33e42712f9198c215f703412e1a1) on port 14654 Only local connections are allowed. Dec 12, 2016 11:45:51 AM org.openqa.selenium.remote.ProtocolHandshake createSession INFO: Attempting bi-dialect session, assuming Postel's Law holds true on the remote end Dec 12, 2016 11:45:52 AM org.openqa.selenium.remote.ProtocolHandshake createSession INFO: Detected dialect: OSS 2016-12-12 11:45:52.988:INFO::main: Logging initialized @2358ms 2016-12-12 11:45:53.040:INFO:osjs.Server:main: jetty-9.2.z-SNAPSHOT 2016-12-12 11:45:53.055:INFO:osjsh.ContextHandler:main: Started o.s.j.s.h.ContextHandler@5c6648b0{/tests,null,AVAILABLE} 2016-12-12 11:45:53.074:INFO:osjs.ServerConnector:main: Started ServerConnector@3e694b3f{HTTP/1.1}{0.0.0.0:6067} 2016-12-12 11:45:53.074:INFO:osjs.Server:main: Started @2444ms 2016-12-12 11:45:53.545:INFO:osjs.ServerConnector:main: Stopped ServerConnector@3e694b3f{HTTP/1.1}{0.0.0.0:6067} 2016-12-12 11:45:53.546:INFO:osjsh.ContextHandler:main: Stopped o.s.j.s.h.ContextHandler@5c6648b0{/tests,null,UNAVAILABLE} Dec 12, 2016 11:45:53 AM org.openqa.selenium.server.htmlrunner.HTMLLauncher mainInt WARNING: Test of browser failed: *chrome java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to find suite table:   Error 404    HTTP ERROR: 404 Problem accessing /tests/. Reason:     Not Found Powered by Jetty://    	at org.openqa.selenium.server.htmlrunner.HTMLLauncher.runHTMLSuite(HTMLLauncher.java:118) 	at org.openqa.selenium.server.htmlrunner.HTMLLauncher.mainInt(HTMLLauncher.java:245) 	at org.openqa.selenium.server.htmlrunner.HTMLLauncher.main(HTMLLauncher.java:273) ``` Did some digging, i found its failing around [these lines](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/java/server/src/org/openqa/selenium/server/htmlrunner/HTMLLauncher.java#L120), but no idea why ...   General questions: - Am i missing some installation steps - Are my Selenium and Chrome versions compatible - If yes, what can i do to tackle this issue

column3: Timeouts with selenium grid (Linux/Firefox)

column3: Save downloads to shared storage
column4: ## Meta - OS:    Windows 7 Selenium Version:    2.53.1, IDE, etc Browser:    Chrome ------------------------ Hello,  I'm using Selenium Grid and been trying to download some files from different websites, zipping them and uploading to S3.. I was trying to understand how this can be possible since the hub sends the selenium tasks to a node where I don't have control over.  I've encountered this Issue: https://github.com/seleniumhq/selenium-google-code-issue-archive/issues/5886  and on comment #5 the author of the comment writes:  "Another option would be to save donwloads to some shared storage (NFS, S3, what have you)."   I've tried to search about saving the download to an S3 storage but with no luck of finding any refrences..  Any ideas?  Thanks.

column3: Some sessions abandoned after loading the Log in page in Internet Explorer-11 using with Selenium 2.53.1 Grid version
column4: ## Meta - OS:    Windows 7 Selenium Version:    2.53.1 Browser:   Internet Explorer-11  I am using Selenium Grid with following configuration in pom.xml file: parallel - classes threadCount - 2 forkcount-0  I have a 8 core machine with 16 GB RAM. There is no issue with IE sessions - opened 16 sessions at a time, but 3 or 4 sessions staying in Login page once it entered URL.  Browser Version:    IE-11 (64-bit)  ## Expected Behavior - All the sessions it should execute whatever story assigned to them  ## Actual Behavior - Some of the sessions staying in Log-in page ## Steps to reproduce - Execute scripts with Selenium Grid using 2.53.1 Version in IE-11 browser

column3: contextClick() freezes in Microsoft Edge.
column4: ## Meta - OS:    Windows 10 Version 1607 Build 14393.693 Selenium Version:    2.53.0 Browser:   Microsoft Edge   Browser Version:   38.14393.0.0  ## Expected Behavior - Right click action should finish and browser window should close. ## Actual Behavior - Right click action is done, but the execution freezes. When I manually click somewhere else in the browser, it continues as expected. ## Steps to reproduce - `System.setProperty("webdriver.edge.driver",	"C:\\Workspaces\\MicrosoftWebDriver.exe");`  `WebDriver driver = new EdgeDriver();`  `driver.navigate().to("http://www.google.com");`  `new Actions(driver).contextClick(driver.findElement(By.id("lst-ib"))).build().perform();`  `if (driver != null) {` 	`driver.close();`   ` }`

column3: Selenium Webdriver Gem doesn't play nice with RSpec "all" matchers
column4: ## Meta - OS:    Selenium Version:  2.53.4  Browser:  Irrespective (I used Chrome)   Browser Version:  Irrespective (I used latest Chrome)   ## Expected Behavior - When asking RSpec to perform `all` matching tests. They run and pass/fail accordingly ## Actual Behavior - The following the error is thrown ``` Selenium::WebDriver::Error::InvalidSelectorError: invalid selector: An invalid or illegal selector was specified   (Session info: chrome=56.0.2924.87)   (Driver info: chromedriver=2.24.417431 (9aea000394714d2fbb20850021f6204f2256b9cf),platform=Windows NT 6.1.7601 SP1 x86_64) ``` ## Steps to reproduce - Try and perform one of the following inline tests `expect(['23 apr 2017','23 apr 2017','23 apr 2017','23 apr 2017']).to all eq('23 apr 2017')` `expect(['23 apr 2017','23 apr 2017','23 apr 2017','23 apr 2017']).to all include('23 apr 2017')` `expect([1, 3, 5]).to all( be < 10 )` `expect([1, 3, 5]).to all( be_odd.and be < 10 )`

column3: Not able to send data through nodeConfig.json
column4: ## Meta - OS:    Selenium Version:   3.0.1 Browser:   All  Browser Version:     ## Expected Behavior -  ## Actual Behavior -  ## Steps to reproduce - {   "capabilities":   [     {       "browserName": "firefox",       "maxInstances": 0,       "seleniumProtocol": "WebDriver"     },     {       "browserName": "chrome",       "maxInstances": 1,       "seleniumProtocol": "WebDriver"     },     {       "browserName": "internet explorer",       "maxInstances": 0,       "seleniumProtocol": "WebDriver"     }   ],   "proxy": "com.selenium.security.GenericRemoteProxy",   "maxSession": 5,   "port": 5555,   "register": true,   "registerCycle": 60000,   "hub": "http://localhost:4444",   "nodeStatusCheckTimeout": 5000,   "nodePolling": 5000,   "role": "node",   "unregisterIfStillDownAfter": 60000,   "downPollingLimit": 2,   "debug": false,   "servlets" : ["com.selenium.servlet.node.NodeShutDownServlet"],   "withoutServlets": [],   "custom"	: { 		 "extraConfig": {       "testMachine": {         "ipAddress": "localhost",         "hostName": "jtjohny",         "macAddress": "A4-17-31-65-0B-77",         "platform": "win10"       },       "webDriverArray": [         {           "excelPropertyIID": "ERS_RESKIN",           "moduleIID": "ERS_RESKIN",           "isActive" : true,           "driverConfig": {             "webDriverPlatform": "DESKTOP",             "driverPath": "setup\\driver\\chromedriver.exe",             "acceptSSLCerts": true,             "browserName": "chrome",             "webDriverType": "CHROME_DRIVER",             "isDeleteCookies": true,             "isDisableAllPlugins": true,             "hubURL": "http://localhost:4444/wd/hub",             "testPlatform": "CHROME"           }         }       ]     } }  	   }     --That is my nodeConfig.json being passed as -nodeConfig parameter to GridLauncherV3.Main(args) The problem is that i am not able to send data inside custom object which i need my hub server end code to detect and process the request. The exception is as follows:-     org.openqa.grid.common.exception.GridConfigurationException: Error with the JSON of the config : java.lang.IllegalStateException: Expected STRING but was BEGIN_OBJECT 	at org.openqa.grid.internal.utils.configuration.GridNodeConfiguration.loadFromJSON(GridNodeConfiguration.java:311) 	at org.openqa.grid.internal.utils.configuration.GridNodeConfiguration.loadFromJSON(GridNodeConfiguration.java:287) 	at org.openqa.grid.selenium.GridLauncherV3$3.setConfiguration(GridLauncherV3.java:261) 	at org.openqa.grid.selenium.GridLauncherV3.buildLauncher(GridLauncherV3.java:147) 	at org.openqa.grid.selenium.GridLauncherV3.main(GridLauncherV3.java:73) 	at com.selenium.client.TestClientLauncher.main(TestClientLauncher.java:28)   How can i send extra data through from the node to hub end?

If the issue is with Google Chrome consider logging an issue with chromedriver instead: https://sites.google.com/a/chromium.org/chromedriver/help  If the issue is with Microsoft Edge consider logging an issue with Microsoft instead: https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/platform/issues/  If the issue is with Firefox GeckoDriver (aka Marionette) consider logging an issue with Mozilla: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/buglist.cgi?product=Testing&component=Marionette  If the issue is with Safari, only Safari 10+ is supported. Please log any Safari issue with Apple: https://bugreport.apple.com/  If the issue is with PhantomJS consider logging an issue with Ghostdriver: https://github.com/detro/ghostdriver  -->  Browser Version:     ## Expected Behavior -  ## Actual Behavior -  ## Steps to reproduce -

column3: If an input is disabled, WebElement.sendKeys() should throw InvalidElementStateException
column4: ## Meta - OS:   Selenium Version:  3.0.1  Browser:  Firefox   Browser Version:  50.1.0   ## Steps to reproduce -  I have this form with **all its input elements disabled** :  ```  Your name        ```  I have an EventListener class that implements WebDriverEventListener  ``` public class EventListener implements WebDriverEventListener { 	public void onException(Throwable error, WebDriver driver) { 		if(error instanceof InvalidElementStateException) 			System.err.println("I've got an exception"); 	} } ```   I register my listener to my webdriver wrapped in an EventFiringWebDriver instance :  ``` EventFiringWebDriver eventDriver = new EventFiringWebDriver(driver); EventListener listener = new EventListener(); eventDriver.register(listener); ```  In my test script I have :  ``` WebElement element;  element = eventDriver.findElement(By.name("name")); element.sendKeys("xxxxx");  element = eventDriver.findElement(By.name("button")); element.click(); ```  ## Expected Behavior - Since both elements are disabled, I should get this message **twice** : `I've got an exception`  ## Actual Behavior - I get the message only **once**. I get it when I try to click the disabled button.  The WebElement.click() method throws InvalidElementStateException. **(OK)** The WebElement.sendKeys() method doesn't throw any exception. **(BUG)**  WebElement.sendKeys() should throw an exception if the element is disabled.

column3: Selenium 3.0.1 - html-runner not able to find test suite (URL form)
column4: ## Meta - OS:   - Windows 7   Selenium Version:    - selenium-server-standalone-3.0.1 & selenium-html-runner-3.0.1    Browser:    - Firefox    Browser Version:    - Firefox 51.0    ## Expected Behavior -  - See my suite running  ## Actual Behavior -  - Errors is thrown  I'm trying to run my suite on Firefox, according to this issue [https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/issues/2706](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/issues/2706) I struggled some days and figured out that I need to launch the standalone server, then I'm able to feed the html-runner with an URL suite source so that I won't get an error message of Address already in use. However, now I get new error message said that the html runner is not able to find my suite  This is the commands and the content of mySuite.html I'm running:  Server: `java -jar "D:\JAVA\selenium-java-3.0.1\selenium-server-standalone-3.0.1.jar"`  Htmlrunner: `java -jar "D:\JAVA\selenium-java-3.0.1\selenium-html-runner-3.0.1.jar" -htmlSuite "*firefox" http://targetwebpage "http://localhost:4444/mySuite.html" "D:\JAVA\selenium-java-3.0.1\result"`  mySuite.html: ```          Test Suite    Test Suite 172.21.128.191_8090 172.21.128.191_8100 172.21.128.191_8110 172.21.128.191_8120 172.21.128.191_8130 172.21.128.191_8140 172.21.128.191_8150 172.21.128.191_8160 172.21.128.192_8090 172.21.128.192_8100 172.21.128.192_8110 172.21.128.192_8120 172.21.128.192_8130 172.21.128.192_8140 172.21.128.192_8150 172.21.128.192_8160 172.21.128.209_8090 172.21.128.209_8100 172.21.128.209_8110 172.21.128.209_8120 172.21.128.209_8130 172.21.128.209_8140 172.21.128.209_8150 172.21.128.209_8160 172.21.128.210.8090 172.21.128.210_8100 172.21.128.210_8110 172.21.128.210_8120 172.21.128.210_8130 172.21.128.210_8140 172.21.128.210_8150 172.21.128.210_8160    ````  And I got the following error messages: ``` äºŒæœˆ 06, 2017 4:42:12 ä¸‹åˆ org.openqa.selenium.remote.ProtocolHandshake createSe ssion è³‡è¨Š: Detected dialect: W3C [Child 708] ###!!! ABORT: Aborting on channel error.: file c:/builds/moz2_slave/ m-rel-w32-00000000000000000000/build/src/ipc/glue/MessageChannel.cpp, line 2056 äºŒæœˆ 06, 2017 4:42:14 ä¸‹åˆ org.openqa.selenium.os.UnixProcess destroy åš´é‡: Unable to kill process with PID 9172 äºŒæœˆ 06, 2017 4:42:14 ä¸‹åˆ org.openqa.selenium.server.htmlrunner.HTMLLauncher ma inInt è­¦å‘Š: Test of browser failed: *firefox java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to find suite table:                 Selenium Standalone v.3.0.1                Selenium StandaloneÂ v.3.0.1      ... ```  I put my suite, related test files (htmls), geckodriver, standalone server jar and html runner jar in same directory.   Questions:  - Where should I put my suite and related test files so the html-runner could find and run them successfully?  - Or if there exist any mistakes in my steps, please let me know so I can correct it  Thanks for the spent time and patient in advance.    ## Ps : My previous commands and the following address already used error message:  Only run html-runner with the command: `java -jar "D:\JAVA\selenium-java-3.0.1\selenium-html-runner-3.0.1.jar" -htmlSuite "*firefox" http://targetwebpage "D:\JAVA\selenium-java-3.0.1\mySuite.html" "D:\JAVA\selenium-java-3.0.1\result"`  Address already in use error message: ``` 2017-02-06 17:03:29.788:INFO:osjs.Server:main: Started @2821ms 2017-02-06 17:03:29.790:INFO:osjs.ServerConnector:main: Stopped ServerConnector@ 49e53c76{HTTP/1.1}{0.0.0.0:26580} 2017-02-06 17:03:29.791:INFO:osjsh.ContextHandler:main: Stopped o.s.j.s.h.Contex tHandler@52e6fdee{/tests,null,UNAVAILABLE} [Child 2264] ###!!! ABORT: Aborting on channel error.: file c:/builds/moz2_slave /m-rel-w32-00000000000000000000/build/src/ipc/glue/MessageChannel.cpp, line 2056  äºŒæœˆ 06, 2017 5:03:31 ä¸‹åˆ org.openqa.selenium.os.UnixProcess destroy åš´é‡: Unable to kill process with PID 12128 äºŒæœˆ 06, 2017 5:03:31 ä¸‹åˆ org.openqa.selenium.server.htmlrunner.HTMLLauncher ma inInt è­¦å‘Š: Test of browser failed: *firefox java.io.IOException: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.net.BindException: Address  already in use: JVM_Bind         at org.openqa.selenium.server.htmlrunner.HTMLLauncher.determineSuiteUrl( HTMLLauncher.java:180)         at org.openqa.selenium.server.htmlrunnerHTMLLauncher.runHTMLSuite(HTMLL auncher.java:108)         at org.openqa.selenium.server.htmlrunner.HTMLLaun>her.mainInt(HTMLLaunch er.java:245)         at org.openqa.selenium.server.htmlrunner.HTMLLauncher.main(HTMLLauncher. java:273) Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.net.BindException: Address already i n use: JVM_Bind         at org.openqa.selenium.net.PortProber.pollPort(PortProber.java:154)         at org.openqa.selenium.net.PortProber.pollPort(PortProber.java:137)         at org.openqa.selenium.server.htmlrunner.HTMLLauncher.determineSuiteUrl( HTMLLauncher.java:174)         ... 3 more Caused by: java.net.BindException: Address already in use: JVM_Bind ```    ## Steps to reproduce -  - put suite, all test files, geckodriver, standalone server and html runner in same directory   [http://imgur.com/a/ojOA1](http://imgur.com/a/ojOA1)  - launch the standalone server   [http://imgur.com/a/Wv6Ze](http://imgur.com/a/Wv6Ze)  - run the html-runner command (in another terminal)

column3: is it possible to resize an element(canvas, etc..) using selenium python?
column4: ## Meta - OS: Windows 7 x64 bit Selenium Version: 3.0.2 Python: 3.6.0 Browser: Chrome 55.0.2883.87 m (64-bit)  ## Expected Behavior - canvas element can be changed  ## Actual Behavior - canvas element can not be changed  ## Steps to reproduce -  note that I have an element: "id=canvas" and its default size is 1024*768 now I want to change the size of it to 800*600 using selenium python  method 1: canvas.size['width'] = 800; canvas.size['height'] = 600;  method 2: browser.execute_script('arguments[0].width = 800;', canvas) browser.execute_script('arguments[0].height = 800;', canvas)  both failed.  Why?

column3: Firefox Driver is crashing after multiple times
column4: ## Meta - OS: Windows 7 Service Pack 1 Selenium Version:   2.53.5 Browser:   FireFox 4.3/4.5  I have a test on RobotFramework using Selenium2Library  that is going over 5 video streaming sites (DailyMotion, Metacafe, PornHub, ....), picking up a movie from each one of the sites and playing it 4 times in a row. For each iteration we are Starting a Browser (FireFox in this case), playing the video content and closing it when done to avoid caching symptoms.  There was a Failure in the last 2-3 sites with FireFox 4.3:  > WebDriverException: Message: Can't load the profile. Profile Dir: c:\users\admin\appdata\local\temp\tmpysbcxd\webdriver-py-profilecopy If you specified a log_file in the FirefoxBinary constructor, check it for details.  I searched for it and found this issue reported: [selenium Issue](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/commit/6fc17a0cba238af9d76f5fe6e32f73ac8958c19e)  There was a recommendation as well to switch to Firefox 4.5, but with this this version I got somthing else:  > WebDriverException: Message: Component returned failure code: 0x80570016 (NS_ERROR_XPC_GS_RETURNED_FAILURE) [nsIJSCID.getService] Stacktrace:     at Dispatcher.executeAs/< (file:///c:/users/admin/appdata/local/temp/tmpgkvz0f/webdriver-py-profilecopy/extensions/fxdriver@googlecode.com/components/driver-component.js:9558)     at Resource.prototype.handle (file:///c:/users/admin/appdata/local/temp/tmpgkvz0f/webdriver-py-profilecopy/extensions/fxdriver@googlecode.com/components/driver-component.js:9705)     at Dispatcher.prototype.dispatch (file:///c:/users/admin/appdata/local/temp/tmpgkvz0f/webdriver-py-profilecopy/extensions/fxdriver@googlecode.com/components/driver-component.js:9652)     at WebDriverServer/<.handle (file:///c:/users/admin/appdata/local/temp/tmpgkvz0f/webdriver-py-profilecopy/extensions/fxdriver@googlecode.com/components/driver-component.js:12517)     at createHandlerFunc/< (file:///c:/users/admin/appdata/local/temp/tmpgkvz0f/webdriver-py-profilecopy/extensions/fxdriver@googlecode.com/components/httpd.js:2054)     at ServerHandler.prototype.handleResponse ....   Is it a known issue and fixed with latest versions of Selenium? I didnt upgrade my selenium version right now cause it has issues with FireFox 4.8: [Selenium2Library #686](https://github.com/robotframework/Selenium2Library/issues/686#issuecomment-259368688)  Please advice...  Thanks.

column3: `async`/`await` breaks the control flow
column4: ## Meta - OS: Ubuntu Selenium Version: `2.53.3` or `3.0.0-beta-3` Browser: node Browser Version: `v5.10.1` or `v4.0.0`  ## Bug I was trying to improve `async`/`await` support for Protractor when I ran into a problem with the folllowing test: ```ts describe('async function + control flow', function() {   var val;   var seven;   it('should wait for this it() to finish', async function() {     val = 1;     seven = await webdriver.promise.fulfilled(7);     controlFlow.execute(() => {       return webdriver.promise.delayed(1000).then(() => {         val = seven;     }));   });    it('should have waited for setter in previous it()', function() {     expect(val).toBe(7); // <<------ This fails   }); }); ``` `async`/`await` are being compiled by the typescript compiler in this case, and `jasminewd2` wraps each `it()` block in the control flow, so this test should have worked.  However, the final assertion failed, with `val` still being `1`.  Compiling down to ES6 and stripping out the jasmine/`jasminewd2`, the above translates to the following: ```js var webdriver = require('selenium-webdriver'),     flow = webdriver.promise.controlFlow();  var val;  function runInFlow(fun, name) {   return flow.execute(() => {     return webdriver.promise.fulfilled(fun());   }, name); }  runInFlow(() => {   val = 1;   return new Promise((resolve) => {     resolve(webdriver.promise.fulfilled(7));   }).then((seven) => {     runInFlow(() => {       return webdriver.promise.delayed(1000).then(() => {         val = seven;       });     }, 'set outer');   }); }, 'set inner');  runInFlow(() => {   console.log('RESULT: val = ' + val); // 1, should be 7 }, 'log'); ```  Basically, by putting a webdriver promise inside an ES6 promise inside a webdriver promise, we somehow break the control flow.  This is a problem because `await` compiles down to an ES6 promise, and `async` functions then return those promises.  So if you `await` some webdriver promise, and then wrap the `async` function in the control flow, you will run into this bug (as in the first example).  This means that Protractor users (or any users who wrap blocks of code in the control flow) basically cannot `await` an `element.getText()` command or any other webdriver promise or else everything will become desynchronized.  I know that as per https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/issues/2969 you plan on removing ManagedPromise/the control flow entirely.  But in the mean time, `async` functions are practically unusable, so this seemed worth bringing to your attention.

column3: Python Selenium 3.3.0 breaks with remote_connection.py:480: AttributeError
column4: ## Meta - Language: Python Python Version: 3.4.6 OS:   Linux Selenium Version:   3.3.1 Browser:   Remote Driver w/ Chrome via Sauce Labs Browser Version:   56.0.2924.76  ## Expected Behavior - Don't try to decode a string.  ## Actual Behavior - ```Python /tmp/tox/webui/lib/python3.4/site-packages/webium/base_page.py:63: in open     self._driver.get(self.url) /tmp/tox/webui/lib/python3.4/site-packages/webium/base_page.py:52: in _driver     return get_driver() /tmp/tox/webui/lib/python3.4/site-packages/webium/driver.py:10: in get_driver     _driver_instance = webium.settings.driver_class() /tmp/tox/webui/lib/python3.4/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py:92: in __init__     self.start_session(desired_capabilities, browser_profile) /tmp/tox/webui/lib/python3.4/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py:179: in start_session     response = self.execute(Command.NEW_SESSION, capabilities) /tmp/tox/webui/lib/python3.4/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py:236: in execute     response = self.command_executor.execute(driver_command, params) /tmp/tox/webui/lib/python3.4/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/remote_connection.py:415: in execute     return self._request(command_info[0], url, body=data) ...             if parsed_url.username:                 base64string = base64.b64encode('{0.username}:{0.password}'.format(parsed_url).encode()) >               request.add_header('Authorization', 'Basic {}'.format(base64string).decode()) E               AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'decode'  /tmp/tox/webui/lib/python3.4/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/remote_connection.py:480: AttributeError ```  This issue appears to be introduced by #3622 / 55ed929d64e96c518c89244dd4a6fccc85865fc0, which itself was addressing another string/bytes related issue.  The return of `.format()` is a string, which you have no need to further decode.  Demonstration via the debugger:  ```Python ipdb> type(base64string)  ipdb> type('Basic {}'.format(base64string))   ipdb> hasattr(base64string, 'decode') True ipdb> hasattr('Basic {}'.format(base64string), 'decode') False ```  ## Steps to reproduce - This is probably going to be a problem with every Python3 version (confirmed on 3.4 and 3.6), you can do as follows: ```Python In [1]: from selenium.webdriver.remote import remote_connection In [2]: rc = remote_connection.RemoteConnection('http://user:123-key@123.45.67.89:80/wd/hub/session') In [3]: rc._request('POST', 'http://user:123-key@123.45.67.89:80/wd/hub/session', '{}') --------------------------------------------------------------------------- AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)  in () ----> 1 rc._request('POST', 'http://user:123-key@123.45.67.89:80/wd/hub/session', '{}')  /usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/remote_connection.py in _request(self, method, url, body)     478             if parsed_url.username:     479                 base64string = base64.b64encode('{0.username}:{0.password}'.format(parsed_url).encode()) --> 480                 request.add_header('Authorization', 'Basic {}'.format(base64string).decode())     481      482             if password_manager:  AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'decode' ```  ## Fix - - Remove the unnecessary `.decode()` call

Selenium Wiki Formatter: v1.0.1-signed.1-signed - Separated Values Formatter (Selenium IDE): v1.0.0.1-signed.1-signed - WebDriver Backed Formatters: v1.0.4.1-signed.1-signed - SeLite -- SeLite AutoCheck: v0.12 -- SeLite Clipboard And Indent: v0.23 -- SeLite Commands: v0.98 -- SeLite DB Objects: v0.91 -- SeLite Exit Confirmation Checker: v0.14 -- SeLite Miscellaneous: v1.09 -- SeLite SelBlocks Global: v2.68 -- SeLite Settings: v0.65 -- SeLite SQLite Connection Manager: v0.77 -- SeLite TestCase Debug Context: v0.80 -- SeLite Bootstrap: v0.96 -- SeLite Extension Sequencer: v0.53 -- SeLite Run All Favorites: v0.15  **Aditions information about firefox ide:** Installed firefox plugins: ![2016-12-02_10h22_32_installedplugins](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24313436/20831119/e5217460-b883-11e6-8994-f4793cee85fb.png)  **Selenium IDE Configuration (Menu > Options):** ![2016-12-02_10h24_56_seleniumideconfig1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24313436/20831121/e52473ae-b883-11e6-9e46-8b1313cc4fff.png)  ![2016-12-02_10h25_06_seleniumideconfig2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24313436/20831122/e52641ca-b883-11e6-8a97-63ebc03faf1f.png)  ![2016-12-02_10h25_14_seleniumideconfig3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24313436/20831123/e526a2fa-b883-11e6-81b6-420064c1c83f.png)  ![2016-12-02_10h25_20_seleniumideconfig4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24313436/20831125/e54d41ee-b883-11e6-97a4-b800f40e8e32.png)  ![2016-12-02_10h25_44_seleniumideconfig5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24313436/20831126/e54d8e7e-b883-11e6-83f9-ba34eb8788b4.png)  **I have some JS snippets injected at the beginning of our test suites in a separate test case file:** [ETC_Tenant_StdLib_Core.zip](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/files/626985/ETC_Tenant_StdLib_Core.zip)  ## Expected Behavior - Proper functional Selenium IDE everytime.  ## Actual Behavior - For some time everything around the Selenium IDE works very well, but after some times later - with user actions and also without user actions - there are triggered several unexpected errors in the Selenium IDE for Firefox:  ![2016-12-02_10h11_17](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24313436/20831113/e5097a04-b883-11e6-8e2b-ddf4fbb027f3.png)  ![2016-12-02_10h12_03](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24313436/20831111/e508fa34-b883-11e6-99d0-3dcb8ed4d5f7.png)  If I click on any command line in Selenium IDE window: ![2016-12-02_10h12_25_onclick](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24313436/20831112/e5092450-b883-11e6-8344-1600f92bf89c.png)  If I switch (key press) to the next or previously command line step with the keyboard arrow keys in Selenium IDE window: ![2016-12-02_10h13_16_keypress](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24313436/20831115/e50c0904-b883-11e6-87bb-715160a79fab.png)  If I execute a command line in Selenium IDE window: ![2016-12-02_10h17_11_executecommand](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24313436/20831114/e50bc3c2-b883-11e6-8d66-ba3de8ac123f.png)  After these such errors, the "Target" and "Value" field of command lines are empty and not editable, but the commands works well in browser window: ![2016-12-02_10h14_55](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24313436/20831116/e50c6aa2-b883-11e6-9d57-d8803af69208.png)  **Error console of firefox:** ![2016-12-02_10h34_57_errorconsole](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24313436/20831124/e54ca180-b883-11e6-9b88-29ddf0e702c9.png)  ## Steps to reproduce - For some time everything around the Selenium IDE works very well, but after some times later - with user actions and also without user actions - there are triggered several unexpected errors in the Selenium IDE for Firefox.  See also section "Actual Behavior" before. It's currently not possible for me to reproduce or provoke the described errors.   I don't know really how I can reproduce or provoke the described errors. It seems to me, that the errors appears faster if I have executed my own JS injections in my test suites. But, my JS injections are only default ECMA JS.  ## Workarounds - Currently I must restart the Selenium IDE window and reload the last or new Selenium test suite. Then I have some time to execute or developement without issues until the errors reappears.  Please start investigation an fix these errors, because the described errors are particularly disturbing in our productive operation (execution and also development of test cases).  There are also related tickets of me at other Selenium IDE / addons projects, see:  https://github.com/SeLite/SelBlocksGlobal/issues/6 https://github.com/refactoror/SelBlocks/issues/31  Best regards  Kevin Marco Erler QA at INTERSHOP Communications AG - FullService

column3: "acceptSslCerts" is not working while doing execution using selenium grid.
column4: ## Meta - **OS:**   Hub : Linux 14.04 Node: Windows 7 **Selenium Version:**   3.0.1 **Browser:**   Firefox **Browser Version:**   45  ## Expected Behavior - For HTTPS enabled site, Untrusted ssl certificate exception should be ignored if ACCEPT_SSL_CERTS set to true.   ## Actual Behavior - Tried same code with 2.53.1 and 3.0.1 with same configuration. It works perfectly with 2.53.1 but not working with 3.0.1.  Driver info: org.openqa.selenium.firefox.FirefoxDriver Capabilities [{rotatable=false, raisesAccessibilityExceptions=false, firefoxOptions={args=[], }, appBuildId=20160623154057, version=, platform=XP, proxy={}, command_id=1, specificationLevel=0, **acceptSslCerts=false**, browserVersion=47.0.1, platformVersion=6.1, XULappId={ec8030f7-c20a-464f-9b0e-13a3a9e97384}, browserName=Firefox, takesScreenshot=true, takesElementScreenshot=true, platformName=Windows_NT, device=desktop}] Session ID: 205635d3-1462-41c0-81e5-7f14c1df1804 	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method) 	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(Unknown Source) 	at org.openqa.selenium.remote.http.W3CHttpResponseCodec.decode(W3CHttpResponseCodec.java:42) 	at org.openqa.selenium.remote.HttpCommandExecutor.execute(HttpCommandExecutor.java:163) 	at org.openqa.selenium.remote.service.DriverCommandExecutor.execute(DriverCommandExecutor.java:82) 	at org.openqa.selenium.remote.RemoteWebDriver.execute(RemoteWebDriver.java:601) 	at org.openqa.selenium.remote.RemoteWebDriver.get(RemoteWebDriver.java:322) 	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) 	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) 	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source) 	at org.openqa.selenium.support.events.EventFiringWebDriver$2.invoke(EventFiringWebDriver.java:103) 	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy6.get(Unknown Source) 	at org.openqa.selenium.support.events.EventFiringWebDriver.get(EventFiringWebDriver.java:162) 	at org.openqa.selenium.remote.server.handler.ChangeUrl.call(ChangeUrl.java:40) 	at org.openqa.selenium.remote.server.handler.ChangeUrl.call(ChangeUrl.java:25) 	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source) 	at org.openqa.selenium.remote.server.DefaultSession$1.run(DefaultSession.java:176) 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(Unknown Source) 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source) 	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)  Please find below logs: https://gist.github.com/priyankshah217/d7a8dbb01943ae9f3d22a9ba8924244a  ## Steps to reproduce - ``` public class SeleniumGridTest {     public StringBuffer verificationErrors = new StringBuffer();     private WebDriver driver;     private String baseUrl;      @BeforeClass(alwaysRun = true)     public void setUp() throws Exception {         baseUrl = "https:///#/login";         DesiredCapabilities desiredCapability = DesiredCapabilities.firefox();         desiredCapability.setCapability(CapabilityType.ACCEPT_SSL_CERTS, true);         driver = new RemoteWebDriver(new URL("http://XX.XX.XX.XX:XXXX/wd/hub"), desiredCapability);         driver.manage().timeouts().implicitlyWait(30, TimeUnit.SECONDS);         driver.manage().window().maximize();     }      @Test     public void testIRRule() throws Exception {         driver.get(baseUrl);         driver.findElement(By.id("password")).clear();         driver.findElement(By.id("password")).sendKeys("XXXXX");         driver.findElement(By.id("username")).clear();         driver.findElement(By.id("username")).sendKeys("XXXXX");         driver.findElement(By.tagName("button")).click();     }      @AfterClass(alwaysRun = true)     public void tearDown() throws Exception {         driver.quit();         String verificationErrorString = verificationErrors.toString();         if (!"".equals(verificationErrorString)) {             fail(verificationErrorString);         }     } } ```

 ```         System.out.println("Sucessfully Right clicked on the element");     }      catch (StaleElementReferenceException e)      {         System.out.println("Element is not attached to the page document "                 + e.getStackTrace());     }      catch (NoSuchElementException e)      {         System.out.println("Element " + element + " was not found in DOM "                 + e.getStackTrace());     }      catch (Exception e)      {         System.out.println("Element " + element + " was not clickable "                 + e.getStackTrace()); column3: Using Curb client causes 'RuntimeError: can't modify frozen Array'
column4: ## Meta -  OS: Ubuntu Selenium Version:  3.0.0 ## Expected Behavior -  Users should be able to use the Curb remote client in place of the standard Http client without any trouble. ## Actual Behavior -  Requiring `selenium/webdriver/remote/http/curb.rb` in a file causes a `RuntimeError`. This is a result of style changes made in commit [cccc9fe4a7b4549bb6aa830397f437286b260f21](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/commit/cccc9fe4a7b4549bb6aa830397f437286b260f21). Specifically, the `QUIT_ERRORS` constant in the `Bridge` class was frozen to fit with Rubocop's ["Style/MutableConstants" ](http://www.rubydoc.info/gems/rubocop/RuboCop/Cop/Style/MutableConstant) setting. As a result, when `curb.rb` tries to push `Curl::Err::RecvError` into that constant, the `RuntimeError` is thrown. ## Steps to reproduce -  require `selenium/webdriver/remote/http/curb`.

Thank you for response.**

column3: Removing 'version' from capabilities breaks Selenium Hubs CapabilityMatcher
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  Windows/Linux Selenium Grid  Selenium Version:  3.0.0 Browser:  Firefox Selenium Client ruby 3.0.0 ## Expected Behavior -  When requesting a specific version of a browser e.g. Firefox: 49 I expect the hub to forward the request to a node providing this version. ## Actual Behavior -  The Hub redirects the client to any firefox node disregarding the version specified in the desired capabilities. ## Steps to reproduce -  Make a request using the ruby client against a selenium grid requesting a specific firefox version with `marionette: true`  Participants in this issue:   Specifying `marionette:true` causes the capabilities to call `W3CCapabilities.firefox(opts)` in [Selenium::WebDriver::Remote::Capabilities#L75](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/rb/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/capabilities.rb#L75).  `W3CCapabilites` replaces `version` with `browser_version` in [Selenium::WebDriver::Remote::W3CCapabilities#79](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/rb/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/w3c_capabilities.rb#L79, dropping `version` from the Hash passed as argument.  The `CapabilitiesComparator` builds a [version comparator](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/java/server/src/org/openqa/selenium/remote/server/CapabilitiesComparator.java#L64) that uses the Capabilites key [`version`](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/java/client/src/org/openqa/selenium/remote/CapabilityType.java#L28) when [retrieving the Version](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/java/client/src/org/openqa/selenium/remote/DesiredCapabilities.java#L100).  As this key has been deleted, the hub treats the request as a desired browser `firefox` with an unspecified version, resulting in an arbitrary node with any firefox being returned.  As I am not sure about the best approach how to fix it, I have not yet created any pull request.  My approach to fixing would be to have `DesiredCapabilities.getVersion()` look both into `version` and `browserVersion`, but I am not really familiar with the current code base yet (i.e. is the removed version key really obsolete for all browsers?).

column3: PortProber.pollPort makes a unexpected exception
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  Windows 8.1 Selenium Version:   3.0.1 and 3.0.0 Browser:   Tested on Firefox 48.0.2 and Chrome 53.0.2785.143 m  Browser Version:   Firefox 48.0.2 and Chrome 53.0.2785.143 m ## Expected Behavior -  I'm new to the seleniun code but i think that the pollPort function is there to delay the process until the port is free.  maybe thats the reason why ConnectException has a catch just to ignore this error.  I'm getting the java.net.BindException inside the pollPort, and this error is not threated making the HTML Runner to shut down.  I downloaded the code and created a catch below the ConnectException catch to catch java.net.BindException and ignore it too.  Everything worked well after this, my suite runned and now i'm happy.  Maybe this is a problem for someone else  My java version:  java version "1.8.0_66" Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_66-b18) Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.66-b18, mixed mode) ## Actual Behavior - ## Steps to reproduce -    Just runned a suite inside a html file using the HTML Runner  java -jar selenium-html-runner-3.0.1.jar -htmlSuite "*chrome" "http://xxxx/xxxx/" "D:\xxxxx\xxxx.html" "D:\xxxxx\Results.html"

column3: Selenium 3 Grid Node not shutting down

Start the hub using `java -jar selenium-server-standalone-3.0.0-beta4.jar -role hub -capabilityMatcher org.openqa.grid.internal.utils.DefaultCapabilityMatcher` 2. column3: Calling quit() on FirefoxDriver doesn't release everything when marionette is disabled
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  Windows 7    Selenium Version:  3.0.0-beta4    Browser:   Firefox 46 (using FirefoxDriver with -Dwebdriver.firefox.marionette=false)    Browser Version:  46.0.1   ## Expected Behavior -  When calling `quit()` on `FirefoxDriver` instance, `quit()` method from underlying `CommandExecutor` instance should be invoked instance to release its resource like profile temporary directory. ## Actual Behavior -  `quit()` is never invoked on the `CommandExecutor` instance. ## Steps to reproduce -    Use the debugger, place a breakpoint in `FirefoxDriver$LazyCommandExecutor#quit()`, and invoke `quit()` on the FirefoxDriver instance. Breakpoint is not hit, and temporary directory from Firefox profile is not deleted until the JVM is shutdown.  Problem is that `RemoveWebDriver` invoke `stopClient()` without arguments, but this method is not overriden in `FirefoxDriver`. Only `stopClient(Capabilities desiredCapabilities, Capabilities requiredCapabilities)` is overriden.

column3: Page Load timeout is NOT working in version 3.0 java
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  Windows 7    Selenium Version:  3.0.0 WebDriver    Browser:  Firefox v49 ,chrome v54,IE v11    Browser Version:     ## Expected Behavior -  The driver page load timeout should wait for the prescribed time to load the page. ## Actual Behavior -  The driver page load timeout is not now actually waiting for the prescribed time. Instead it gets closed immediately ## Steps to reproduce - 1. Open https://www.google.co.in/?gws_rd=ssl and start searching for Xpertfeed. 2. Click on the link http://xpertfeed.blogspot.com/ 3. it takes more time to now load the page in the meantime the webdriver closes displaying error in console    INFO: Attempting bi-dialect session, assuming Postel's Law holds true on the remote end    lokakuuta 17, 2016 5:29:18 IP. org.openqa.selenium.remote.ProtocolHandshake createSession    INFO: Detected dialect: OSS

column3: NullPointerException when starting node
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  Windows 10 (virtual machines) Selenium Version:  3.0.0 beta4 Browser:  N/A Browser Version:  N/A ## Expected Behavior -  able to start java -jar selenium-server-standalone-3.0.0-beta4.jar -role node -nodeConfig node.json ## Actual Behavior -  Exception just after "Selenium Grid node is up and ready to register to the hub" and the usage appear: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.openqa.grid.internal.utils.SelfRegisteringRemote.startRegistrationProcess(SelfRegisteringRemote.java:175) at org.openqa.grid.selenium.GridLauncherV3$3.launch(GridLauncherV3.java:271) at org.openqa.grid.selenium.GridLauncherV3.main(GridLauncherV3.java:86) ## Steps to reproduce -  hub.json: {     "port": 4444,     "newSessionWaitTimeout": -1,     "throwOnCapabilityNotPresent": true,     "timeout": 1200000,     "browserTimeout": 120000 }  node.json: {     "capabilities":     [         {             "browserName": "firefox",             "maxInstances": 10,             "seleniumProtocol": "WebDriver"         }     ],     "proxy": "org.openqa.grid.selenium.proxy.DefaultRemoteProxy",     "maxSession": 10,     "timeout": 1200000,     "browserTimeout": 120000,     "port": 5555,     "hub": "http://IP_OF_HUB_MACHINE:4444" }  Run this on 1st machine:  java -jar selenium-server-standalone-3.0.0-beta4.jar -role hub -hubConfig hub.json  Run this on 2nd machine: java -jar elenium-server-standalone-3.0.0-beta4.jar -role node -nodeConfig node.json  NOTE: this was working fine with Selenium 2.53.0, I just altered node.json to remove configuration { ... } as advised in the docs.

column3: Occasional EADDRINUSE by chromedriver causes crash
column4:
## Meta -  OS:  Windows 10 Selenium Version:  3.0.0-beta-2 (NodeJS) Browser:  Chrome Browser Version:  53.0.2785.116 (Official Build) m (32-bit) ## Expected Behavior -  Attempt to resolve connection if possible, or at least allow users to provide their own error handler. ## Actual Behavior -  Unsure if this is a chromedriver issue, selenium webdriver issue or an operator issue. Occasionally during a portion of my tests where I conduct a fair bit of waiting in the form:  ``` // Wait up to 10 seconds for the control to appear driver.wait(Until.elementLocated(By.xpath('/html/body/div[4]/div/div[2]/div/div[2]/div[1]')), 10000).then(function(element) {     expect(element).to.not.be.null;      // Wait up to 10 seconds for the control to disappear     driver.wait(Until.elementIsNotVisible(element), 10000).then(function(element) {         done();     }); }); ```  I receive an error from https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/javascript/node/selenium-webdriver/http/index.js#L238.  Without having delved into the actual implementation, I assume that this code, under the hood, will open many repeat connections to the chromedriver in order to poll for element state. After a while, this eventually causes an `EADDRINUSE` error to be thrown by the above linked error handler, causing the webdriver to stop. This issue does not happen when using firefox. Error in question:  ``` Uncaught Error: EADDRINUSE connect EADDRINUSE 127.0.0.1:57941                                                                                                                                   at ClientRequest. (d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium
ode_modules\selenium-webdriver\http\index.js:238:15)                                                  at Socket.socketErrorListener (_http_client.js:308:9)                                                                                                                                          at emitErrorNT (net.js:1272:8)                                                                                                                                                                 at _combinedTickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:74:11)                                                                                                                                 at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:98:9)                                                                                                                              From: Task: WebElement.getTagName()                                                                                                                                                                at Driver.schedule (d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium
ode_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\webdriver.js:414:17)                                                         at WebElement.schedule_ (d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium
ode_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\webdriver.js:1820:25)                                                   at WebElement.getTagName (d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium
ode_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\webdriver.js:2012:17)                                                  at d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium
ode_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\until.js:282:20                                                                               at d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium
ode_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\webdriver.js:753:14                                                                           at TaskQueue.execute_ (d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium
ode_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:2736:14)                                                       at TaskQueue.executeNext_ (d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium
ode_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:2719:21)                                                   at asyncRun (d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium
ode_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:2642:25)                                                                 at d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium
ode_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:639:7                                                                          From: Task:                                                                                                                                                                             at Timeout.pollCondition [as _onTimeout] (d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium
ode_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:2178:16)                                From: Task: Waiting element to become stale                                                                                                                                                        at ControlFlow.wait (d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium
ode_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:2171:17)                                                         at Driver.wait (d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium
ode_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\webdriver.js:749:29)                                                             at d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium\spec\setup\products\productDetails.spec.js:28:28                                                                                  at ManagedPromise.invokeCallback_ (d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium
ode_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:1315:14)                                           at TaskQueue.execute_ (d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium
ode_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:2736:14)                                                       at TaskQueue.executeNext_ (d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium
ode_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:2719:21)                                                   at asyncRun (d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium
ode_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:2595:27)                                                                 at d:\SVN\Testing	runk\GUITesting\Selenium
ode_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\promise.js:639:7                                            ```  I fixed this issue locally by replacing above error handler with:  ``` request.on('error', function(e) {   if (e.code === 'ECONNRESET' || e.code === 'EADDRINUSE') {     setTimeout(function() {       sendRequest(options, onOk, onError, opt_data, opt_proxy);     }, e.code === 'EADDRINUSE' ? 50 : 15);   } else {     var message = e.message;     if (e.code) {       message = e.code + ' ' + message;     }     onError(new Error(message));   } }); ```  This works fine. If you add a console log above for each retry it retries maybe 5-10 times before it starts working again. This makes me think that the issue is with clogging up the communications (`netstat -a` shows the ports hitting 65535 with requests to the what I can only assume is the chromedriver).  I have tried running chromedriver in verbose mode with logging turned on, there are no events being displayed from within chromedriver to indicate that it is failing.  If this is an issue with chromedriver instead of webdriver please close this and I will see what they have to say on the issue. ## Steps to reproduce -  Can't easily provide as the point at which this occurs is variable, however it always happens inside tests with the above wait-based code.

column3: Selenium Grid Console unable to detect window OS
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  Window 7 Selenium Version:  3 Browser:  not related   FIREFOX 48+ IS ONLY COMPATIBLE WITH GECKODRIVER. Any issue logged here for 48+ will be closed as a duplicate of #2559  If the issue is with Google Chrome consider logging an issue with chromedriver instead: https://sites.google.com/a/chromium.org/chromedriver/help  If the issue is with Microsoft Edge consider logging an issue with Microsoft instead: https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/platform/issues/  If the issue is with Firefox GeckoDriver (aka Marionette) consider logging an issue with Mozilla: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/buglist.cgi?product=Testing&component=Marionette  If the issue is with Safari, only Safari 10+ is supported. Please log any Safari issue with Apple: https://bugreport.apple.com/  If the issue is with PhantomJS consider logging an issue with Ghostdriver: https://github.com/detro/ghostdriver  -->  Browser Version:   Not related ## Expected Behavior -  Grid console able to detect the correct OS ## Actual Behavior -  Grid console is display mixed OS on a window 7 machine ## Steps to reproduce - 1. Having both selenium node and selenium server to connect in localhost 2. Navigate to grid console UI 3. Check on the OS value showed  ![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1460421/19507154/90bcbe40-9603-11e6-8d8d-2ecc6d442b97.PNG)

column3: Ruby: `undefined method `executable_path='` for webdriver 3.0.0
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  Ubuntu 16.10    Selenium Version:  ruby 3.0.0    Browser:  Chrome    Browser Version:  Version 54.0.2840.59    ## Steps to reproduce -  [Download](http://chromedriver.storage.googleapis.com/index.html?path=2.24/) latest chromedriver (2.24) and place it to /tmp/chromedriver Create rb file with this content and run it:  ``` require 'selenium-webdriver' puts Gem.loaded_specs['selenium-webdriver'].version Selenium::WebDriver::Chrome::Service.executable_path = '/tmp/chromedriver' @driver = Selenium::WebDriver.for :chrome ``` ## Expected Behavior -  On selenium-webdriver 2.53.4  ``` 2.53.4 ```  Browser started ## Actual Behavior -  On selenium-webdriver 3.0.0  ``` 3.0.0 undefined method `executable_path=' for Selenium::WebDriver::Chrome::Service:Class (NoMethodError) ```
