column3: selenium.common.exceptions.WebDriverException: Message: Service wires unexpectedly exited.
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  Ubuntu 16.04 Selenium Version:  2.53.6 Browser:  Firefox 49 ## Expected Behavior -  Following https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/issues/2739, I understand the problem and tried to fix it by using geckodriver.  I followed this https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/QA/Marionette/WebDriver to configure. (I had to rename the executable to wires). ## Actual Behavior -  The browser doesn't start.  ``` Traceback (most recent call last):   File "/usr/lib/python3.5/unittest/loader.py", line 428, in _find_test_path     module = self._get_module_from_name(name)   File "/usr/lib/python3.5/unittest/loader.py", line 369, in _get_module_from_name     __import__(name)   File "/home/jmaurice/back-office/backoffice/dashboard/tests.py", line 126, in      d = webdriver.Firefox(capabilities=caps)   File "/home/jmaurice/back-office/venv/lib/python3.5/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/firefox/webdriver.py", line 65, in __init__     self.service.start()   File "/home/jmaurice/back-office/venv/lib/python3.5/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/common/service.py", line 86, in start     self.assert_process_still_running()   File "/home/jmaurice/back-office/venv/lib/python3.5/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/common/service.py", line 99, in assert_process_still_running     % (self.path, return_code) selenium.common.exceptions.WebDriverException: Message: Service wires unexpectedly exited. Status code was: 1 ``` ## Steps to reproduce -  ``` from selenium import webdriver from selenium.webdriver.common.desired_capabilities import DesiredCapabilities  caps = DesiredCapabilities.FIREFOX caps['marionette'] = True caps['binary'] = '/usr/bin/firefox' d = webdriver.Firefox(capabilities=caps) ``` ## Trying to figure out the problem  I didn't see at first but geckodriver created a log (I renamed 'geckodriver' to 'wires' following the link recommendation).  ``` error: Found argument '--webdriver-port' which wasn't expected, or isn't valid in this context  USAGE:      wires --binary   For more information try --help ```  This led me to # https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/issues/2544 and https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/commit/c76917839c868603c9ab494d8aa0e9d600515371, the geckodriver port argument changed from to 'webdriver-port' to 'port', that was edited in version 3 but not in 2.53.  This quick hack seems to do the trick for me, a proper fix is obviously more complicated than that, but that confirms it should be the problem.  ```     # def command_line_args(self):     #     if self.firefox_binary:     #         return ["-b", self.firefox_binary, "--webdriver-port", "%d" % self.port]     #     return ["--webdriver-port", "%d" % self.port]      def command_line_args(self):         if self.firefox_binary:             return ["-b", self.firefox_binary, "--port", "%d" % self.port]         return ["--port", "%d" % self.port] ```

column3: Firefox Driver doesn't clean up /tmp/ profiles
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  Ubuntu 16.04  Selenium Version: Standalone server 3.0.0 Beta 4   Browser:  Firefox  Browser Version:  47.0.1 ## Expected Behavior -  No unused profile directories in anonymous*webdriver-profile ## Actual Behavior -  Lots of unused profile directories. Eventually the VM running the selenium server ran out of disk space. ## Steps to reproduce - 1. Start selenium server: `java -jar selenium-server-standalone.jar` 2. In Python, create and then quit a remote browser instance:      from selenium import webdriver     from selenium.webdriver.common.desired_capabilities import DesiredCapabilities.FIREFOX as ff      driver = webdriver.Remote(command_executor='http://localhost:4444/wd/hub', desired_capabilities=ff)     driver.quit()  1. Inspect the /tmp/ directory.    `ls -l /tmp/ | grep -E anonymous.*webdriver`

column3: Ruby, remote chrome: No implicit conversion of Symbol into Integer in W3CBridge#edge_check
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  Ubuntu 16.04    Selenium Version: 3.0.0     Browser:  Remote Chrome from ruby bindings    Browser Version:  Unrelevant   ## Expected Behavior -  ``` ruby Selenium::WebDriver.for(:remote, url: "http://selenium_hub:4444/wd/hub", desired_capabilities: :chrome) ```  must create driver ## Actual Behavior -  ``` /var/lib/gems/2.3.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/w3c_bridge.rb:102:in `[]': no implicit conversion of Symbol into Integer (TypeError)     from /var/lib/gems/2.3.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/w3c_bridge.rb:102:in `edge_check'     from /var/lib/gems/2.3.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/w3c_bridge.rb:66:in `initialize'     from /var/lib/gems/2.3.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/driver.rb:55:in `new'     from /var/lib/gems/2.3.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/driver.rb:55:in `for'     from /var/lib/gems/2.3.0/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.0/lib/selenium/webdriver.rb:82:in `for'     from ./test.rb:5:in `' ```  at lib/selenium/webdriver/remote/w3c_bridge.rb:102:  ``` ruby return unless caps && caps[:browser_name] && caps[:browser_name] == 'MicrosoftEdge' ```  **caps** is somehow equal to :chrome symbol ## Steps to reproduce -  ``` ruby #/usr/bin/env ruby require 'selenium-webdriver' Selenium::WebDriver.for(:remote, url: "http://selenium_hub:4444/wd/hub", desired_capabilities: :chrome) ```

column3: 3.0.x selenium SessionCleaner insideBrowserTimeout and clientGoneTimeout not working properly
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  OSX 10.12 Sierre Selenium Version:  3.0.1 java standalone server, 3.0.0.beta2 javascript client binding Browser:  Safari 10.0 (12602.1.50.0.10) ## Expected Behavior -  I thought insideBrowserTimeout matches browserTimeout, and clientGoneTimeout matches timeout in the hub and node configuration parameters. 1. If browserTimeout and timeout is configured in the selenium hubConfig.json file, Selenium node should pick up those values, and so are insideBrowserTimeout and clientGoneTimeout.  2. In selenium nodeConfig.json file, I set browserTimeout: 60000, timeout: 120000, the values are in milliseconds according to documentation.  SessionCleaner should pick up these values 3. If the testing running inside browser finishes but not calling webdriver.quit(), the clientGoneTimeout should be triggered, session is destroyed and the browser instance is free to be used again  ## Actual Behavior - 1. From hub grid console, I can see the selenium node configuration has browserTimeout and timeout value set correctly from the hub configuration, but according to node.log, SessionCleaner still uses default insideBrowserTimeout (0) and clientGoneTimeout (1800000) 2. According to node.log, SessionCleaner uses insideBrowserTimeout 60000000 and clientGoneTimeout 120000000. Somehow times 1000 on the milliseconds again. 3. Session is destroyed after clientGoneTimeout expires. However, the hub doesn't seem to be notified of this event, so from the hub console, that browser instance is grey out and cannot be used. ## Steps to reproduce - 1. Start hub with following command    `java -jar selenium-server-standalone-3.0.1.jar -role hub -log hub.log -port 4444 -host  -hubConfig hubConfig.json`, and hubConfig.json:    `{    "browserTimeout": 60000,    "timeout": 120000    }` 2. Start node with following command    `java -jar selenium-server-standalone-3.0.1.jar -role node -log node.log -hub $HUB_URL -nodeConfig nodeConfig.json`, and nodeConfig.json:    `{    "capabilities":    [        {            "browserName":"safari",            "maxInstances":1,                        "platform":"MAC",                        "version":"10",                        "seleniumProtocol": "WebDriver"        }    ],    "debug": false,    "proxy": "org.openqa.grid.selenium.proxy.DefaultRemoteProxy",    "register": true,    "registerCycle": 5000,    "maxSession":6,    "port":"7777"    }` 3. check node.log and you will see the following lines:    `11:40:18.427 INFO - SessionCleaner initialized with insideBrowserTimeout 0 and clientGoneTimeout 1800000 polling every 180000` 4. add the following properties to nodeConfig.json and restart selenium node        `"browserTimeout": 60000,    "timeout": 120000` 5. check node.log and you will see the following lines:    `11:45:57.387 INFO - SessionCleaner initialized with insideBrowserTimeout 60000000 and clientGoneTimeout 60000000 polling every 6000000"` 6. change browserTimeout and timeout in nodeConfig.json to the following and restart selenium node        `"browserTimeout": 60,    "timeout": 120"` 7. check node.log and you will see the following lines:    `11:52:21.122 INFO - SessionCleaner initialized with insideBrowserTimeout 60000 and clientGoneTimeout 120000 polling every 6000` 8. Run a QUnit test but don't call webdriver.quit() when test finishes 9. After 120 seconds, browser is shutdown as expected due to client timeout and the following log can be seen in node.log:    `11:56:15.237 INFO - Session 4e364367-9f6e-43fc-8591-ad27c82506c9 deleted due to client timeout`.  However, the hub doesn't seem to be aware of the session being deleted. From the hub console page, that instance remains grey out and cannot be used.

column3: NullPointerException when trying to load grid console page
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  OSX 10.11.6 Selenium Version:  selenium-server 3.0.0-beta3 ## Expected Behavior -  Hi, we're pulling down selenium-server as a maven dependency as part of my open source project.  We were previously using org.openqa.grid.selenium.GridLauncher as an entry point .  However, when using org.openqa.grid.selenium.GridLauncherV3 as the main class and "-role hub" as the program arguments, we get a NullPointerException when trying to load the grid console page (http://127.0.0.1:4444/grid/console) in a web browser. column3: NPE when running selenium 3.0-beta4 jar with nodeConfig file that doesn't have registerCycle defined
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  OSX 10.11.6    Selenium Version:  3.0-beta4    Browser:  N/A  java -version java version "1.8.0_77" Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_77-b03) Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.77-b03, mixed mode)    Browser Version:     ## Expected Behavior - No NPE. Node to start correctly. Default registerCycle to 5000 ## Actual Behavior - NPE. Node does not start ## Steps to reproduce -  java -jar /tmp/webdriver/3.0.0-beta4.jar -role wd -nodeConfig node_5555.json  ``` {   "capabilities": [     {       "browserName": "firefox",       "maxInstances": 5,       "seleniumProtocol": "WebDriver"     }   ],     "maxSession": 3,     "port": 5555,     "register": true,     "unregisterIfStillDownAfter": 10000,     "hubPort": 4444,     "hubHost": "127.0.0.1",     "nodeStatusCheckTimeout": 10000,     "downPollingLimit": 0 } ```  Here is the console : https://gist.github.com/smccarthy/9871abb8daa292b4169392b88e644b0c

column3: 'WebDriverException: Message: Illegal base64 character a' trying to send a file path to a file upload input using RemoteDriver
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  OSX 10.10.5 Selenium Version: selenium server 3.0.0-beta4 and python bindings 3.0.0b3 Browser:  Firefox and Chrome Browser Version: Firefox 49.0.1 and Chrome 53.0.2785.143 (64-bit) ## Expected Behavior -  File path should be sent to file upload input. ## Actual Behavior -  Exception is thrown: **\* WebDriverException: Message: Illegal base64 character a Stacktrace:     at java.util.Base64$Decoder.decode0 (Base64.java:714)     at java.util.Base64$Decoder.decode (Base64.java:526)     at java.util.Base64$Decoder.decode (Base64.java:549)     at org.openqa.selenium.io.Zip.unzip (Zip.java:120)     at org.openqa.selenium.remote.server.handler.UploadFile.call (UploadFile.java:42)     at org.openqa.selenium.remote.server.handler.UploadFile.call (UploadFile.java:29)     at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run (FutureTask.java:266)     at org.openqa.selenium.remote.server.DefaultSession$1.run (DefaultSession.java:176)     at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker (ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)     at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run (ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)     at java.lang.Thread.run (Thread.java:745) ## Steps to reproduce -  from selenium.webdriver.remote.webdriver import WebDriver as RemoteDriver from selenium.webdriver.common.desired_capabilities import DesiredCapabilities  file_to_upload = "/file/that/exists/on/your/machine"  try:     driver = RemoteDriver(command_executor="http://127.0.0.1:4444/wd/hub", desired_capabilities=getattr(DesiredCapabilities, "CHROME"))     driver.get("https://jsfiddle.net/sqod9632/1/")     driver.switch_to.frame("result")     driver.find_element_by_id("file").send_keys(file_to_upload) finally:     driver.quit()

column3: Selenium 3 - Port isn't recognised for a node when defined in json file and using -nodeConfig option
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  OSX (10.11.6)    Selenium Version:  3.0.0-beta3    Browser:      Browser Version:     ## Expected Behavior -  I can use the following json with the -nodeConfig option in server v2.53.0 to specify the port used when registering the node:  ``` json {   "capabilities":       [         {           "browserName": "safari",           "maxInstances": 5,           "seleniumProtocol": "WebDriver",           "platform": "MAC"           },         {           "browserName": "chrome",           "maxInstances": 5,           "seleniumProtocol": "WebDriver",           "platform": "MAC"          },         {           "browserName": "firefox",           "maxInstances": 5,           "seleniumProtocol": "WebDriver",           "platform": "MAC"         }       ],   "configuration":   {     "proxy": "org.openqa.grid.selenium.proxy.DefaultRemoteProxy",     "maxSession": 5,     "port": 3334,     "register": true,     "registerCycle": 5000,     "hubPort": 3100,     "hubHost": 127.0.0.1   } } ``` ## Actual Behavior -  When attempting this using the same json and 3.0.0-beta3 it defaults to port 5555, despite finding the right hubHost & hubPort values, and registering the expected browser versions.  **NOTE**: Specifying a port for the node works correctly when using the `-port` option on the command line:  `java -jar selenium-server-standalone-3.0.0-beta3.jar -role node -port 3334 -hub http://127.0.0.1:3100/wd/register` ## Steps to reproduce -  Create a nodeConfig.json file using the above detail, and launch the node using the following command: `java -jar selenium-server-standalone.jar -role node -nodeConfig nodeConfig.json`  Navigate to the hub console and note the port number used to register the new node.

column3: load strategy unstable not working  selenium-driver 3.0.0-beta-2
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  OSX Selenium Version:  3.0.0-beta-2 Browser:  Firefox 49.0.1 ## Expected Behavior -  `driver.wait(until.elementLocated(By.className(` should resolve as soon as it's visible. ## Actual Behavior -  ~~driver.get resolves before any driver.waits~~ The page needs to be fully loaded before resolving `driver.wait(until.elementLocated` ## Steps to reproduce -  ```     var profile = new firefox.Profile();     profile.setPreference('webdriver.load.strategy', "unstable");     var options = new firefox.Options().setProfile(profile);     var driver = new firefox.Driver(options);  driver.get('https://google.com')         .then(function () {             console.log('Loaded')         });  driver.wait(until.elementLocated(By.className('example')), 5000)         .then(function () {             console.log('Element found')         }); ```

column3: Selenium Webdriver returns empty response even with --ssl-protocol=any and --ignore-ssl-errors=true
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  OSX Selenium Version:  2.47.1 Browser:  PhantomJs ## Expected Behavior -  the page source is printed ## Actual Behavior -  the empty page is printed:  ## Steps to reproduce -  from selenium import webdriver   driver = webdriver.PhantomJS(service_args=['--ignore-ssl-errors=true', '--debug=true', '--ssl-protocol=any'])  driver.get("https://tmp.org")  print(driver.page_source)  I am seeing (in my logs): 2016-10-16T18:31:31 [DEBUG] Network - Resource request error: 2 ( "Connection closed" ) URL: "https://tmp.org/"  If I try the url 'https://www.americascarmuseum.org' I get 'Resource request error: 6 ( "SSL handshake failed" )'

column3: action.move_to(ele).perform not working with Ruby and Selenium 3.0.0
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  OSX    Selenium Version:  3.0.0    Browser:  Firefox    Browser Version:  49.0.2   ## Expected Behavior -  A Ruby command like browser.action.move_to(element).perform should succeed ala http://www.rubydoc.info/gems/selenium-webdriver/3.0.0/Selenium/WebDriver/ActionBuilder#move_to-instance_method ## Actual Behavior -  the same command results in an error "unknown command: :mouseMoveTo.  There is a similar known issue for Safari, but not for Firefox. ## Steps to reproduce -    1) Go to google.com 2) Run these lines @browser = Selenium::WebDriver.for :firefox, marionette: true ele = @browser.find_element(:xpath, "//input[@value = 'Google Search']") @browser.action.move_to(ele).perform

column3: normal click() brings the contextual menu like if it was a right click

column3: Selenium Server Standalone 3.0.1: Exception in thread "main" com.beust.jcommander.ParameterException: no main parameter was defined
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  MacOS 10.12 Selenium Version: selenium-server-standalone-3.0.1.jar Browser:  NA ## Expected Behavior -  Launch hub for selenium grid for parallel execution in Appium ## Actual Behavior -  ``` Exception in thread "main" com.beust.jcommander.ParameterException: Was passed main parameter 'http://127.0.0.1:4444/grid/console/' but no main parameter was defined     at com.beust.jcommander.JCommander.getMainParameter(JCommander.java:914)     at com.beust.jcommander.JCommander.parseValues(JCommander.java:759)     at com.beust.jcommander.JCommander.parse(JCommander.java:282)     at com.beust.jcommander.JCommander.parse(JCommander.java:265)     at com.beust.jcommander.JCommander.(JCommander.java:210)     at org.openqa.grid.selenium.GridLauncherV3$2.setConfiguration(GridLauncherV3.java:236)     at org.openqa.grid.selenium.GridLauncherV3.buildLauncher(GridLauncherV3.java:147)     at org.openqa.grid.selenium.GridLauncherV3.main(GridLauncherV3.java:73)  ``` ## Steps to reproduce -  executing following command in terminal:  `java -jar ~/Downloads/selenium-server-standalone-3.0.1.jar -role hub http://127.0.0.1:4444/grid/console/`

column3: query :: need help in building latest code
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  MAC OS X ## Actual Behavior -  On latest code from `master` while trying build latest code from source, it fails using crazyfun and buck both ways Stacktrace  **./go build fails with:** bad-cert deps   **Buck build fails with** java_library() got an unexpected keyword argument 'maven_pom_template'    **./go clean test** breaks too with no such files   **Tried investigating** there are key sets in each rule in BUCK(/java/client/src/org/openqa/selenium/BUCK) file like this:  ``` maven_pom_template = ':template-pom', ```  however even removing this doesn't solve the problem, it starts pointing "manifest_file = ':manifest'," as unexpected argument. what settings i'm missing here. I'm on latest commit (9d984ac231549cd88be44a45475f0cff6e4e382d)  is there different build system or for 3.0 to be built smoothly or its some silly miss from my side

column3: Detect browser crash
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  Linux Ubuntu 14.04    Selenium Version:  3.0.1    Browser:  Chrome    Browser Version:  54.0.2840.71   ## Expected Behavior -  I'm trying to get notified of browser crashes by periodically issuing a `webDriver.getTitle()`. I would expect it to throw a `WebDriverException` as soon as the browser is not reachable.  ## Actual Behavior -  A `WebDriverException,` is actually thrown when the browser is not reachable, but only after ~2 minutes (127 seconds). I guess some timeout fires at that point.  Is such timeout configurable somewhere? I tries the various `WebDriver.Timeouts` but had no effect. ## Steps to reproduce -    Through the Java bindings:  ```     WebDriver webDriver = new ChromeDriver();     webDriver.get("https://www.google.com");     while(true) {         try {             webDriver.getTitle();             Thread.sleep(1000);         } catch(WebDriverException | InterruptedException e) {             e.printStackTrace();             break;         }     } ```

column3: platform.rb assumes stable file ordering -> geckodriver can not be found on TravisCI
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  Linux on TravisCI Selenium Version:  3.0 Browser:  FF 49.0.1 ## Expected Behavior -  Having the tar file in the same directory as the geckodriver executable should not cause problems.  ``` TAR=geckodriver-v0.11.1-linux64.tar wget https://github.com/mozilla/geckodriver/releases/download/v0.11.1/$TAR.gz gunzip $TAR.gz tar -xvf $TAR chmod a+x geckodriver export PATH=$PATH:`pwd` ``` ## Actual Behavior -  But it can't find the executable for geckodriver: https://travis-ci.org/Caleydo/caleydo.github.io/builds/168922490#L621  For whatever reason, on Travis the tar file is returned in the listing before the executable file, but the glob matches both of them, and in the ruby code we only see the first one:  selenium/webdriver/common/platform.rb:  ```    116        def find_binary(*binary_names)    117          paths = ENV['PATH'].split(File::PATH_SEPARATOR)    118          binary_names.map! { |n| "#{n}.exe" } if windows?    119          binary_names.each do |binary_name|    120            paths.each do |path|    121              full_path = File.join(path, binary_name)    122              full_path.tr!('\\', '/') if windows?    123              exe = Dir.glob(full_path).first # *** but for me the executable wasn't first in this list.    124              next unless exe    125              return exe if File.executable?(exe)    126            end    127          end ```  called from selenium/webdriver/firefox.rb:  ```     49        def self.driver_path     50          @driver_path ||= begin     51            path = Platform.find_binary('geckodriver*')     52            raise Error::WebDriverError, MISSING_TEXT unless path     53            Platform.assert_executable path     54            path     55          end     56        end ```  By removing the tar file, I got it to work, but it wasn't obvious from the error message what needed to change: `which geckdriver` worked, so why wasn't the ruby code able to find it?  Thanks!  (I don't have a local reproducer: I'm guessing the file ordering is a function of the file system.)

column3: use of firefox profile floods terminal
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  Linux gentoo Selenium Version: master   Browser:  Firefox Browser Version:  45.4.0 ## Expected Behavior -  With selenium-server-standalone, when capabilities are displayed. The field containing base64 encoded firefox profile is truncated. Otherwise terminal is readable. ## Actual Behavior -  Now with 3.0, "firefoxOptions" capability entry (and more specificly its "profile" subentry) is containing the base64 string... and it is not truncated by org.openqa.selenium.remote.DesiredCapabilities#toString  Terminal is completly flooded. ## Steps to reproduce -  Use a relatively big firefox profile.

column3: Unable to setup Selenium Grid v3.0.0 in AWS EC2 using Docker Swarm Mode due to Unknown option: -remoteHost
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  Docker container (https://hub.docker.com/r/selenium/node-chrome/)    Selenium Version:  3.0.0    Browser:  Chrome    Browser Version:  53.0.2785.101-1   ## Expected Behavior -  Selenium Grid is successfully setup and all nodes (containers) across hosts are able to talk to each other. ## Actual Behavior -  This set of commands below worked for 2.53.1.  ``` docker network create -d overlay gridnet docker service create --network gridnet --name hub -p 4444:4444 -e JAVA_OPTS='-Xmx512m -DPOOL_MAX=512' -e GRID_TIMEOUT=600000 \             -e GRID_BROWSER_TIMEOUT=600000 selenium/hub:3.0.0-cerium docker service create --network gridnet --endpoint-mode dnsrr --name nodes \             --mount type=bind,source=/dev/shm,target=/dev/shm \             -e HUB_PORT_4444_TCP_ADDR=hub -e HUB_PORT_4444_TCP_PORT=4444 -e NODE_MAX_INSTANCES=5 -e NODE_MAX_SESSION=5 \             --replicas 2 selenium/node-chrome:3.0.0-cerium bash -c 'HOSTIP=$(ip -4 addr show eth0 | grep -Po "inet \K[\d.]+") REMOTE_HOST=http://$HOSTIP:5555 /opt/bin/entry_point.sh' ```  Screen shot of working grid - ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10567800/19462124/3a7afaac-949f-11e6-90d3-74823d79844f.png)  But on v3.0.0 exited container has this log message when running the commands above -  ``` REMOTE_HOST variable is set, appending -remoteHost Exception in thread "main" com.beust.jcommander.ParameterException: Unknown option: -remoteHost     at com.beust.jcommander.JCommander.parseValues(JCommander.java:742)     at com.beust.jcommander.JCommander.parse(JCommander.java:282)     at com.beust.jcommander.JCommander.parse(JCommander.java:265)     at com.beust.jcommander.JCommander.(JCommander.java:210)     at org.openqa.grid.selenium.GridLauncherV3$3.setConfiguration(GridLauncherV3.java:257)     at org.openqa.grid.selenium.GridLauncherV3.buildLauncher(GridLauncherV3.java:147)     at org.openqa.grid.selenium.GridLauncherV3.main(GridLauncherV3.java:73) ```  So I changed my command to set SE_OPTS instead of REMOTE_HOST for setting up the Swarm -  ``` docker network create -d overlay gridnet docker service create --network gridnet --name hub -p 4444:4444 -e JAVA_OPTS='-Xmx512m -DPOOL_MAX=512' -e GRID_TIMEOUT=600000 \             -e GRID_BROWSER_TIMEOUT=600000 selenium/hub:3.0.0-cerium docker service create --network gridnet --endpoint-mode dnsrr --name nodes \             --mount type=bind,source=/dev/shm,target=/dev/shm \             -e HUB_PORT_4444_TCP_ADDR=hub -e HUB_PORT_4444_TCP_PORT=4444 -e NODE_MAX_INSTANCES=5 -e NODE_MAX_SESSION=5 \             --replicas 2 selenium/node-chrome:3.0.0-cerium bash -c 'HOSTIP=$(ip -4 addr show eth0 | grep -Po "inet \K[\d.]+") SE_OPTS="-hubHost $HOSTIP" /opt/bin/entry_point.sh' ```  I see the following error - DefaultRemoteProxy unknown version,Connect to 172.18.0.3:5555 [/172.18.0.3] failed: Connection refused. ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10567800/19461761/5af6c728-949c-11e6-990c-695d42682f59.png)  So, I'd like to know if it's possible to still set the remoteHost in 3.0.0. If not what is the right setting to setup the grid in Swarm mode? ## Steps to reproduce -   1. Create 2 EC2 instances 2. Install latest Docker (1.12.2) 3. Have one instance join as manager and the other as worker in Swarm Mode. 4. Run the commands above to first create an overlay network, then create the hub and node services to setup the grid.

column3: Selenium grid 3.0.1 hanging on post request forever when starting remote web driver
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  Command running from windows 10 Grid is running on windows 7 Selenium Version:  3.0.1, IDE Pycharm Browser:   Chrome Browser Version:  53.0.2623.87  ## Expected Behavior -  Post request return status 200 and a browser will be opened ## Actual Behavior -  Post request with the capabilities is hanging forever ## Steps to reproduce -  Run the following python code from selenium.webdriver import Chrome, Remote from selenium.webdriver import DesiredCapabilities  selenium_server = env.instance().selenium_server() capabilities = DesiredCapabilities.CHROME repo = env.instance().chrome_download_path capabilities["nativeEvents"] = True capabilities['chromeOptions'] = {} capabilities['chromeOptions']['prefs'] = {} capabilities['chromeOptions']['prefs']['download.prompt_for_download'] = False capabilities['chromeOptions']['prefs']['download.default_directory'] = repo Remote(command_executor=selenium_server + "/wd/hub",desired_capabilities=capabilities)  To selenium grid version 3.0.1 (for version 2.53.1 it works)

column3: Issue while compiling with java 8 the v.3.0.0-beta4
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  Android    Selenium Version:    3.0.0-beta4    Browser:  -    Browser Version:     ## Expected Behavior - ## Actual Behavior - ## Steps to reproduce -    Hi, I've got a problem that has shocked me, and I think it's a bug because I should've done all well: Basically, as we know since v3.0.0-beta1 it's necessary java 8; well, if I try to compile it (Android Studio, last release [2.2]) I got a message error and also it says me to put a target/source compatibility to java 1.7; I mean, what? I've got upset, why I got an error because of compiling with java 8 when I must use it?  For more details, here's the problem well described: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39806585/compiling-compatibility-issue-external-libraries  Hope that I helped, or at least if I've done something wrong hope that you'll help me :)

column3: ChromeDriver proxy not working??
column4: ## Meta -  OS:  10.11.6 Selenium Version:   3.0.0 Browser:   ## Chrome  I'm experiencing a very strange bug with ChromeDriver (using Ruby)...  ``` @proxy = "proxy:port goes here" Capybara.register_driver :selenium do |app|         prefs = {"download" => {"default_directory" => DownloadHelpers::PATH.to_s, "directory_upgrade" => true, "extensions_to_open" => ""}}         proxy = Selenium::WebDriver::Proxy.new(:type => :manual, :http => @proxy)         caps = Selenium::WebDriver::Remote::Capabilities.chrome(:proxy => proxy)         caps['chromeOptions'] = {'prefs' => prefs}         Capybara::Selenium::Driver.new(app, :detach => false, :browser => :chrome, :desired_capabilities => caps)     end ```  Here is my Ruby code. When I run the code, Chrome opens, but when I go to website to check my IP, it's not showing the proxy address. If I put in 'about:' in the URL and hit enter, I get the command list, which shows "--proxy-server=http=69.63.114.3:3128" in the list of commands, so it seems it is being inserted.. but it's not using it for some reason. If I go to preferences in that Chrome instance, it says it's using the system proxy and does _not_ say it's using a manual proxy, which could be part of the problem...  Any ideas?

column3: Navigate to other domain with anchor click
column4: ## Meta -  OS:   Windows Server 2012 R2 Selenium Version:   selenium server standalone 3.0 Browser:   Firefox (geckodriver)  Browser Version:   48 32Bit ## Expected Behavior -  Click on anchor links refering to other domains should succeed. ## Actual Behavior -  Page load Error (even with Manual click done in a window created by selenium server). There is no Firewall / connectivity issue: When doing the test manually in a window not created by Selenium Server the click succeeds. ## Steps to reproduce -  WebDriver firefox = new RemoteWebDriver(                 new URL("http://"+IP_SELENIUM_SERVER+":4444/wd/hub"), DesiredCapabilities.firefox()); firefox.get("http://my.domain"); firefox.manage().timeouts().pageLoadTimeout(15, TimeUnit.SECONDS); List anchors = firefox.findElements(By.cssSelector("a")); WebElement anchor = anchors.get(0); anchor.click(); firefox.manage().timeouts().pageLoadTimeout(15, TimeUnit.SECONDS);

column3: PayPal Page HTML Not Matching Displayed HTML
column4: ## Meta -  OS:   Windows 7 x64 SP1  Selenium Version:   2.53.4 in use with Ruby, rspec, and capybara   Browser:   Tested in Chrome and Firefox  Browser Version:   ChromeDriver 2.24 / Chrome 53.0.2785.116 / Firefox 49.0.1 with Marionette ## Expected Behavior -  Input fields with the ids of 'email' and 'password' display on the page. ## Actual Behavior -  Only part of the page is captured in Selenium ## Steps to reproduce -  Use Selenium to automate a checkout process using PayPal as the payment type.  When you reach the PayPal login page, page.html doesn't contain the "#email" and "#password" fields even though they're displayed right there on the page in the browser selenium opened using Chrome / Firefox driver.  Here's a screenshot of what it looks like in the browser:  ![paypal_html_in_browser](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22548644/19044598/3ef7ede0-8952-11e6-8f93-5ea93b1f770c.png)  Here's a screenshot of the HTML that I retrieved using page.html (which I saved to an HTML file which I've also attached here):  ![paypal_html_in_ruby_page_source](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22548644/19044629/5eb48602-8952-11e6-93f6-42d87d4fcab6.png)  [current_page.zip](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/files/506684/current_page.zip)

column3: nodeConfig json file firefox_binary entries not passed on to geckodriver
column4: ## Meta -  OS:   Windows 7 Selenium Version:   3.0.0 Browser:   Firefox  Browser Version:   any FF version ## Expected Behavior -  When using selenium grid and launching a grid node with -nodeConfig using a json file that contains a mapping of custom firefox locations like:  {         "browserName": "firefox",         "version": "48",          "platform": "VISTA",         "firefox_binary":"C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox48\firefox.exe",         "maxInstances": 1,         "seleniumProtocol": "WebDriver"         }, {         "browserName": "firefox",         "version": "47",          "platform": "VISTA",         "firefox_binary":"C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox47\firefox.exe",         "maxInstances": 1,         "seleniumProtocol": "WebDriver"         },  The geckodriver should receive this binary location, but it does not. Specifying custom firefox binary locations in the json file works for all previous selenium 2 versions. ## Actual Behavior -  The geckodriver never receives this json firefox binary location and instead looks for a binary location in client capabilities or default install location of firefox on the os.  If it cannot find it it throws an error. Tested this with Java and Python, same result. ## Steps to reproduce -  Launch a 3.0.0. selenium grid and for the grid node, install FF48 in a custom location and launch the node with -nodeConfig using a json file with the firefox_binary location. There should not be any Firefox installed in the default OS location. Then run a test with FF48 not specifying the FF48 firefox_binary in a capability.

column3: executable path of browser converted to unix format and loses the drive name so tests and executable need to be on the same drive
column4: ## Meta -  OS:   Windows 10  Selenium Version:   3.3.1  Browser:    Firefox  Browser Version:    I was using portable firefox version 47.0.1 but this isn't strictly relevant to the bug because the code does not get as far as starting the browser  ## Expected Behavior -  When I set the browser binary, I expected it to use the binary no matter which drive I ran my tests from - this was behaviour in previous versions of WebDriver below 3.3.0  ~~~~~~~~         String firefox_binary_path = "C:\\webdrivers\\FirefoxPortable\\FirefoxPortable.exe";          capabilities.setCapability("firefox_binary", firefox_binary_path); ~~~~~~~~  ## Actual Behavior -  In 3.3.1 the `FirefoxOptions` has a method call `asUnixPath` which converts   `C:\webdrivers\FirefoxPortable\FirefoxPortable.exe`  to   `/webdrivers/FirefoxPortable/FirefoxPortable.exe`  And while the capability still has the full path. The `.binaryPath` field in `FirefoxOptions` does not have the drive in it.  Therefore, when `FirefoxOptions` uses the `getBinaryOrNull` method the `binaryPath` field is used and this does not have the path in it so the check for file existence only works if the tests are running on the same drive as the browser executable is located.  ## Steps to reproduce -  Run a test which configures the location of the browser location, but have the browser located on a different drive.  ## Workaround  Run the tests from the same drive the executable is stored on.

column3: Unable to free up slot if close the browser manually
column4: ## Meta -  OS:   Window 7  Selenium Version:   Selenium 3  Browser:   FF, tried with FF only at the moment  FIREFOX 48+ IS ONLY COMPATIBLE WITH GECKODRIVER. Any issue logged here for 48+ will be closed as a duplicate of #2559  If the issue is with Google Chrome consider logging an issue with chromedriver instead: https://sites.google.com/a/chromium.org/chromedriver/help  If the issue is with Microsoft Edge consider logging an issue with Microsoft instead: https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/platform/issues/  If the issue is with Firefox GeckoDriver (aka Marionette) consider logging an issue with Mozilla: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/buglist.cgi?product=Testing&component=Marionette  If the issue is with Safari, only Safari 10+ is supported. Please log any Safari issue with Apple: https://bugreport.apple.com/  If the issue is with PhantomJS consider logging an issue with Ghostdriver: https://github.com/detro/ghostdriver  -->  Browser Version:   <49.0.1 (x86)> ## Expected Behavior -  Selenium grid should able to free up browser slot after the browser is closed manually ## Actual Behavior -  Selenium grid is not able to free up browser slot after few minutes ## Steps to reproduce -  1) Write a python script to start FF remotely 2) Close the FF manually after python script is done  ![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1460421/19425151/dcec63fe-9461-11e6-94dc-c07c1cdb2ff8.png)

column3: cookie.getExpiry() don't return the date
column4: ## Meta -  OS:   OSX Sierra 10.12 Selenium Version:   3.0.0 Browser:   Firefox  Browser Version:   46.0.1 ## Expected Behavior -  We can get the expiry date using: driver.manage().getCookieNamed(COOKIE_NAME).getExpiry(); ## Actual Behavior -  driver.manage().getCookieNamed(COOKIE_NAME).getExpiry(); returns null! ## Steps to reproduce -  With a cookie that have an expiry date like "12/31/9999, 11:59:59PM" Using Selenium 2.53.0 and Java 1.8 and executing:  driver.manage().getCookieNamed(COOKIE_NAME).getExpiry();

column3: TypeError: element.isDisplayed is not a function (Javascript driver)
column4: ## Meta -  OS:   OSX El Capitan Selenium Version:   3.0 Browser:   Chrome & Safari ## Expected Behavior -  elementIsVisible should work ## Actual Behavior -  `TypeError: element.isDisplayed is not a function` ## Steps to reproduce -  This could should be fine based on the node module and specification.  ``` var webdriver = require('selenium-webdriver'),     By = webdriver.By,     until = webdriver.until;  var driver = new webdriver.Builder()     .forBrowser('safari')     .build();  driver.get('http://cnn.com'); driver.findElement(By.className('nav-menu')).click(); driver.wait(until.elementLocated(By.className('nav-menu'), 10000)) driver.wait(until.elementIsVisible(By.className('nav-menu')), 10000); driver.quit(); ```

column3: Simple javascript webdriver example fails with chrome 54
column4: ## Meta -  OS:   OSX Selenium Version:   tested with 3.0.0-beta-3 and 2.53.3 Browser:   Chrome  Browser Version:    54.0.2840.59   The simple javascript example from https://www.npmjs.com/package/selenium-webdriver stopped working with Chrome 54.  The browser windows opens, loads the url, but doesn't perform any further actions. ## Steps to reproduce -  package.json:  ``` {   "name": "webdriver-bug",   "version": "1.0.0",   "description": "example for issue report",   "main": "index.js",   "scripts": {     "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1"   },   "author": "",   "license": "BSD-2-Clause",   "dependencies": {     "chromedriver": "^2.24.1",     "selenium-webdriver": "^3.0.0-beta-3"   } } ```  example.js:  ``` var webdriver = require('selenium-webdriver'),     By = webdriver.By,     until = webdriver.until;  var driver = new webdriver.Builder()     .forBrowser('chrome')     .setChromeOptions()     .build();  driver.get('http://www.google.com/ncr'); driver.findElement(By.name('q')).sendKeys('webdriver'); driver.findElement(By.name('btnG')).click(); driver.wait(until.titleIs('webdriver - Google Search'), 1000); driver.quit(); ```  To run the test  ``` export PATH=node_modules/chromedriver/lib/chromedriver/:$PATH node example.js ```  The java bindings work for chromedriver 2.24.1 and selenium 2.53.1, thus I've filed the bug here.

column4: ## Meta -  OS:   OSX Selenium Version:   3.0.0 Browser:   N/A  If you pull in selenium-server 3.0.0 as a dependency, note that multiple versions of selenium-support (3.0.0 and 3.0.0-beta2) are being pulled in:  ``` Dependency convergence error for org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-support:3.0.0 paths to dependency are: +-com.retailmenot:selenium-grid-scaler:0.9-SNAPSHOT   +-org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-server:3.0.0     +-org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-java:3.0.0       +-org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-support:3.0.0 and +-com.retailmenot:selenium-grid-scaler:0.9-SNAPSHOT   +-org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-server:3.0.0     +-org.seleniumhq.selenium:htmlunit-driver:2.23       +-org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-support:3.0.0-beta2  [WARNING] Rule 0: org.apache.maven.plugins.enforcer.DependencyConvergence failed with message: Failed while enforcing releasability the error(s) are [ Dependency convergence error for org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-support:3.0.0 paths to dependency are: +-com.retailmenot:selenium-grid-scaler:0.9-SNAPSHOT   +-org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-server:3.0.0     +-org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-java:3.0.0       +-org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-support:3.0.0 and +-com.retailmenot:selenium-grid-scaler:0.9-SNAPSHOT   +-org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-server:3.0.0     +-org.seleniumhq.selenium:htmlunit-driver:2.23       +-org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-support:3.0.0-beta2 ```

column3: Selenium WebDriver with MacOS Sierra 10.12 doesnâ€™t work methods with waiting for condition, like waitForElementâ€¦ and waitForElementNot...
column4: ## Meta -  OS:   MacOS Sierra 10.12 Selenium Version:   2.53.1, 3.0.0-beta3 Facebook php-adapter Browser:   Chrome  When i upgrade to macOS Sierra, i faced a problem that all WebDrivers methods with waiting until a condition, like $_webDriver->wait($timeout)->until(WebDriverExpectedCondition::presenceOfElementLocated($selector) doesnâ€™t work correctly.  The problem is, if target selector is not visible or present now, WebDriver not trying to repeat check this selector again and again. WebDriver trying once and after timeout, just throws an Exception (NoSuchElementException).  The El Capitan (10.11) didn't have a problem. column3: [On Firefox] Able to hover but not click on a Dropdown:webElement (reactjs)
column4: ## Meta -  OS:   MAC Selenium Version:   2.53.1 Browser:   FF 45  Browser Version:   45.0 ## Expected Behavior - ## Actual Behavior -  Am able to hover over an element on FF but unable to click on it. ## Steps to reproduce -  It's a dropdown list of category, on clicking a category, list of sub category shows up within the dropdown. It's in reactjs.  Now am able to hover over the category but clicking on it closes the dropdown itself. Works fine on Chrome. Only issue with FF, unable to upgrade FF > 45 bcoz am using Selenium 2.53.1.

column3: Microsoft Edge clicking session issues
column4: ## Meta -  OS:    Windows 10 Selenium Version:   2.531 Browser:   Microsoft Edge   I cannot click on elements in microsoft edge in selenium tests. Does anyone know why? I am having the follow issues with Microsoft Edge v 13; - Cannot click on elements using selenium click function - Cannot find elements that are on top of other elements (waitForElement function does not work) - Cannot open a new clean session every time I run a test using Edge driver  How can I resolve the issues above? Maybe my desired capabilities configuration is wrong?  What are the desired capabilities needed to get Microsoft Edge working well?  -->  Browser Version:   13 ## Expected Behavior -  Expected click and new session every time open Microsoft Edge browser. ## Actual Behavior -  Cannot click on elements. Doesn't open new session each time. ## Steps to reproduce - 1. Try to click on an element that is on top of another element (like a menu that opens on top of other elements) 2. Try to open a new test using Microsoft Edge, session won't be cleared

column3: Issue with variable value on selenium grid execution
column4:
## Meta -  OS:      Selenium Version:  2.471.1  Browser:   Firefox 45  If the issue is with Google Chrome consider logging an issue with chromedriver instead: https://sites.google.com/a/chromium.org/chromedriver/help  If the issue is with Microsoft Edge consider logging an issue with Microsoft instead: https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/platform/issues/  If the issue is with Firefox GeckoDriver (aka Marionette) consider logging an issue with Mozilla: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/buglist.cgi?product=Testing&component=Marionette  If the issue is with Safari, only Safari 10+ is supported. column3: Enable support for specifying custom firefox binary locations when using marionette
column4: ## Meta -  OS:      Selenium Version:      3.0.0-beta3 Browser:      Browser Version:     ## Expected Behavior -  When user specifies a custom browser binary location via `FirefoxBinary` object, the location should be honored by `FirefoxDriver` and it should be spawned via geckodriver by passing the location to geckodriver via `GeckoDriverService` ## Actual Behavior -  This is currently not the case. ## Steps to reproduce -    The following test code can be executed to recreate the problem  ``` public static void main(String[] args) {     RemoteWebDriver driver = null;     try {         DesiredCapabilities caps = DesiredCapabilities.firefox();         caps.setCapability("marionette", true);         //Simulating as if the binary is available in a diff location outside of the default location         FirefoxBinary binary = new FirefoxBinary(new File("/Applications/Firefox.app/Contents/MacOS/firefox-bin-new"));         driver = new FirefoxDriver(binary, new FirefoxProfile());         driver.get("http://www.seleniumhq.org/download/maven.jsp");         System.err.println("Page title : " + driver.getTitle());      } finally {         if (driver != null) {             driver.quit();         }     } }  ```

column3: Grid client times out waiting for browser, but a place in the queue and a browser still getting blocked
column4: ## Meta -  OS: Windows 7    Selenium Version: Grid: 2.53.1, Client: Selenium.WebDriver for .NET 3.0.0  Browser: Remote Web Driver - (using Ghost Driver) ## Expected Behavior -  It is expected that when all the browsers are taken, and a timeout is thrown from the client's constructor:  `new RemoteWebDriver(new Uri("http://127.0.0.1:4444/wd/hub/"), DesiredCapabilities.PhantomJS())`   the client should disconnect from the http request that requested a browser, and that the grid, upon noticing this, should remove the request from the queue so that a browser is not needlessly held reserved without anyone using it. ## Actual Behavior -  `new RemoteWebDriver(...)` throws a timeout, but a place in the queue is still taken, and when the browser becomes available it's held reserved until some timeout. This is especially severe when using [the default -1 newSessionWaitTimeout](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/b97704fa76678d540adbb9661ae2fda6789dc0c0/java/server/src/org/openqa/grid/internal/utils/configuration/GridHubConfiguration.java#L71), which makes all requests live forever to do this blocking. While changing this setting alleviates the issue, not removing the request from the queue still causes an unnecessary congestion of browsers reservations.  [This stackoverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7474345/grid-hub-http-client-timeout-if-waiting-for-a-slot-to-be-free/7477034#7477034) suggests that issue exists with Ruby client as well, so possibly is a problem with Grid itself. ## Steps to reproduce - 1. Spin up grid with 0 browsers. 2. Attempt to connect with client and observe timeout exception (`new RemoteWebDriver(..., ..., TimeSpan.FromSeconds(5))` will make it appear fast) 3. See how the requests are still in the queue

column3: ((RemoteWebDriver) webDriver).setLogLevel(Level.OFF) - results in verbose logging
column4: ## Meta -  OS: Ubuntu 16.04 x64  Selenium Version: 3.0.0 (final)  Browser: Chrome, Firefox  Browser Version:   - Chrome Version 53.0.2785.143 (64-bit) - Firefox Version 49.0 ## Expected Behavior -  Expect that setting webdriver log level to `Level.OFF` would produce no logging output. ## Actual Behavior -  Logging more verbose than at `Level.FINE`. All webdriver logging is prefixed with `OFF:` If set to Level.SEVERE still aggressive logging; all prefixed with `SEVERE`. Same for `Level.WARNING` ## Steps to reproduce -  Both browser tests executed at Node and on Hub. (Hub is Ubuntu 16.04 x64, same browser versions) ### Node  Note: Treating the local webdriver instances as RemoteWebDriver `webDriver =                                 new RemoteWebDriver(((ChromeDriverService) service).getUrl(), dc);` and `((RemoteWebDriver) webDriver).setLogLevel(Level.OFF)`  ``` INFO [m: [main]; Testing started Starting ChromeDriver 2.23.409687 (c46e862757edc04c06b1bd88724d15a5807b84d1) on port 32630 Only local connections are allowed. Oct 14, 2016 1:38:06 PM org.openqa.selenium.remote.ProtocolHandshake createSession INFO: Attempting bi-dialect session, assuming Postel's Law holds true on the remote end Oct 14, 2016 1:38:07 PM org.openqa.selenium.remote.ProtocolHandshake createSession INFO: Detected dialect: OSS Oct 14, 2016 1:38:07 PM org.openqa.selenium.remote.RemoteWebDriver log OFF: Executing: setTimeout [7fb1cc5cf006fb6c13e7d396ee6cbb28, setTimeout {type=implicit, ms=5000}] ... Oct 14, 2016 1:39:44 PM org.openqa.selenium.remote.RemoteWebDriver log OFF: Executed: [904a4f2aca26b3637d7f1d682a74d200, quit {}] ``` ### Hub  Note: logging is far far less than logging when executing tests locally on a node workstation. `webDriver = new RemoteWebDriver(gridUrl, dc);` and `((RemoteWebDriver) webDriver).setLogLevel(Level.OFF)`  ``` INFO : [main]; Testing started Oct 14, 2016 1:32:54 PM org.openqa.selenium.remote.ProtocolHandshake createSession INFO: Attempting bi-dialect session, assuming Postel's Law holds true on the remote end ```

column3: selenium-standalone-server will use network interfaces that are down when registering as a node
column4: ## Meta -  OS: Linux 4.7.6 (ArchLinux)(node machine) and CentOS 6 (hub machine)  Selenium Version: 3.0.0 ## Steps to reproduce -  you should already have one network interface on your system that is UP and has an IP address add another ipv4 network interface on your system and give it an IP address:  > $ modprobe dummy > $ ip link set name eth10 dev dummy0 > $ ip addr add 192.168.100.199/24 brd + dev eth10  by deafault, this interface will be DOWN start selenium-standalone-server in hub mode start another selenium-standalone-server in node mode ## Expected Behavior -  The hub should show a connection from the IP address of the network interface that is UP ## Actual Behavior -  The dummy interface will be used to connect to the hub. You should see it register a node from 192.168.100.199  The first network interface that is returned from java.net.NetworkInterface#getNetworkInterfaces that is not the loopback interface will be used, regardless of the status of that interface. I myself have a setup at work where I use extra interfaces for some virtualbox VMs that our dev environments run in. I'm unable to run a selenium node from my machine, even if these interfaces are DOWN.

column3: FirefoxDriver fails to construct with existing FirefoxBinary
column4: ## Meta OS: Ubuntu 16.04  Selenium Version: 3.0.1   Browser: Firefox   Browser Version: 45.0.2   ## Expected Behavior When call `new FirefoxDriver(firefoxBinary, firefoxProfile, capabilities)` new driver is opened ## Actual Behavior Although the firefoxBinary actually exists (i.e. it's not null), FirefoxDriver fails to construct with error message `java.lang.IllegalStateException: The path to the driver executable must be set by the webdriver.gecko.driver system property`.  Imo, the problem is here `org.openqa.selenium.firefox.GeckoDriverService.Builder#Builder(org.openqa.selenium.firefox.FirefoxBinary)`. This constructor sets the `binary` field, but doesn't set its' `super` field `org.openqa.selenium.remote.service.DriverService.Builder#exe`. Thus call to `org.openqa.selenium.remote.service.DriverService.Builder#build` fails. ## Steps to reproduce ```java String path = "/usr/bin/firefox"; String display = ":0";  FirefoxProfile profile = new FirefoxProfile(); // here was createDefaultFirefoxProfile(); FirefoxBinary binary = new FirefoxBinary(new File(path));  binary.setEnvironmentProperty("DISPLAY", display); WebDriver driver = new FirefoxDriver(binary, profile, cap); ```   This code works perfectly in Selenium 2.53.1

column3: "[Errno 98] Address already in use" Calling free_port()
column4: ## Meta OS: linux, using the Docker image at `gcr.io/google_appengine/python-compat-multicore` Selenium Version: 2.53.6 Browser: PhantomJS  ## Expected Behavior I am attempting to startup Selenium on a server with `port=0`. I understand that when `port` is `0`, Selenium looks for an open port to bind to.  Note that on this server, there are other instances of Selenium running, so it is possible that this is some type of race condition.  ## Actual Behavior There is a crash with the following call stack during startup: ``` Traceback (most recent call last):   File "/home/vmagent/app/[redacted].py", line 188, in login     driver = self._get_driver()   File "/home/vmagent/app/[redacted].py", line 159, in _get_driver     use_proxy = self.use_proxy, use_browsermob = self.use_proxy)   File "/home/vmagent/app/[redacted].py", line 405, in get_driver     service_log_path = log_file_name)   File "/env/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/phantomjs/webdriver.py", line 51, in __init__     log_path=service_log_path)   File "/env/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/phantomjs/service.py", line 50, in __init__     service.Service.__init__(self, executable_path, port=port, log_file=open(log_path, 'w'))   File "/env/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/common/service.py", line 35, in __init__     self.port = utils.free_port()   File "/env/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/common/utils.py", line 36, in free_port     free_socket.bind(('0.0.0.0', 0))   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/socket.py", line 224, in meth     return getattr(self._sock,name)(*args) error: [Errno 98] Address already in use ```  ## Steps to reproduce This is happening every few minutes on my server, but it's not easy to reproduce. It's almost certainly a race with other instances of selenium running on the same server.

column3: FluentWait changes WebDriverWait().until(ExpectedCondition...) fails with java.lang.NoSuchMethodError
column4: ## Meta OS:  Windows 7 Selenium Version:  3.2.0 Browser:  Chrome (problem is not related to browser) Browser Version:  56.0.2924.87 (64-bit) Java: jdk 1.8 (latest)   ## Problem I had the following setup: OS:  Windows 7 Selenium Version:  3.0.1 Browser:  Chrome (problem is not related to browser) Browser Version:  56.0.2924.87 (64-bit) Java: jdk 1.8 (latest)  I was using guava - 18.0 version and had a tests which were running fine.   Then I decided to upgrade the whole selenium grid environment to use 3.2.0 webdriver. I went through the changes and updated the pom.xml file to use 3.2.0 selenium-java and guava 21.0. Then I ran the same tests and all of them failed in the following code fragment:  ``` public void waitForElementToLoad(By locator, long timeOutInSeconds) {         new WebDriverWait(webDriver, timeOutInSeconds).until(ExpectedConditions.visibilityOfElementLocated(locator));     } ```  with the following reason: ```  java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.WebDriverWait.until(Ljava/util/function/Function;)Ljava/lang/Object; ```  ## Expected Behavior  If the error above is expected please add some suggestions how to use WebDriverWait + ExpectedConditions  ## Actual Behavior  The tests are failing because of the changes done related to FluentWait. Same piece of code works fine with 3.0.1 and guava 18.0.  ## Steps to reproduce  ```     @Test     public void example() throws Throwable {         webDriver.get("https://www.google.com/");         new WebDriverWait(webDriver, 30000).until(ExpectedConditions.visibilityOfElementLocated(By.cssSelector("input[name='q']")));     } ```  Thank you in advance!

column3: Selenium IDE RSpec export broken
column4: ## Meta OS:  OSX 10.11.6 Selenium Version:   IDE 2.9.1 FF plugin Browser:   FireFox  Browser Version:   49.0.2 (64-bit)  ## Expected Behavior - Export RSpec file and runs fine in both RSpec 2.0 and Rspec 3.0  ## Actual Behavior - Export RSpec file and it runs with the following errors:  1.) ${' is not allowed as a global variable name (SyntaxError) (For example of how it is being used see this blog post: http://elementalselenium.com/tips/6-export-from-selenium-ide notice that they solve the issue by deleting the helper functions. This will not work with more advanced tests that use the helper functions) 2.) "should" syntax is not supported (see: see:  http://rspec.info/blog/2012/06/rspecs-new-expectation-syntax/) Exports RSpec file with deprecated syntax and does not replace ${receiver} token  ## Description Currently the Selenium IDE 2.9.1 add-on has an export formatter called Ruby / RSpec / WebDriver but it is broken. It does not properly replace the ${receiver} token (see previous issue https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/selenium-users/fLcO7qSFnCA) and it uses the RSpec 1.0 "should" syntax instead of the new RSpec 2.11 or greater "expect" syntax.  This file needs to be updated: https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/ide/plugins/ruby-format/src/content/formats/ruby-wd-rspec.js  ## Steps to reproduce  0.) Install RSpec (http://rspec.info/) 1.) Install Selenium IDE in FireFox - https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/selenium-ide/ 2.) Open FireFox 3.) Go to Menu -> tools -> Selenium IDE 4.) Select Selenium IDE window 5.) Create a Test Case 6.) Go to Menu -> File -> Export Test Case ... -> Ruby / RSpec / WebDriver 7.) Save File as test.rb in Rspec spec directory 8.) Run rspec spec/test.rb

column3: Cannot submit form with id="submit" (Selenium 3 & Geckodriver)
Java client hasn't support of latest ChromeDriver commands
column4: ## Meta OS:  All Selenium Version:  3.0.1 Browser:  Chrome Browser Version:  56.0.2924.87 (64-bit)  ## Expected Behavior All driver commands are supported  ## Actual Behavior GET_NETWORK_CONDITIONS, SET_NETWORK_CONDITIONS and DELETE_NETWORK_CONDITIONS doesn't presented is Java client  ## Real world value Simulating of weak/slow connection became possible with built-in browser capabilities instead of third party solutions.  ## Description ChromeDriver sources contain browser-specific commands that are not supported in Selenium Java client. They can be found here: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/41f6892aa7564234093ebbcea765990febf495e8/chrome/test/chromedriver/client/command_executor.py and here: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/41f6892aa7564234093ebbcea765990febf495e8/chrome/test/chromedriver/client/chromedriver.py  Similar implementation was done in https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/commit/1b6febddd2986449aac5a957c85a9cb8903651dc

column3: Firefox and IE won't allow popup notification to dissapear (Edge and Chrome works)
column4: ## Meta OS:   Windows 10 Selenium Version:   C# bindings 3.3.0 Browser:    Internet Explorer, Firefox  Browser Version:   Firefox 49.0.2623.87 (64-bit)  ## Expected Behavior Notification bar should close after 5~6 seconds as it happens on Chrome and Edge ## Actual Behavior The notification Never Closes ## Steps to reproduce [TestMethod]     public void TestMethod1()     {       //var driver = new ChromeDriver();       var driver = new FirefoxDriver();       //var driver = new InternetExplorerDriver();       driver.Navigate().GoToUrl("http://demo.nopcommerce.com");       driver.Manage().Window.Maximize();        var button = driver.FindElementByCssSelector         ("[data-productid=\"18\"] input[value=\"Add to cart\"]");        button.Click();       // green bar on top appears but doesn't go away       var wait = new WebDriverWait(driver, TimeSpan.FromSeconds(10));       wait.Until(         ExpectedConditions.ElementIsVisible(By.CssSelector("#bar-notification")));       wait.Until(         ExpectedConditions.InvisibilityOfElementLocated(By.CssSelector("#bar-notification")));        driver.Quit();     }

column3: Can't add firefox web-extension to profile
column4: ## Meta OS:   Windows 10 Selenium Version:   3.0.1 Browser:   Firefox 50 Language: C# (dotnet)  ## Problem I can't add firefox web-extension (https://developer.mozilla.org/en/Add-ons/WebExtensions) for Firefox Driver. The extension is signed by AMO.  ## Code: ``` var options = new FirefoxOptions();     var profile = new FirefoxProfile();     profile.AddExtension("MyExtension.xpi");     options.Profile = profile;     var firefoxDriver = new FirefoxDriver(options);  ```  ## Error: ```   Could not find file 'C:\Users\TestUser\AppData\Local\Temp\anonymous.9da76164678e4f169142c80ccccebc4c.webdriver-profile.staging\MyExtension.xpi\install.rdf'.    at System.IO.__Error.WinIOError(Int32 errorCode, String maybeFullPath)    at System.IO.FileStream.Init(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, Int32 rights, Boolean useRights, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize, FileOptions options, SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES secAttrs, String msgPath, Boolean bFromProxy, Boolean useLongPath, Boolean checkHost)    at System.IO.FileStream..ctor(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize)    at System.Xml.XmlDownloadManager.GetStream(Uri uri, ICredentials credentials, IWebProxy proxy, RequestCachePolicy cachePolicy)    at System.Xml.XmlUrlResolver.GetEntity(Uri absoluteUri, String role, Type ofObjectToReturn)    at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.OpenUrlDelegate(Object xmlResolver)    at System.Threading.CompressedStack.runTryCode(Object userData)    at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RuntimeHelpers.ExecuteCodeWithGuaranteedCleanup(TryCode code, CleanupCode backoutCode, Object userData)    at System.Threading.CompressedStack.Run(CompressedStack compressedStack, ContextCallback callback, Object state)    at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.OpenUrl()    at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.Read()    at System.Xml.XmlLoader.Load(XmlDocument doc, XmlReader reader, Boolean preserveWhitespace)    at System.Xml.XmlDocument.Load(XmlReader reader)    at System.Xml.XmlDocument.Load(String filename)    at OpenQA.Selenium.Firefox.FirefoxExtension.ReadIdFromInstallRdf(String root) ``` ## PS Firefox web-extension don't use update\install rdf file for updating\installing.

column3: WebDriverException on set_page_load_timeout()
column4: ## Meta OS:   Linux Selenium Version:   3.3.1 with Python  Browser:   Firefox, using geckodriver 0.15.0 Browser Version:   52.0  ## Expected Behavior - Create a client and set page timeout.  ## Actual Behavior - A WebDriverException is thrown (without any message): ``` Traceback (most recent call last):   File "test.py", line 5, in      client.set_page_load_timeout(120)   File "/home/jack/git/flask-prismfp/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py", line 727, in set_page_load_timeout     'pageLoad': int(float(time_to_wait) * 1000)})   File "/home/jack/git/flask-prismfp/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py", line 238, in execute     self.error_handler.check_response(response)   File "/home/jack/git/flask-prismfp/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selenium/webdriver/remote/errorhandler.py", line 193, in check_response     raise exception_class(message, screen, stacktrace) selenium.common.exceptions.WebDriverException: Message:  ```  ## Steps to reproduce - from selenium import webdriver prof = webdriver.FirefoxProfile() client = webdriver.Firefox(prof) client.set_page_load_timeout(120)  The above seems to work correctly with version 3.3.0, with all other aspects of the environment the same.

column3: Unable to set geckodriver log level
column4: ## Meta  Selenium 3.0.1 - Java Firefox 49.0.2 - geckodriver 11.0.1 ## Issue  I'd like to set log level for geckodriver, which is DEBUG by default. Mozilla says we have to set `{moz:firefoxOptions: {log: {level: }}}` but I can't get it working in java.  I tried this:  ```         FirefoxOptions options = new FirefoxOptions();         options.addPreference("log", "{level: info}");         // also tried:         options.addPreference("log.level", "info");         desiredCapabilities.setCapability("moz:firefoxOptions", options); ```  Selenium throws an exception if `options`is not instanceof FirefoxOptions, and options.addPreference accepts only String, integer or boolean as second parameter, not dictionnary. So how to set properly Log option ?  Thank your for your help,  Linked Issue @Mozilla: https://github.com/mozilla/geckodriver/issues/152

column3: Getting `SocketError: getaddrinfo: Name or service not known`
column4: ## Meta  OS: Linux CentOS (`centos-release-6-8.el6.centos.12.3.x86_64`) Selenium Version: `3.0.0` Browser: PhantomJS Browser Version: `2.1.1.1` ## Problem  I have both `selenium-webdriver` and `phantomjs`:  ``` $ gem list # removed irrelevant entries phantomjs-binaries (2.1.1.1) selenium-webdriver (3.0.0) ```  And I get a `SocketError: getaddrinfo: Name or service not known` error when trying to call the latter with the former:  ``` ruby irb> require 'selenium-webdriver' => true irb> browser = Selenium::WebDriver.for(:phantomjs) SocketError: getaddrinfo: Name or service not known     from /home2/username/_mydirectory/ruby/gems/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/platform.rb:175:in `getaddrinfo'     from /home2/username/_mydirectory/ruby/gems/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/platform.rb:175:in `localhost'     from /home2/username/_mydirectory/ruby/gems/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/service.rb:43:in `initialize'     from /home2/username/_mydirectory/ruby/gems/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/phantomjs/bridge.rb:34:in `new'     from /home2/username/_mydirectory/ruby/gems/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/phantomjs/bridge.rb:34:in `initialize'     from /home2/username/_mydirectory/ruby/gems/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/driver.rb:66:in `new'     from /home2/username/_mydirectory/ruby/gems/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/driver.rb:66:in `for'     from /home2/username/_mydirectory/ruby/gems/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.0/lib/selenium/webdriver.rb:82:in `for'     from (irb):4     from /home2/username/_mydirectory/ruby/bin/irb:11:in `'    ```  As far as I can gather, a similar class of errors occurs commonly due to a wrong mapping of `localhost` to `127.0.0.1` in `/etc/hosts`.  In this case, this error is occurring on a shared hosting (so I have limited privileges) and there is no `/etc/hosts` (Iâ€™ve contacted support and they told me that is expected for shared accounts). The mapping seems to be correct, anyway:  ``` $ host localhost localhost has address 127.0.0.1 localhost has IPv6 address ::1 ```  ---  If I install an older version of `selenium-webdriver` (specifically version `2.46.2`), it hangs indefinitely instead of outputting the error.  ---  I also found https://github.com/seleniumhq/selenium-google-code-issue-archive/issues/4020 while looking for a resolution. For the command `ruby -rsocket -e 'p IPSocket.getaddress(Socket.gethostname)'`, the output is the correct IP address for the server.  As for `ruby -r selenium-webdriver -e 'p Selenium::WebDriver::Platform.interfaces'`, I get:  ``` ruby /home2/username/_mydirectory/ruby/gems/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/platform.rb:198:in `getaddrinfo': getaddrinfo: Name or service not known (SocketError)     from /home2/username/_mydirectory/ruby/gems/gems/selenium-webdriver-3.0.0/lib/selenium/webdriver/common/platform.rb:198:in `interfaces'     from -e:1:in `' ```  ---  Again, this is a shared hosting, _but_ on this exact shared hosting (though with a different account) just a few weeks ago this was working. Unfortunately, I donâ€™t have access to that old account anymore to check the exact versions of the installed gems, but I tried a huge combination of versions and nothing seems to work.  Running `phantomjs` by itself runs fine, hence why Iâ€™m submitting here.

column3: Mozilla Firefox cannot be programmatically closed after Selenium update
column4: ## Meta  OS:  Windows 10 Home x64 (10.0.14393.0) Selenium Version:  3.3.1 Browser:  Mozilla Firefox 5.0.1  ## Expected Behavior  Firefox should close when `driver.close()` is called.  ## Actual Behavior  Firefox (FF) does not close when `driver.close()` is called. Attempted to reinstall FF and upgrade Selenium, but the issue persists. This worked yesterday with the same version of FF, but no longer seems to work properly after executing `pip install -U selenium`. Other Selenium functions seem to work as intended with the exception of closing the browser, which must be closed manually. Also verified that I am using the latest Selenium Gecko webdriver.  ## Steps to reproduce  ```python from selenium import webdriver ff = webdriver.Firefox() ff.close() ```

column3: Webelement.Click() - Getting exception on Webelement.Click() though it clicks the Element
column4: ## Meta  OS:  Windows Selenium Version:  2.53.1.0  IDE: Visual Studio 2013 Browser:  Internet Explorer 11 version 11.420  I am getting an exception when i tried to click an element on webpage. This happens when a link is clicked and it opens a dialog. Webelement.click() function clicks the element and the modal dialog is opened but Click() takes time to return and finally logs exception as '**The HTTP request to the remote WebDriver server for URL "" timed out after 60 seconds.'** ## Expected Behavior -  ```    It should click the "Firefox Beta" download button and "IE tool bar" with RUN and SAVE option will appear ``` ## Actual Behavior -  It clicks the "Firefox Beta" download button and "IE tool bar" is coming. **But downloadElement.Click() waits for 60 seconds and throws exception**. ## Steps to reproduce -  **Below is code snippet:**        string url = "**https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/channel/#beta**";             try             {                 IWebDriver driver = new InternetExplorerDriver();                 driver.Navigate().GoToUrl(url);                   Thread.Sleep(5000);                 IWebElement downloadElement = driver.FindElement(By.XPath("//div[@id='download-   button-desktop-beta']/ul/li/a/strong"));                   Thread.Sleep(5000);                   downloadElement.Click();             }             catch{}

column3: Selenium Slowdown with Multiple Tests and the Need to avoid Grid
column4: ## Meta  OS:  Linux Ubuntu Xenial 16.04 RAM: 11g CPU: 8 cores  Code Base: Scala/Java Hardware: Dell Laptop Browser: Firefox 45 ESR and Firefox 49.0 and Chrome 53+ Selenium: 3.0 beta 4 ## Update  I may have discovered where the issue lies using chrome driver.   The page hangs when I call in Scala or Java:  var options = new ChromeOptions() ... options.addArguments("----proxy-server=proxy:port") // the only way I can get proxies to work is with only options browser.get("https://sors.doc.state.ok.us/svor/f?p=119:1:")  I then proceed to perform a  search and loop through the terms. It takes about 8 hours for complete and irreversible destruction to occur. With no OOM, way less then the given heap size reported by htop, and 25 % CPU, the error is likely in part of the pipeline (See my update).  The same error happens without a proxy. I am running with both incognito and non-incognito browsers as well as practically no cache size and most memory related features disabled. I tried with just a default chrome options as well.  The output stalls at the following:  Starting ChromeDriver 2.24.417424 (c5c5ea873213ee72e3d0929b47482681555340c3) on port 19899 Only local connections are allowed. Oct 12, 2016 1:37:40 PM org.openqa.selenium.remote.ProtocolHandshake createSession INFO: Attempting bi-dialect session, assuming Postel's Law holds true on the remote end Oct 12, 2016 1:37:40 PM org.openqa.selenium.remote.ProtocolHandshake createSession INFO: Detected dialect: OSS  With xvfb, I cannot see anything but when I run the 'test' or crawl without xvfb, the tool is stuck in an infinite loop trying to obtain the page data: before getting the specified url. Firefox stalls in the same way as well.  I set a pageLoadTimeout but never see an error for this. The timeout is between 30 and 240 seconds but never appears. At times, however, it will, and the tests can continue.  ## Expected Behavior  Running tests and crawls for thousands of terms completes using a rotating list of proxies utilizing xvfb. The specified temp directory is used. Not seeing a million empty GeckoChildDriverCrash files. ## Actual Behavior  A general slowdown occurs, freezing the system after 100 or so tests, 1-3 at a time, with rotating proxies no proxies. The specified temp directory is never used for Firefox files whether they are for the rust profiles or crash logs. I see one crash log per source which is manageable via rm -rf in the /tmp folder.  No java heap space leak was detected as memory usage denoted from the jvisualvm was consistently near 1g and CPU usage only maxed out around 70% for 3 proceses and 25% for 1 which is much better than for the previous Selenium version. Luckily, the files in /tmp now delete reliably but when things crash the number of rust profiles grows as I cannot just delete anything in /tmp with multiple jobs running from time to time.  ## Steps to reproduce - Set xmx at 5g of which 2g is the most utilized even if I toy with heap space percentages. - Fork a new slave process up to a specified number or the number of CPU cores with xvfb-run -a [options] jar [jar] [args] and setup the process - Setup a new browser with proxy set in capabilities and a firefox profile with proxy and performance enhancing options such as no color management and no update downloading. I checked the options and everything sets up fine. Use the path to the desired /tmp file from the args. I enable webgl via firefox options to avoid certain errors apparently related to xvfb but this does not seem to be a problem as the same issue happens when I do not enable webgl. The browser is set to not cache anything. All SSL certificates are normally allowed with expect untrusted certifications sometimes set. - Create a firefox browser using the DesiredCapabilities - Run through the system using Apache Http Components where possible if this is a crawl or logging output for QA. Run javascript as necessary. The tests / scrapes attain 500 pages on average. - exit with the quit() command - clean out the GeckoChildDriver crash logs from /tmp, return exit status and code via Future to the main loop  I manage the processes in Scala using Futures and execute with Apache Command Exec so I can set a timeout. The processes work fine at first but the performance degrades over time.  The overall goal is to be able to incorporate everything with Apache Mesos to develop a large test system as well as a large streaming Acquisition + Scrape System. My selenium based acquisition code is available at https://github.com/asevans48/GoatGrazerSelenium where a general overview of the entire project can be found. The code works and can be used to solve any underlying problems if you wish as it is under a GPL license.  As there is only an empty crash log and no errors, there really is nothing to attach. The only useful information would be that crawlers and testers slow down to 1/100 of the time they first took despite no caching, decent network connectivity, and no detectable Java heap space problems.  Overall, great job as I hate messing with the very buggy JavaFX and increasingly outdated webkit of PyQt but this problem is really killing the progress made with the tool for me. I did see an eventual inclusion of a web engine in Qt though.

column3: selenium.common.exceptions.WebDriverException: Message: 'geckodriver' executable may have wrong permissions.
column4: ## Firefox Version 52.0.2  ## Platform Linux Mint - Rebecca Python - 2.7.6 Selenium - 3.3.3 Geckodriver - 0.15.0  Guys, I am getting the above error when trying to run the following script :-  ``` import time   from selenium import webdriver from selenium.webdriver.firefox.firefox_binary import FirefoxBinary from selenium.webdriver.common.desired_capabilities import DesiredCapabilities from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC from selenium.common.exceptions import TimeoutException, \     ElementNotVisibleException   binary = FirefoxBinary(r'/usr/local/bin/firefox')  caps = DesiredCapabilities.FIREFOX.copy()  caps['marionette'] = True   def init_driver():     driver = webdriver.Firefox(firefox_binary=binary,                                capabilities=caps,                                executable_path=r'/usr/local/bin/geckodriver')     driver.wait = WebDriverWait(driver, 5)     return driver   def lookup(driver, query):     driver.get("http://www.google.com")     try:         box = driver.wait.until(EC.presence_of_element_located(             (By.NAME, "q")))         button = driver.wait.until(EC.element_to_be_clickable(             (By.NAME, "btnK")))         box.send_keys(query)         try:             button.click()         except ElementNotVisibleException:             button = driver.wait.until(EC.visibility_of_element_located(                 (By.NAME, "btnG")))             button.click()     except TimeoutException:         print("Box or Button not found in google.com")   if __name__ == "__main__":     driver = init_driver()     lookup(driver, "Selenium")     time.sleep(5)     driver.quit() ``` I have followed all the steps described in this [post](http://askubuntu.com/questions/870530/how-to-install-geckodriver-in-ubuntu) but still it ain't working! Please help me with this!
